Compressed work week option: 1/2 day Fridays

Your Story.

The Data Engineering Manager is a lead role on the IT Data & Analytics (D&A) team and you are responsible for building, maintaining, and improving data infrastructure that enables delivering analytical insights for the organization. As part of a SAFe Agile team, you collaborate with Enterprise Architecture, Business Applications, and Analytics & Insights Team as well as internal stakeholders, cross-functional teams, and external vendors. Together, you deliver high-level strategies, tactical decisions, and hands-on execution of the governance, design, implementation, integration, and usage of data and tools that provide accurate, high-quality, high-performance data solutions needed for corporate decision-making capabilities. You manage a team of Data professionals including data engineers/architects, data management analysts, and other related analysts, developers, and scientists by providing coaching and development opportunities, as well as ensuring team resource levels and competencies support the needs of the larger D&A Agile team. Through collaboration and team leadership, you support the execution of data management and governance, data storage, data transformation, data analytics, data literacy, and data quality initiatives. You establish standards for ensuring accurate data collection, processing, modeling and analysis across the organization.


Your Passion. Our Culture.

At Sargento, you work for a company you believe in, with a family of people who believe in you. Our culture stems from a simple premise: Hire good people and treat them like family. At Sargento, you can make decisions based on how they affect people as well as the long-term health of our company. You will be encouraged to make a meaningful difference in the community, in the company and in your career. With diverse experiences and tools to learn and develop, you can transform your aspirations into reality. If you’re ready for the right place to belong and grow your career, you can find it here.


What You Do.

This role supports the development of a long-term tactical strategy supporting the Data & Analytics processes and solutions in collaboration with Strategy & Architecture team. This includes the development of skills, competencies, and talents needed from the Data Engineering Team to fulfill business requests and recommends resources required to achieve business outcomes in the Data & Analytics space. Must effectively collaborate and communicate with internal stakeholders, business leaders and cross-functional teams to understand the ongoing needs and priorities, evangelize enterprise data sharing and collaboration, and promote the enterprise-wide use of data and analytics.


Responsible for identifying, designing, and implementing internal process improvements and requirements for Data Integration, Data Management and Data Warehouse tools by meeting with internal stakeholders and IT colleagues to ensure their data and analytical needs will be or are being met. Ensure infrastructure is designed for greater scalability, optimizing data delivery, and automating manual processes. Tools may include but are not limited to SAP Business Objects, SAP HANA, cloud-based solutions such as Snowflake, Matillion, and others as business needs and available solutions emerge. Support the effort to select and implement new Data Engineering platforms and tool sets when needed, and refresh and expand existing solutions per business requirements.

Data Engineering Manager is ultimately responsible for the execution of the following tasks either by directly performing the functions or through delegation of tasks to his/her team members or a combination thereof. Data Engineering Team tasks include:


Develop data models for use in cloud-based data warehouse including metadata tables, views or related database structures.


Deliver data-related project artifacts including but not limited to data requirements, Entity/Relationship Diagrams, Data Dictionary, Data Profiling artifacts, data flow diagrams, Meta Data creation, and data sourcing plans.


Support the identification of data, verification of data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL/ELT) between multiple enterprise systems as well as any other potential third-party systems. Ensure any issues that arise during the ETL/ETL process are identified and resolved on a timely basis.


Design and perform data harmonization or normalization operations on appropriate operational data within the cloud data warehouse with appropriate documentation on required logic.


Research and develop process automation through the use of systematic processes or other methodology on the Data & Analytics platform.


Manage integrity checks for required master data and transaction data. Manage cleansing the data and formulating processes for ongoing data integrity verification to ensure data quality across enterprise data systems ingested into the Data & Analytics platform. Provide consulting to the Master Data Governance Team on best practices and processes.


Lead the analysis and scaling associated to system performance of the Enterprise Data & Analytics platform, and assist with consumption tracking metrics associated with platform tools to advise data performance run rates.


Effectively research new options and look for resolutions to existing Data & Analytics issues using the appropriate software Support Portal or Incident Reporting System.


As needed, perform testing of Data & Analytics systems during IT Disaster Recovery testing.


Support Enterprise Data & Analytics system upgrades and support package applications as well as any new product implementations from Data & Analytics perspective.


Maintain appropriate level of system or technical documentation of key Master Data & Data & Analytics processes


Partner with Master Data Governance and Data Governance operating teams to support development and continuous improvement of standards to ensure accurate data collection, processing, modeling and analysis. Coordinate the necessary training for stakeholders to ensure adherence to standards and facilitate high adoption of the tools.


As part of the D&A Agile team, support operations of the Data Engineering team to deliver all aspects of the data lifecycle including but not limited to architecture, storage, extract/load/transform (ETL/ELT), integration, and modeling supportive of analytics, reporting and visualization initiatives. Includes appropriate levels of system management, such as maintenance and security for deployed data, data management, and other data functions, including but not limited to SAP Business Objects, Snowflake, Matillion, and others as solutions evolve. Provide upskilling opportunities for team members as needs and technology progress.


Provide support for leadership updates regarding in Data & Analytics projects and Short Work to ensure complete and comprehensive adherence to requirements gathering and documentation procedures, organizational change management activities, IT PMO/Agile processes, IT Production System Change Management procedures, and other applicable policies.


Work with senior IT leadership to support the development and execution of formal Information Technology department objectives aligned with Corporate objectives. Support development and monitoring of relevant budget items and staffing levels within the Data Engineering area. When external products or services are required, evaluate, negotiate, and recommend contracts with providers.


SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

May directly supervise both supervisory and non-supervisory employees on the Data & Analytics Team including consultants as needed.




Your Education and Experience.

Bachelor's degree from a four-year college or university in a relevant field.
Minimum of five or more years of IT and business industry work experience of which two or more years include direct experience working with Data Engineering tools; some SAP preferred.
Experience managing teams and influencing management and key stakeholders is preferred. Experience in managing resources to meet goals across multiple initiatives is preferred.
Working knowledge of IT service management and IT project management principles.
Experience working in a SAFe Agile environment a plus.


Qualifications


Must have strong communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences at the highest levels of corporate management. Exceptional analytical, written, oral, and presentation skills with proven track record of effectively communicating actionable insights.


Requires deep expertise of data models(s), business area(s), or process(es) within the current areas of responsibility as well as strong understanding of related systems. Advanced skills in analytics and the ability to convert data from a raw form to a different format using data modeling techniques. Demonstrable experience in enforcing data standards, resolving end-to-end data issues, data design issues and end to end data test issues. Ability to lead business collaboration to diagnose or do research to recommend complex data solutions.


Working knowledge of IT infrastructure, various technologies/platforms relevant to enterprise applications and data sources, and current vendor solutions in the Data & Analytics space.


Ability to understand problems from a broad perspective and anticipate the impact of issues and solutions. Ability to negotiate for mutually beneficial outcomes.


Benefits that set us apart.

Comprehensive medical including Fertility, Adoption benefits, Dental, and Vision Insurance

Hybrid work schedule – Onsite Tuesday – Thursday with the option to work remotely Monday and Friday
Compressed work week – Option of ½ day Friday
Onsite Health & Wellness Center: includes a nurse practitioner, licensed physical therapist, dietitian, personal trainer, and health coach, care coordinator and work-life mentor
Extraordinary Employer 401K contribution which includes Profit Sharing Plan

Our Story.

With over 2,000 employees and net sales of $1.5 billion, Sargento Foods is a family-owned company that has been a leader in cheese for more than 65 years. We created the world’s first, successful pre-packaged sliced and shredded natural cheeses. Sargento is based in Plymouth, Wisconsin, where we manufacture and market shredded, sliced and snack natural cheese products, as well as ingredients and sauces. Sargento is known for the exceptional quality of our products and for product design, packaging and merchandising innovations that have transformed our industry.

To learn more about our culture and values, please visit our website at https://careers.sargento.com/us/en.

Job_title: Manager IS Analytics and Business Intelligence - FT - Days - IS Business Systems
Job_description:
El Camino Health is committed to hiring, retaining and growing the best and brightest professionals who will carry our mission and vision forward. We are proud of our reputation in the community: One built on compassion, innovation, collaboration and delivering high-quality care. Come join the team that makes this happen.
Applicants MUST apply for position(s) by submitting a separate application for each individual job posting number they are interested in being considered for.
FTE
1
Scheduled Bi-Weekly Hours
80
Work Shift
Day: 8 hours
Job Description
Lead the development of reporting, data warehousing, and analytics solutions for Epic, Workday, ServiceNow, and other application systems at El Camino Health. Oversee a team of report writers, analysts, and business intelligence engineers in the development of clinical, operational, and financial data solutions for the health system. Drive innovation in analytics for the organization through effective resource management. Implement strategies to support data governance, data visualization, security, and analytical solutions. Lead the use of modern data science, predictive modeling, machine learning (Python). Present decisions to leaders at all levels from clinicians to executives leading high visibility committees and projects. Most of the Manager’s time is spent on project management, analytics strategy, process development, and team management.
Duties may include: managing design services, providing configuration assistance, performing needs assessments, analyzing current business practices, as well as identifying future business opportunities for leveraging data storage and retrieval system capabilities. Manage relationships with software and hardware vendors to understand the potential impact of different vendor strategies. Ensure the development of proper training and documentation for enterprise-wide technical architecture, systems use, maintenance, planning, and integration of next-generation technologies into the analytics strategy. Selects, develops and evaluates personnel to ensure the efficient operation of the team.
Other duties as assigned.
Key Responsibilities
Management of a team of data analysts, report developers, and business intelligence engineers.
Lead strategies for data architecture, ETL development, extracts, and coordinate with outside vendors.
Project management of key organization initiatives around data use, analytics, extracts, regulatory reporting, and warehousing.
Oversee the development of dashboards, reports, security, and other related tools with a focus on Epic Cogito.
Develop analytics capabilities for the organization around predictive modeling, data warehousing, forecasting, and data science.
Share their understanding of the analytics ecosystem and enhance data literacy for the organization.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree with 4 years related work experience or Master’s degree in related field with 2 years related work experience. Degree in information technology, business or health care preferred.
Minimum of 2 years of experience directly managing a team of report developers, business intelligence engineers, and/or data scientists with responsibility for their performance and career development.
Ability to communicate effectively with employees from all levels within the organization, including senior management.
Project management, process leadership experience, ability to lead meetings, conflict resolution, and delegation.
Knowledgeable, experienced and accountable for data warehouse, visualization tools and analytics platforms in a hospital setting.
Strong understanding of transactional, operational, and dimensional data models.
Demonstrates robust capabilities in the areas of dashboards and balanced scorecards supporting lines of business, strategic goals, and business operations.
Experience with Epic Cogito, SQL, and Tableau.
Proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Experience with Visio, flow diagrams, Smartsheets, ServiceNow, and SharePoint is preferred. Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills.
Must be able to learn, understand, and apply new technologies.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment is crucial.
Moderate to expert levels of knowledge around IT and healthcare sector concepts and trends.
License/Certification/Registration Requirements
Certification in one or more Epic modules preferred.
Salary Range:
76.61 - 114.91 USD Hourly
The Physical Requirements and Working Conditions of this job are available. El Camino Health will provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with a disability if that will allow them to perform the essential functions of a job unless doing so creates an undue hardship for the hospital, or causes a direct threat to these individuals or others in the workplace which cannot be eliminated by reasonable accommodation.
Sedentary Work - Duties performed mostly while sitting; walking and standing at times. Occasionally lift or carry up to 10 lbs. Uses hands and fingers. - (Physical Requirements-United States of America)
An Equal Opportunity Employer:
El Camino Health seeks and values a diverse workforce. The organization is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of qualifications and competencies. El Camino Health prohibits discrimination in employment based on race, ancestry, national origin, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, marital status, age, medical condition or any other status protected by law. In addition to state and federal law, El Camino Health also follows all applicable fair and equitable employment policies from the County of Santa Clara.

Join a Legacy of Innovation 110 Years and Counting!

Daiichi Sankyo Group is dedicated to the creation and supply of innovative pharmaceutical therapies to improve standards of care and address diversified, unmet medical needs of people globally by leveraging our world-class science and technology. With more than 100 years of scientific expertise and a presence in more than 20 countries, Daiichi Sankyo and its 15,000 employees around the world draw upon a rich legacy of innovation and a robust pipeline of promising new medicines to help people. Under the Group’s 2025 Vision to become a “Global Pharma Innovator with Competitive Advantage in Oncology,” Daiichi Sankyo is primarily focused on providing novel therapies in oncology, as well as other research areas centered around rare diseases and immune disorders.
Summary
The purpose of this job is to provide statistical programming technical support to DSI project teams on all statistical programming deliverables and programming submission. It will also improve Daiichi Sankyo programming efficiency by developing tools and macros and build up standard on SDTM/ADaM datasets, and TFLs.
Responsibilities
Supporting project lead on outsourced projects, act as statistical programming subject matter expert (SME) to support outsourced programming activities and be responsible for the programming technical decision. By guiding other internal programmer or by self, perform programmatic review of Study Date Tabulation Model (SDTM) and analysis (including Analysis Data Model (ADaM)) datasets as well as TLFs generated by statistical vendor, ensure correct and effective vendor programming implementation, and expedite the preparation of regulatory submissions. Responsibilities include: make strategic programming decision and planning, review Case Report Form (CRF) annotation and SDTM dataset, identify data inconsistencies and support data review, review analysis dataset specifications and ensure correct interpretation of SAP, develop independent programs to validate stud level analysis dataset and TLFs generated by vendor, ensure analysis dataset in compliance with CDISC and submission requirement, review study submission data package and ensure its quality and integrity.
Provide hands-on statistical programming support to regulatory submission and help submission team in quick turnaround in response to regulatory agencies. Responsibilities include: develop programming submission strategy, perform integrated analysis of efficacy and safety, generate submission data package, create TLFs to support submission Q&As, perform ad-hoc and exploratory analysis requested by clinical team, and support agency response or potential Advisory Committee Meeting
Develop DSI programming standard template on datasets and TFLs to improve efficiency and quality. Responsibilities include: contribute to CRF and SDTM standard development, develop, implement, and maintain SDTM, ADaM dataset and TLF standard, develop sample programs to generate and validate SDTM, ADaM dataset and TLFs, support technical training and ensure effective implementation of SDTM, ADaM and TLFs standard in clinical trial data analysis
Develop and maintain necessary programming macros or tools to effectively support all programming needs. Responsibilities include: identify the macros or tools that will facilitate programing efficiency, lead the macro or tool development by working with contractors or by self, and support the macro or tool implementation and maintenance
Evaluate, assess and enhance DSI computing environment system. Responsibilities include: continue assessing DSI new computing environment system for programming and analysis efficiency, identify system bug/issue and lead the activity to enhance the system, develop system training materials and work as the SME to support implementation, evaluate, request and approve system upgrades, and propose/develop system utilities
Qualifications: Successful candidates will be able to meet the qualifications below with or without a reasonable accommodation.
Education Qualifications (from an accredited college or university)
Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution in a technical field such as computer science or mathematics; preferred
Master's Degree in biostatistics preferred
Experience Qualifications
10 or More Years proven experience within pharmaceutical industry, or CROs supporting statistical analysis of clinical trials programming preferred
7 or More Years proven experience within pharmaceutical industry, or CROs supporting statistical analysis of clinical trials programming with Masters degree preferred
Previous experience supporting SAS macro and/or system utility development preferred
Advanced working knowledge of all aspects of the SAS programming language used in clinical trials programming preferred
Advanced working knowledge of CDISC SDTM and ADaM, and extensive experiences of their implementation in clinical trials analysis preferred
Advanced understanding of statistical concepts in support of analyses and reporting of clinical trials preferred
Knowledge of all phases of drug development, including early and late phase clinical development and submission preferred
Solid background in applied statistics preferred
Solid knowledge of new advanced statistical methods using SAS and R preferred
Advanced knowledge in database structures and set-up preferred
Daiichi Sankyo, Inc. is an equalopportunity/affirmativeaction employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job Description:

SQL Database QA/QC Manager – Laramie, WY

Trihydro, one of the top environmental and engineering consulting firms in the country, has an opening for a SQL database QA/QC manager. The role is a part of our Air and Process Services Team and assists with reviewing and analyzing leak detection and repair (LDAR) data and extending data with third-party sources. If you have database experience and enjoy working with collaborative teams, we encourage you to apply.
As a SQL database QA/QC manager, you will work with the LDAR QA/QC team to use different software applications, regularly use SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS), and read and understand environmental air quality regulations to assess data accuracy and quality. You will also serve as a liaison for routine and ad-hoc data reporting requests and provide first-line-of-support LDAR software help desk functions.
The preferred candidate will be based in our Laramie, WY office. However, remote options may be considered.
We are looking for someone who has:
Extensive experience with SSMS and ad-hoc query writing
Experience formulating efficient T-SQL queries, views, and stored procedures to prepare data reports
The ability to read, understand, and verify data in a variety of formats
A knack for business process improvement to keep pace with an evolving industry
Proficiency in Microsoft Office programs such as Excel, Word, and Outlook
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Attention to detail and accuracy
Time management and organization skills
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills to interact effectively with team members
Positive employment history with a demonstrated commitment to safe work practices
Dependable work practices with the ability to excel in a team environment
This job is for you if:
You desire career-growth opportunities and are interested in playing an integral role in a growing team and company.
You value working with others to achieve goals that make a difference to our clients and our communities.
You assume ownership of your work and take pride in producing high-quality deliverables.
At Trihydro, our approach to work is professional, honest, and dedicated. You’ll find a company culture that is committed to excellence, nurtures collaboration and growth, and still finds plenty of time for fun—often outdoors. Some of the benefits of joining our team include:
Comprehensive health insurance (medical, dental, vision, and prescription)
401(k) retirement plan, including a discretionary 6% match by Trihydro
Generous paid time off including vacation, flex, sick, holiday, and paid family leave
Wellness program, including reimbursement for a gym membership or related expenses
Staff mentoring and opportunities for professional growth
Trihydro is humbled to have received an honorable mention in Outside Magazine’s “Best Places to Work” list. Our 500+ professionals work on meaningful environmental and engineering projects that make a difference for clients and communities. Trihydro’s offices extend from Alaska to Florida, and our team members live and work within minutes of outdoor recreation. As a team of geologists, engineers, ecologists, and scientists, our culture is rooted in a love for the outdoors.

We are seeking a talented Data Warehouse Architect to join our technology team in Santa Ana, CA. This is a full-time position with a high growth organization!

We are seeking a Data Warehouse Architect who can build a data warehouse solution themselves; this is a doer position from the technical side. As a member of the Optima Financial Groups Data Office, the Data Architect is a hands-on individual contributor role responsible for aligning and executing the future state of the Cloud Data Architecture with Data Management strategy. This role collaborates with solutions architects and subject matter experts from project management and IT areas. Must also be able to communicate effectively, including working with the BI team.

Essential Duties:

Must be able to build a data warehouse from scratch
Assist in the development and implementation in the areas of Data Quality, Data Profiling, Data Governance, and Data Integration as part of Optimas Data Management Strategy
Conduct and advise on data product/platform reviews and evaluations, identify gaps and offer recommendations.
Work with key stakeholders across internal groups to develop and communicate the data vision and roadmap while adhering to established Data Management principles.
Manage expectations around data deliverables, define the definition of done and coordinate deployment and delivery with members of the Agile teams.
Other duties as assigned.
In order to be provided the essential training required to be successful in this role, it is mandatory that you are present for and complete all essential/initial training onsite for up to 5 business days (unless prior management approval is provided). Please note that additional onsite training may be required depending on business need.

Qualifications

Bachelors degree, or masters degree in Computer Science, or applicable field of study
5-8 years of hands-on experience in data architecture principles, methods, techniques, and technologies
Hands-on with Cloud data warehouse technologies - Snowflake, Streamset, or similar.
Experience in Agile development methodology.
Exposure to cloud environments (especially AWS) and Hybrid Workloads experience with developing cloud data strategies, best practices, and standards.
Experience with modern data pipelines, data streaming, and using real-time analytics tools.
Demonstrated ability to balance architectural theory with practical solutions
Expert-level technical understanding of data modeling, design, and architectural principals across master data, transaction data, and derived/analytic data
Expert-level knowledge of data management tools, including enterprise repository tools, data modeling tools, data quality tools, data mapping tools, and data profiling tools
Deep knowledge of best practices through relevant experience across data-related disciplines and technologies, with a focus on enterprise-wide data architectures, data management, data governance, and data warehousing
Proven background of designing and implementing architecture which solves strategic and tactical business needs
Strong conceptual knowledge of roles and responsibilities within BI and Data Warehousing (DA, ETL, BI, DBA, SE, QA, and PM)
Expert knowledge and demonstrable experience with either Azure SQL Data Warehouse or Redshift
Experience using Machine Learning technologies in the areas of Data Quality, Metadata Management, Data Lineage, etc.
Detail-oriented and organized. Ability to manage multiple projects and task concurrently.
Proficient in programming languages: PL/SQL, SQL.
Knowledge of C#, Tableau is a plus.

Job_title: Actuarial Data Scientist II - Personal Auto (Hybrid)
Job_description:
At American Family Insurance, we believe people are an organization’s most valuable asset, and their ideas and experiences matter. From our CEO to our agency force, we’re committed to growing a diverse and inclusive culture that empowers innovation that will inspire, protect, and restore our customers’ dreams in ways never imagined.


American Family Insurance is driven by our customers and employees. That’s why we provide more than just a job – we provide opportunity. Whether you’re already part of our team in search of a new challenge or new to our company and ready for what’s next, you’re in the right place. Every dream is a journey that starts with a single step. Start your journey right here. Join our team. Bring your dreams.

Job ID:
R30594 Actuarial Data Scientist II - Personal Auto (Hybrid) (Open)

Compensation may vary based on the job level and your geographic work location.

Compensation Minimum:$90,200 Annual

Compensation Maximum:$144,500 Annual

Summary:

American Family Insurance Auto Center of Excellence (CoE) Predictive Analytics team is looking for an experienced actuarial data scientist to help support and enhance our Auto and Specialty lines insurance pricing.

Prior experience creating insurance pricing models a big plus. Candidates with actuarial and/or data science experience are encouraged to apply.

Data scientists in the Auto COE provide data-driven solutions to new and complex business problems, develop innovative strategies, and monitor/adjust solutions based on changing markets and future trends. They apply and integrate statistical, mathematical, predictive modeling and business analysis skills to manage and manipulate complex high volume data from a variety of sources. You will collaborate closely with business teams (product, state management, actuarial) and the Data Engineering teams to build modeling pipeline, iteratively enhance model performance, and share out results to stakeholders.

Job Profile Summary
Develops, analyzes and models operational, economic, management, accounting and other organizational data to quantify the competitive performance of business segments, evaluate potential operational changes, and design new approaches and methodologies. Analyzes organizational data to recommend solutions to new and complex problems, develops innovative strategies, quantifies the competitive performance of the organization's operations and/or markets; models and evaluates the potential impact of changes. Applies and integrates statistical, mathematical, predictive modeling and business analysis skills to manage and manipulate complex high volume data from a variety of sources.

Job Description:

Responsibilities:

Explores data using a variety of statistical techniques to proactively identify relationships, creates insights and answers business questions or guides future model development
Translates business needs into viable predictive modeling solutions and brings new and innovative ideas or approaches
Identifies proper model structure and statistical measurement to support various hypothesis testing
Incorporates findings and provides industry and competitor insights as part of model development and enhancement
Writes clean and production ready code that can be easily maintained and leveraged by engineering and IT teams
Builds and tests models and investigates areas for future improvement with minimal guidance
Participates in Team's Agile ceremonies (sprint planning, retrospective, demo)
Translates quantitative analyses into business friendly visuals for non-technical audience, present model findings by tailoring messages to various audiences
Supports actuarial and state management teams in state specific model customization, filing, and roll out
Provides sufficient model documentation
Collaborates with IT to bring models into production
Keeps abreast of latest relevant technologies and proposes new ones to the team

Travel Requirements

This position requires travel up to 10% of the time.

Specialized Knowledge and Skills Requirements

Demonstrated experience providing customer-driven solutions, support or service.
Ability to work as part of a team and to communicate effectively.
Proficiency in programming languages suitable for database access, scripting, statistical analysis, and system development. Understanding of software development best practices including source control, coding standards and testing frameworks.
Demonstrated experience formulating, approaching, and solving complex analytical problems using a quantitative, scientific approach.
Demonstrated experience working with large, complex datasets using big data technologies and script.
Solid knowledge and understanding managing data to scale using data summarization, query and analysis software and tools.

Education and Licenses

Preferred: Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Sciences or Engineering, or related field or equivalent experience.

Additional Job Information:

Prior experience creating insurance pricing models a big plus.

Depending on qualifications, candidates may be considered at different levels.

Offer to selected candidate will be made contingent on the results of applicable background checks.

Offer to selected candidate is contingent on signing a non-disclosure agreement for proprietary information, trade secrets, and inventions.

This position is a hybrid role that involves working a minimum of 10 days per month in the office. We know flexibility is important to our employees and their families, and we will continue to offer flexibility in this flex office/home role. This approach will guide us in balancing the needs of the business, customers and our employees.

Preferred locations for this role include:

Madison, WI; Chicago, IL; Boston, MA; Minneapolis, MN; Denver, CO; Phoenix, AZ; Nashville, TN; Atlanta, GA; Seattle, WA; Las Vegas, NV; St. Joseph, MO; Kansas City, MO; St. Louis, MO; Green Bay, WI; Milwaukee, WI; Akron, OH; Keene, NH; Jacksonville, FL

Other locations and remote work may be considered.

Internal candidates are encouraged to apply regardless of location and will be considered based upon the needs of the role.

#LI-Hybrid

When you work at American Family you can expect benefits that support your physical, emotional, and financial wellbeing. You will have access to comprehensive medical, dental, vision and wellbeing benefits that enable you to take care of your health. We also offer a competitive 401(k) contribution, a pension plan, an annual incentive, and a paid-time off program. In addition, our student loan repayment program and paid-family leave are available to support our employees and their families. Interns and contingent workers are not eligible for American Family Enterprise benefits.

We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

Direct Connect Logistix is a nation-wide 3PL company headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Since 2009, we have committed to our promise of delivering every shipment on time, every time - no matter what. That is why we hire the best people, inject tons of energy into our culture, and empower our people to make great things happen for our customers.


Job Summary
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced data engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our data lake and proprietary transportation management systems. You will work closely with the software development team and the data analytics team to ensure our systems are optimized to handle large data sets and provide the necessary information for decision making. The role requires a strong background in developing and connecting APIs and working with large data sets.


Key Responsibilities:


Design, develop and maintain our data lake, proprietary TMS and rating engine, and assist with other data-related projects
Design internal and external APIs
Create and maintain source to output data workflows
Manage data pipelines
Develop metadata management system
Manage a diverse set of data platforms both on prem and cloud
Work with the software development team to ensure the systems are optimized to handle large data sets
Work with the data analytics team to provide the necessary data for decision making
Create data models and develop data processing pipelines to ensure the accuracy and consistency of the data
Develop and implement ETL processes to integrate data from different sources
Monitor and maintain the data infrastructure to ensure data availability, data accuracy, and performance
Resolve database and access and performance issues
Develop maintain and change control of data stores
Test and maintain a testing protocol for data store modifications

Job Requirements


Education/Experience


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field
5+ years of experience in data engineering and software development
Strong experience in designing and building APIs using REST, SOAP, or GraphQL
Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases
Experience building a data lake
Working knowledge of views, stored procedures, and ETLs
Experience with data modeling techniques ODS/ Data Lake/ Analytical Stores
Experience working with finance and business units to develop metrics and dashboards
Experience in working with large data sets and distributed systems
Knowledge of data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL processes
Experience with data modeling tools (Erwin, Power Design)

Preferred Qualifications:


Experience working in the logistics or transportation industry.
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker
Business Process modelling
Familiarity with Python, Java, or Scala
Knowledge of cloud-based data storage and processing technologies such as AWS, Azure, or GCP
Experience working in an Agile environment

Skills Required


Qualified candidate must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills along with relationship-building, follow-up, and problem- solving skills.

Job_title: WORKFORCE ADMINISTRATION BUSINESS ANALYST (HYBRID) MULTIPLE OPENINGS
Job_description:
For UCOP internal applicants, please login to the internal candidate gateway at: Jobs at UCOP

Position Base
Riverside

Location
UCPath Center

UCPATH CENTER

At the University of California (UC), your contributions make a difference. A world leader producing Nobel and Pulitzer prize recipients with over 150 years of groundbreaking research transforming the world. Choose a career where you can leverage your knowledge, skills and aspirations to inspire and support some of the greatest minds in the world, and those who will follow in their footsteps. Working at the University of California is being part of a unique institution, and a vibrant and diverse community. At the University of California, Office of the President, we propel our mission through impactful work locally, in government centers and systemwide. We are passionate people, serving the greater good.

The University of California, one of the largest and most acclaimed institutions of higher learning in the world, is dedicated to excellence in teaching, research and public service. The University of California Office of the President is the headquarters to the 10 campuses, six academic medical centers and three national laboratories and enrolls premier students from California, the nation and the world. Learn more about the UC Office of the President

The UCPath Center is the University of California's shared services center in Riverside, CA. The UCPath Center manages the payroll, benefits, and other human resources transactions for more than 200,000 UC employees working across ten UC campuses, five medical centers, three national labs and more. The staff at the UCPath Center work in a variety of areas including business operations, customer service, quality management, technology, training, human resources and communications. Learn more about the UCPath Center

POSITION SUMMARY

Applies skills as a seasoned, experienced professional with a full understanding of industry-wide business process and analysis practices and organizational policies and procedures. Resolves a wide range of business process issues of moderate to complex scope. Demonstrates good judgment in selecting methods and techniques to obtain solutions.

Applies human resources (HR) and Workforce Administration (WFA) business process analysis, professional HR and Compensation concepts as well as department/unit and campus policies and procedures to resolve a variety of business process problems and to make recommendations for system and process improvement. Works on business process issues of moderate to complex scope where evaluation of processes, procedures and data requires analysis using a variety of factors.

Responsibilities

65%

SYSTEM SUPPORT, TESTING, AND CONFIGURATION


Works closely with other department members and ITSS to support the PeopleSoft Human Capital Management system for HR/ WFA related processes.


This position will serve as the UCPath Center subject matter expert (SME) for the Workforce Administration, Compensation Administration, Absence Management and Position Management modules within UCPath.


This position will also serve as UCPath Center SME for all HR, Leave of Absence and Compensation customizations and vendor processes.


Analyze processes and identify system discrepancies related to Primary Job Derivation, Paygroup assignment, Mass Compensation processing and other HR/ WFA related customized batch processes that run to no success or produce errors. Will review error logs and record system issues and develop and implement solutions.


Coordinates testing process for system changes to include scheduling test cycles with the appropriate parties, obtaining testers and applicable test database access, and translates business requirements into test cases. Executes testing according to testing plan and communicates results to required parties. Plans and executes unit integration and acceptance testing.


Coordinates and performs table and configuration maintenance within the HR/ WFA department modules and tables.


Use in-depth knowledge of HR/ WFA business processes and rules to communicate system needs and requirements.


Assists with data analysis to find trends or indications of potential issues and provides support for processing and troubleshooting changes within the UCPath system.


Creates and edits queries for data audits, testing validation and troubleshooting issues.


Assess new functionality as it is released and advise the UCPath Center leadership on the use of new functionality to improve business operations.


25%

BUSINESS AND SYSTEM ANALYSIS


Provides and applies technical expertise in identifying, evaluating and developing complex systems and procedures. Creates complex specifications for systems to meet end-user requirements. Involved in developing complex user interface designs. Plans and executes unit integration and acceptance testing.


Participates in cross-functional teams to address complex business or systems issues.


Identifies gaps in business processes and system functionality and works with the necessary parties to recommend and implement system changes.


Monitors policy and rate changes to update business process and system modifications to salary plan and grade tables, including the preparation of Business Requirement Documents. Gathers, analyzes, prepares and summarizes recommendations for approval of business process and procedural documentation. Recommends and implements changes in processes and procedures.


Stays current on configuration changes needed to implement upcoming mass wage implementations as well as salary plan, department and table requirements.


Creates and updates testing scripts when implementing enhancements and/or during the migration process for system defects.


Provides knowledge transfer to WFA Workstreams on business process and system changes.


Review existing business processes, assist operational groups with identifying inefficiencies, enhance quality control standards and recommend optimal solutions for process improvement.


Provides project management support between WFA teams and ITSS as required.


Creates, tracks, manages, and drives all business process defects to full resolution via workarounds and incidents. Uses internal tracking tools to maintain a current status of issues. Partners with ITSS department to ensure effective and timely resolution of all workarounds, change requests and incidents. Consults with WFA department supervisors and manager to ensure defects, workarounds, and incidents are managed according to specific business/process need.


5%

Gathers, analyzes, prepares and summarizes business and user needs, documenting requirements and revising existing system and process logic issues as necessary. Provides support and training on new applications. Guides and advises less-experienced Business Systems Analysts.


5%

Gathers, analyzes, prepares and summarizes recommendations for approval of business process and procedural documentation. Recommends and implements changes in processes and procedures. Negotiates with stakeholders on the creation of specifications.


Required Qualifications

A minimum of three (3) years of relevant HCM system experience or equivalent combination of education/experience.
Self-motivated and works independently and as part of a team. Able to learn independently and meet deadlines.
Ability to exercise critical judgment in defining and developing system requirements and implementing polices and processes. Ability to promote and implement changes to current practices and processes.
Ability to provide high quality work utilizing highly developed and effective communication, project management, time management and collaboration skills.
Demonstrated ability to work with others from diverse backgrounds.
Ability to prioritize, streamline and accomplish assigned projects. Ability to maintain flexibility and quickly address changing priorities.
Demonstrates advanced problem solving and analytical skills. Ability to accomplish assigned projects without compromising the integrity of the UCPath Center and/or University of California policies and procedures. Ability to think strategically and focus on the accomplishment of the UCPath Center mission and priorities.
Thorough knowledge of business processes and procedures.
Demonstrated testing and test planning expertise.
Demonstrated effective communication and interpersonal skills. Demonstrated ability to communicate technical information to technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organization. Interpersonal and communications skills to work with both technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organization.
Ability to appropriately handle confidential matters and material.
Preferred Qualifications

Has a thorough knowledge of modules in PeopleSoft related to Workforce Administration, Compensation Administration, Absence Management and Position Management. Understanding of the system structure and modifications and how they impact operations and business objectives.
Knowledge of UC personnel and payroll policies and procedures.
Experience with configuration rules and tables updates. Understanding of the interdependencies between PeopleSoft modules.
Experience and proficiency in the PeopleSoft HCM 9.2.
In depth knowledge of PeopleSoft Human Resources/ Workforce Administration, Absence Management, Position Management, and Compensation Administration Modules.
Education

Bachelor's degree in human resources, business administration, computer science, or related field.

SALARY AND BENEFITS

The University of California, Office of the President, is required to provide a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. This range takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to experience, skills, knowledge, abilities, education, licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs. It is not typical for an individual to be offered a salary at or near the top of the range for a position. The full salary range shows the growth potential for this position and the pay scale is the budgeted salary or hourly range that the University reasonably expects to pay for this position.

Job Title
Business Systems Analyst 3

Job Code
007584

Salary Grade
Grade 22

Payscale:
$84,000 - $96,200 – Salary offers are determined based on final candidate qualifications and experience.


Full Salary Range:
$68,500 - $123,900

Benefits: For information on the comprehensive benefits package offered by UCPath Center visit: Benefits of Working for UC

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

This position will work a hybrid schedule which includes a combination of working both onsite at the UCPath Center in Riverside and remote in California.

HOW TO APPLY

Please be prepared to attach a cover letter and resume with your application.

JOB CLOSE DATE

The position will be open until filled.

CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT

Background Check Process: Successful completion of a background check is required for this critical position. Background check process at UCOP

Smoke Free Work Environment: The University of California, Office of the President, is smoke & tobacco-free as of January 1, 2014. UC Smoke & Tobacco Free Policy

Upon hire into a UCOP position, you will be provided detailed instructions on how to comply with this policy including access to the COVID vaccination at no cost. New hires to UCOP who work onsite or will come onsite for any activities at a UCOP or other UC location must comply with this policy within 8 weeks after their start date. The policy allows for employees to request approval for an exception or deferral. UC COVID-19 Vaccine Policy

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age or protected veteran status. Dolls Kill is a global fashion brand that empowers everyone to celebrate their individuality. We currently have over 10 million social media followers including some of the most influential personalities in music, art, pop culture and fashion. We’re also backed by strong consumer-focused investors who share in our vision of building one of the world’s next great consumer brands.


Our team is growing quickly and we are hiring across many functions. We are looking for team members who are equally passionate about what we do and excited about joining the Dolls Kill crew.


*
About Us*
Dolls Kill is the go-to brand globally for those who are going to be whoever the $#%@ they want to be. Our mission is simple, to empower everyone to celebrate their individuality, and have fun doing it. Who do you want to be today? Dolls Kill is headquartered in SF and backed by some of the world’s leading investors.
**
About the Role
In this role you’ll be hands-on managing big projects, a smart passionate team, and loads of data. Our Business Intelligence team is at the center of everything. You’ll lead integrating data from a variety of sources, transforming it for use, generating insights, and partnering with teams across the company to assure they have the information they need to make the best decisions.


Responsibilities


Develop and maintain a strong understanding of the business, build strong relationships across the company, and partner with teams to leverage data to drive the best decisions and outcomes
Manage team to efficiently and effectively tackle complex data challenges, coach and develop team members
Build and maintain scalable infrastructure to provide teams seamless access to data and insights
Extract, prepare and ingest data from various sources, set up ETLs to ready data for efficient access
Understand and document underlying data from multiple sources
Partner with the engineering team and external partners to assure efficient data housing, transformation and querying (Redshift, MySQL)
Manage self-service tools for end users across the company to explore a wide variety of data with little assistance
Partner with merchandising, marketing, finance, product, and ops teams to understand their data needs, surface insights through reports and dashboards, and make recommendations
Manage end-user facing ticketing system, assign and prioritize work for your team
Partner with teams to automate actions based on data, engineer creative solutions for passing data between tools
Manage data records to maintain GDPR+CCPA data compliance

Requirements


Detail oriented, self-starter
Experience leading and mentoring
Adept at query writing, strong knowledge of and experience with MySQL a must
Experience with Looker or similar tool a must (Tableau, Power BI, etc..)
Experience with ETL tools and processes
Skilled at processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis; technical familiarity with data models and database design development
Comfortable editing production data, close attention to detail
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize and analyze large amounts of data
Familiarity with common statistical models, experience with R or python a plus
BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics
Experience with the following a plus: Matillion, PHP, Javascript, AWS

Cover letter is required

Pay: From $120,000.00 per year

Health insurance

Job Summary:
The Data Reviewer, Office of Data Reliability (ODR) is accountable for critical review of pre-submission applications ready for regulatory submission to the US FDA. Responsibilities include the review of assigned pre-submission applications by using department SOPs and exhaustive audit checklists to ensure Data Integrity, Reliability, Accuracy, and Traceability of any submitted data.

Area of Responsibility:
Ensures compliance with cGMP/cGLP and good documentation procedure during the review process
Audits regulatory pre-submission documents from the manufacturing and quality units within the purview of ODR checklist
Communicates any audit comments/ observations/ findings to respective stakeholders and assesses acceptability/ appropriateness of responses
Informs the manager/s and Chief Data Reliability Officer immediately of any critical data integrity issues or data irregularity
Reports all audit finding in the ODR audit worksheets and highlight noteworthy/ major/ critical observations on CDRO certifications
Completes the audit tasks within the specified timeframe without compromising the quality of the audit and archives all documents in a closed electronic system
Collates audit findings in the audit comments log
Performs any other responsibilities which are required as assigned by the manager/s depending on departmental needs
Completes all training requirements as per Learning Management System (LMS) and as per Safety
Adheres to the Safety and Health Program and associated plans.

Requirements:
Minimum Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Chemistry, Pharmacy, Biochemistry or related field. A Master of Science (M.S.) in Chemistry, Pharmacy, Biochemistry or related field is desirable.
Minimum 5 years of experience in a pharmaceutical company within a cGMP environment in Quality Control and/or Analytical R&D department is required.
Minimum 2 years of Quality Assurance exposure in Pharmaceutical industry, involving review of manufacturing/ packaging batch records and investigations is desirable
Knowledge in and review of, but not limited to, the following: Laboratory test procedures, cGMP/cGLP/cGDP requirements, ICH/US FDA guidelines, raw material analyses, method validation guidelines, analytical method transfers, finished products and stability testing procedures; standard operating procedures, general procedures, test procedures, validation protocols; manufacturing and packaging batch records, excipients COAs, packaging components COAs, manufacturing reports, scale-up reports, product development reports; Quality overall summaries, executive summaries
Proficient in MS Office applications (Word, Excel)
Ability to monitor, coordinate and prioritize work in an effective and efficient manner, with capacity to manage simultaneous projects within a set timeline; ability to continuously make an assessment of the work load and suggest any support required on need basis
Must be a self-motivated, proactive team player with positive interaction with colleagues and stakeholders to ensure work ethics, teamwork, and discipline.
Conduct oneself in a professional manner in alignment with corporate values.
Ability to work and interact successfully in a global, diverse and dynamic environment.
Demonstrates excellent interpersonal communication skills: verbal, written and presentation skills.
Excellent project management and problem solving skills
The requirement for English language proficiency for this job role is Intermediate-B1+ (comparable to Global CEFR Independent B1) level based on the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR).

Our client offers a competitive compensation package as well as an excellent benefits package for eligible candidates.

Join Team CARFAX as a Data Analytics & Reporting Manager

Isn't it time you bragged about where you work? At CARFAX, we do, every day. We pride ourselves on being mission-focused on helping to grow a brand built on accuracy and integrity. We care deeply about our products and our customers. We’re more than just a company: We help millions of consumers make more-informed decisions every day. We know that our teammates are our most valuable asset, and we value a balanced life while tackling challenging projects in a fast-paced environment. One last thing: Our four-day week continues in Summer 2023!

As the Data Analytics & Reporting Manager, you will drive reporting, measurement, and insights efforts in the CARFAX Human Resources group. You will work with the organization's key performance indicators developing dashboards, scorecards, forecasting, trending, tracking results for the purpose of supporting operational excellence, management intelligence for effective decision-making, and overall tracking of organizational performance. You will provide structure and consistent guidelines for ensuring quality data and reporting. You will help HR leaders and managers across the organization find ways to work more effectively – we want to maintain and grow Team CARFAX for long term success.

This role has an expectation of 3 days in the office per week, subject to change based on future business needs.

What you’ll be doing:

Manage and oversee the functional Data & Reporting strategy, through the creation of reporting goals and objectives, prioritization of reporting projects and identify areas of growth for the Data and Reporting roadmap.
Author reports/visualizations and provide general data analysis using available business intelligence tools.
Oversee development and maintenance of company metrics based on people-related data to analyze issues such as pay, equity, hiring, promotions, turnover, performance and the overall health of the business.
Design, analyze and distribute periodic reports that highlight relevant data to decision-makers.
Ensure reporting processes, and procedures are reflected and appropriately documented.
Use advanced data analysis techniques to interpret and analyze large data sets providing insights to determine operational impact, trends, and opportunities.
Assist in the development of data management plans processes, tools, templates and guidelines that will deliver accurate timelines consistent with quality data.
Capture, develop, and maintain data definitions, business rules and data quality requirements.
Interpret, analyze and make recommendations regarding data accuracy and data collection needs and processes.
Work with managers to apply data to business goals and analytical requirements which may include areas such as workforce planning, volume, forecasting and unit costing.

What we’re looking for:

Bachelor’s Degree in HR, Business Administration or a related field.
5+ years of experience in manipulating data sets and building statistical models
3+ years of experience with reporting and information analysis and problem-solving skills gained within a Finance, HR and/or System environment.
Strong analytical and communication skills.
Ability to rapidly analyze, interpret, and integrate data information from multiple sources identifying clear conclusions and recommendations
Experience in data curation, acquisition, cleaning, and management
Experience with ADP, Jobvite, Xactly and/or Cognos preferred.

What’s in it for you:

Competitive compensation, benefits and generous time-off policies
4-Day summer work weeks and a winter holiday break
401(k) / RRSP matching
Annual bonus program
Casual, dog-friendly, and innovative office spaces

For more than 40 years, CXtec has been helping organizations maximize value in their IT investments. We are the largest secondary market network hardware provider in North America. Today, we remain focused on providing creative life cycle management solutions for organization of all sizes, all over the world.


We are looking for an Oracle EBS Database and Application Developer to join our IT team. The primary focus of this role will be leveraging development experience with Oracle EBS R12 applications and interfaces to provide robust functionality and meet new requirements of the business. The ideal candidate has a minimum of six years experience with managing and supporting Oracle EBS databases/applications hosted on both Oracle and Red Hat Linux environments, must be able to interact with business teams, understand and document business needs and translate them into a system solution that they will develop.

Summary:

Provide world-class support and expertise to CXtec’s Oracle EBS application and database environments. Represent CXtec’s Data Architecture and EBS Oracle team as a subject matter expert in the Oracle EBS application sub domains. Continually look for opportunities to create efficiencies and provide expertise to integrate technologies and platforms into current environment. Contribute to technology roadmaps to support the enterprise’s vision for all Oracle, Microsoft SQL and Postgres technologies.

What you'll be doing:

Apply forward thinking infrastructure automation and scripting skills.
Perform systems analysis, development, and maintenance of applications in support of business initiatives.
Coordinate with third-party software vendors on projects related to integration with Oracle EBS environment and custom application focused databases.
Identify inefficiencies and inaccuracies (duplicate data, etc) in current databases and implement solutions.
Work with Oracle vendor and its respected support channels when required.
Work with multiple application teams and developers.
Review existing configurations and installations and provide design decisions for improvements to platform environments.

What we're looking for:

Six or more years of related experience in the design and development of applications for Oracle and Microsoft SQL Server databases.
Strong command of PL/SQL and database business logic development focused on EBS.
Knowledge of WebLogic, Oracle Application Server, JVM Tuning, SQL and PL/SQL.
Experience performing debug, tuning and performance enhancement as well as automation of operational and continuous integration aspect of the Oracle EBS and database platforms.
Proficient with Linux operating systems, specifically Oracle Linux Enterprise and Redhat/CentOS.
Working knowledge of scripting languages such as Bash, ksh, perl, etc.

Preferred Experience:

Agile Methodology.
Oracle E-Business Suite experience, especially Supply Chain, Financials and Order Management modules.
Data integrity and cleanup, deduplication and similar activities.
Workflow and Data Design using OOB Oracle EBS Functionality.
Data warehouse tools and methodologies such as Snowflake.
Reporting tools such as MS Power BI.

What we offer:

Health insurance and prescription drug coverage
Dental and Vision insurance
Company-paid life insurance and voluntary life options
Company paid short-and long term disability
Critical illness, accident and hospital indemnity insurance
Flexible spending accounts
Pet insurance
Traditional and Roth 401(k) retirement plan with company match
Tuition reimbursement and Employee Assistance Program
Paid vacation, sick/personal days and holidays
Flexible work arrangements

Overview

The Digital Data Scientist will work closely with cross regional teams to develop and operationalize machine learning solutions to solve complex business problems and drive value. S/he will provide ongoing training and enablement to the Sappi Citizen Data Science community and cultivate self-service, data driven decision making and problem resolution. Additionally, this position will contribute to the development, and ongoing improvement of our in-house platforms and existing solutions and provide data science expertise and support as required to the wider organization.

Main Responsibilities

Citizen Data Science Tools

May be called upon to provide ongoing training and enablement to the Citizen Data Science community and cultivate self-service, data driven decision making and problem resolution.
Develop and maintain tools, libraries and pre-defined workflows and imputation algorithms that will help analytics team members more efficiently interface and analyze huge amounts of data
Continuously monitor, engage, and support Citizen Data Science initiatives to develop and support a data driven culture at Sappi
Actively report and engage on technical support issues, ensuring problem resolution and knowledge transfer to all stakeholders

Data Science

Develop, automate and optimize machine learning models and algorithms whilst abiding to change control procedures.
Actively develop and adhere to quality assurance best practices for data science services across the organization.
Actively analyze and assess data quality in all source systems (including digital twins) and assist in data quality improvement initiatives.
Conduct research and make recommendations on Machine Learning tools, techniques, and technologies in support of development efforts.

Operational management

Ensure best practices and standards are leveraged wherever possible as part of the solution.
Make recommendations for the introduction of new procedures, techniques and / or standards within the Advanced Analytics environment.
Work with the plant stakeholders and Advanced Analytics Director to develop time estimates and implementation plans.
Effectively communicate technical issues, decisions reached, and/or the status of the project with all stakeholders within the project team and within the business.
Responsible to ensure all data science projects are retained within the Advanced Analytics landscape, and actively monitor and maintain said landscape in terms of governance, performance optimization and security.
Actively ensure good governance to ensure full compliance of audit, controls and security requirements.
Ensure technical models remain accurate with changes in operations.

Interfaces

This role will interface with stakeholders across all regions and departments.
Build constructive relationships with internal and external business partners and with suppliers/contractors.
Collaborate with business partners in identifying opportunities to streamline their operations.

Support

Maintain and enhance all training materials for end user training for Advanced Analytics tools.
Facilitate change management for a data driven culture.

Continuous Improvement projects, optimization & innovation

Support the culture of continuous improvement through team member engagement, knowledge sharing and innovation.
Identify, review, and promote creative ideas and approaches to improve department and team performance.
Ensure optimal utilization of technology solutions, keeping pace with innovations in data science capabilities.

Requirements

Minimum Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Analytics; Master’s Degree preferably in Data Science or Analytics will be an added advantage.
5-8 years’ experience in Data Science
Minimum 5 years experience working in an industrial manufacturing setting
Experience in building innovative algorithms, mathematical modeling and Big Data analysis;
Sound programming and database experience using Python or R, & SQL at a minimum
Experience building visualizations and KPI dashboards with tools such as Tableau, Qlikview, or Grafana
Experience with BrainCube or Rapid Miner a plus

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

The HRIS Operations and Data Analyst maintains human resource management systems and databases across all Human Resources areas. Analyzes HRIS performance, manages user accounts, work process design and flow, improves processes and leverages the return on technological capabilities. The HRIS Operations and Data Analyst builds project plans, ensures adherence to project schedules, maintains a systems orientation, and can work effectively with peers to set technology priorities and conduct long-term planning. This position also serves as a technical point-of-contact for the assigned functional area and assists subject matter experts with ensuring data integrity, testing of system changes, report writing and analyzing data flows for process improvement opportunities. The HRIS Operations and Data Analyst also supports HRMS upgrades, patches, testing and other technical projects as assigned.


Reporting to the Chief Human Resources Officer (CHRO), the HRIS Analyst is responsible for the following:


ESSENTIAL DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES
Serve as the system administrator by leading and performing system maintenance, including assisting in the review, testing and implementation of HRIS system upgrades, and troubleshooting any errors. Collaborates with functional and technical vendor staff to coordinate the application of upgrade or fix for continuous improvement
Audit HR processes/procedures to ensure data integrity across all HR systems by running queries and analyzing data.
Provide support to the organization’s systems, develop, design, implement, and improve HR applications and business solutions.
Generates ad hoc reports/queries/analyses, including writing, maintaining, and supporting a variety of reports or queries utilizing appropriate reporting tools (HR dashboarding).
Develop and implement new processes and systems for efficient HR management
Optimize HRIS processes, integrate new software, and perform diagnostic tests
Perform statistical analysis on gathered HRIS data and run queries
Ensure the efficient recording and secure storage of HR metrics
Perform audits on HR processes and documents, including hiring, termination of service, and payroll administration, when required
Develop and monitor reporting dashboards, metrics, and automated data feeds
Update and alter account logins, permissions, and ongoing reports
Support for the end-user on usage and data integrity of the system
Extensive experience in analyzing HRIS and HR performance metrics
Advanced proficiency in database management as well as running SQL queries
Maintain system documentation and training aids for system functions, changes, and solutions
Partner with department administrators to aid in the development and creation, of project specific report
Conducts training, including developing user procedures, guidelines, manuals, and process documentation. Trains new system users.
Maintains awareness of current trends in HRIS with a focus on product and service. Implement process improvements and policy changes based on trends to improve efficiency and the user experience with the system
Liaise with IT department to ensure compliance with LAS technology security protocol. Ensuring security and monitoring end-user access
Collaborate across multiple departments including recruitment, operations, finance, learning & development and IT on cross-divisional technological needs.
Serve as the go-to subject matter expert for the system used in the organization (e.g., ADP, WFM, ADP-RM)
Own HR Project plan(s), ensuring key milestones are met by tracking and monitoring progress on all projects assigned
Performs other related duties as assigned


Excellent customer service skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software
Strong working knowledge of ADPR and other reporting tools
Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines
Proficiency with or the ability to quickly learn the organization’s HRIS systems
Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality



EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Bachelors in Business or Information Systems required
5-7 years’ experience with HRIS systems
Proficient in ADP Products including but not limited to ADP Reporting, ADP Workforce Manager, ADP-RM, and Enterprise eTime required
Ability to navigate reporting tools in vendor systems like MATRIX or I-Sight, or similar systems
Expert in Microsoft Excel, and Microsoft Office (knowledge of VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables, Index/Match, and other advanced functions required
Prior experience with creating & update SharePoint documents required
Will consider other HRIS systems experience
SALARY TRANSPARENCY
The posting reflects the range of potential salaries for the role. The specific salary offers will be dependent on candidate qualifications, including collectively bargained salary steps for unionized roles.


Salary Range

$93,137 - $95,000


SALARY AND BENEFITS
The leadership of The Legal Aid Society believes in attracting and retaining exceptional talent committed to serving our clients. Job_title: Principal Data Solutions Analyst, Personal Lines
Job_description:
The Personal Lines Modeling Data Solutions (MDS) team is actively searching for a new member to join our team as a technical expert in support of data initiatives within Product Design & Modeling (PDM).
The MDS teams works closely with modeling and delivery stakeholders to curate and deliver comprehensive data solutions that support sophisticated model development and the successful calibration and launch into market of high-quality home and auto personal insurance products.
As a member of the MDS team, analysts will contribute towards process and query enhancements within existing and emerging platforms, support and maintain operational data production, as well as collaborate within the team and with our technology and data partners to design and implement modern solutions leveraging cloud-based tooling to increase speed, efficiency, and accuracy of essential data products.
Responsibilities will include:
Working both autonomously and collaboratively design, prototype, develop, and scale data solutions of moderate to high complexity to meet the needs of business customers and progress organization initiatives.
Lead routine production and validation of data deliverables, overseeing stakeholder engagement, prioritization and planning, and communication. Continuously seek improvement and enhancement opportunities within existing processes.
Leverage agile techniques to gather and distill requirements, accurately scope work efforts, and drive successful development and testing of data products and processes. Proactively identify project risks and propose solution-oriented strategies.
Ability to think critically, analyze data, accurately diagnose data issues, and articulate impacts to varying audiences.
Eagerness to continuously learn and test new technologies and programming languages, adapt and deliver in a dynamic environment, and inspire and influence change through collaboration.
Ideal candidate will have:
Experience coding with SQL, SAS, or Python preferred. Additional experience with AWS, Spark, or Snowflake strongly preferred.
In-depth knowledge of data concepts, strategies, and methodologies for manipulating and curating structured and unstructured data preferred.
Familiarity with database design and data warehousing in an enterprise environment helpful.
Prior knowledge of insurance business operations helpful.
Strong written and oral communication skills required
Experience in communicating recommendations to senior business leaders preferred
BA/BS, or relevant work experience, in Computer Science or related field preferred
MBA or advanced degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or other quantitative discipline strongly preferred
3-5+ years of experience working in coding and data solutions design principles, particularly in open source tools and technology
