Introduction to the job
ASML US, including its affiliates and subsidiaries, bring together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon.
Job Mission
ASML US, its affiliates, subsidiaries, and business teams are critically dependent on their ability to leverage enterprise / business process data from internal business systems and applications, from suppliers, and from customers to run, optimize, and improve our business operations and services.The processing, enrichment, and consumption of this data is essential to improve business processes, drive operational performance improvements and continuously increase efficiencies in customer service and business operations.
The mission of this position is to understand, extend, and enable consumption of the ASML enterprise / business process data foundation in order to realize business benefits and improvements to support our aggressive business growth and new requirements in business insight, business capabilities, and integration as well as technical data volume, data processing, and trusted data enablement for ASML US.
This position may require access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require the Company to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.

Role and responsibilities

This position is located in San Diego, CA. The selected candidate will be part of the ASML IT Solution Delivery Analytics US team and be responsible for the understanding, extending and enriching the ASML enterprise data landscape, applications and platforms, contribute to new capability/technology assessments and pilots, and consult/support day to day operations of specific solutions that support analytics, innovation, and insight for ASML US teams.This hands-on solution application architecture role also entails additional strategic and operational responsibilities to contribute to the definition of ASML’s direction for information management, analytics, and Big Data.
ASML is a crucial player in a fast moving semiconductor industry which means change is a constant. You will work with your team to capture the constant and dynamic refinement of business priorities and data & analytics user stories. You are looked upon, and rewarded for, being able constantly switch between business value and technical implementation. Together with your team you will work constantly to drive ASML’s ambition by building a modern Data & Analytics platform and data foundation, using modern DevOps and Cloud components and leveraging the Agile mindset fully.
Duties and Responsibilities
Design, develop, and support robust, enterprise-grade data pipelines from external and internal data sources into on-premise and on-cloud data targets
Improve, automate, and strengthen existing data pipelines to improve reliability and availability
Contribute to the design and implementation to the innovation and improvement of the ASML data foundation
Strong partner in discussions with solution team system architect and other stakeholders within the internal customer departments
Contribute to Hadoop and Cloud competence to strengthen and improve local data engineering capabilities and capacity
Keep abreast with relevant literature, means and methods
Other duties as assigned

Education and experience

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent technical domain.Master’s degree preferred.
SAP, S4HANA and SAP HANA certifications related to enterprise business operations, solution architecture and cloud data management a strong plus.
Azure, GCP, or AWS certifications related to solution architecture, data management and/or data engineering a plus.
Business Management or Operational Excellence degree or equivalent certificates (i.e. Lean Six Sigma, etc.) a plus
Supply Chain Operations Reference (SCOR-P), American Productivity & Quality Center (APQC) certifications a plus.
Agile Solution Architect (TOGAF, Agilest, etc.) certification or equivalent training a plus; Scaled Agile (SAFe) Solution Architect certificate preferred.
Knowledge/hands-on experience with software/technical tools (i.e. Solidworks, NX, etc.).
Minimum of 7 years of relevant experience with data management, processing, and integration for business critical systems and enterprise business operations.
Demonstrated expertise in complex products business environment and business domains (Innovation/R&D, Supply chain, Manufacturing, Customer Service); experience with semiconductor industry, discrete high-tech manufacturing, and global supply chain / logistics a plus. Solid understanding of ASML and Cymer environments and business operations a plus.
Demonstrated expertise with developing and driving realization of data-centric application architecture and development, information policy formation, information taxonomy and modeling.
Demonstrated competence in business operations, data domain analysis, data warehousing (design and operations), and database design.
Demonstrated competence with benefits, design and management of structured and unstructured cloud native content and databases / repositories and hands-on experience with specific products.
Demonstrated expertise of business processes, integration, and data structures supported by enterprise business systems (SAP, Oracle EBS, Siemens PLM, etc.).
Working knowledge and understanding of benefits and positioning of data virtualization.
Working knowledge of data science, data mining, OLAP programming, database management and programming, business process modeling and analysis.
Working knowledge of mobile-enabled business analytics architecture and solutions.
Working knowledge of statistical computing and graphics programming languages.
Working knowledge of open source or commercial data visualization tools.
Working knowledge of cloud-based offerings and vendor differentiation related to analytics, data management, integration, data quality, and information processing platforms and capabilities.
Familiar with data governance principles, enterprise data modeling, and data management practices.
Proficient with cloud native services such as SAP HANA Cloud, Google BigQuery / Azure Synapse, Databricks, Managed Kubernetes: GKE or AKS, Serverless programming, Azure Data Factory or Google Cloud Dataflow.

Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. E-commerce healthcare training company seeks full-time Data Manager to lead our team in the processing, loading and quality checking the marketing leads we acquire and add to our database.

These qualified marketing prospects are the lifeblood of our company. You will have the important job of managing the processes and staff that are responsible for the capture, completion, and accuracy of all marketing prospects added to our system. This process supports our marketing team and drives the majority of our company’s revenue.

Your day-to-day duties will range from diving in and processing actual prospect records before they are loaded to setting strategic goals for your team to ensure our prospect database continues to grow.

Key Responsibilities:

Manage the acquisition, validation, tagging, and formatting of new email marketing prospects.
Work closely with marketing team to optimize prospect volume and results
Coordinate between departments to ensure deadlines are met
Prioritize data so that the highest quality prospects are processed first
Meet monthly volume and accuracy goals
Front-line management of data processing team of 2 (1 onsite and 1 offsite)
Audit work to ensure accuracy and quality of data before loading
When needed, jump in and process prospects with your team to ensure goals are met
Solve problems as they arise to keep prospects moving

Requirements:

Values: Buy in and to our company values
Experience: 3+ years’ experience as data project manager (or similar job), preferably supporting marketing functions
Computer: EXCELLENT MS Excel skills

MS Dynamics and SQL a massive plus, but not required.

Healthcare Knowledge: Although not completely necessary, it would be hugely beneficial
Details: Track numerous details under tight deadlines with minimal errors.
Change: Ability to shift gears quickly.
Location: North Naples office (partially remote may be possible after time)
Deadlines: Meet numerous deadlines
Management: Strong problem-solving, multitasking and prioritization skills. You never give up.
Communications: Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Auditing: Ability to utilize key indicators to identify problems – then take action to resolve.
Strategy: Regularly examine current processes to identify opportunities to improve speed and accuracy.

Company Core Values: Own it, People Matter, Persistent Optimism, and Results

Our entire team moves fast and never shies away from a challenge. We are definitively a glass entirely full group. This doesn’t mean that we have our heads in the clouds. We live in reality, driven by data and numbers. When mistakes happen (which they do), we own them. Then, we use what we’ve learned and do it right the next time. We respect each other, but say what needs to be said. We work hard so we can have a balanced life. With that said, when we are here we are results-oriented and driven.

This role is a chance to use your talent and expertise to make a visible difference in our company growth. The opportunity to work with a dedicated, talented, fun team that love their jobs, thrive on results and really enjoy coming to work each day (life is too short to simply go through the motions). We even have a company dog (who is hypoallergenic).

We’re looking for a rock star to join our team that can make a real difference in our company success. So, if you have the skills and meet the requirements in this posting and if you want to work somewhere that appreciates you and the work you do, is fast-moving, positive and results driven – we would love to have you join our team!!!!

Who Are We?

Taking care of our customers, our communities and each other. That’s the Travelers Promise. By honoring this commitment, we have maintained our reputation as one of the best property casualty insurers in the industry for over 160 years. Join us to discover a culture that is rooted in innovation and thrives on collaboration. Imagine loving what you do and where you do it.

Compensation Overview

The annual base salary range provided for this position is a nationwide market range and represents a broad range of salaries for this role across the country. The actual salary for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. As part of our comprehensive compensation and benefits program, employees are also eligible for performance-based cash incentive awards.

$112,300.00 - $185,300.00

What Is the Opportunity?

As an Architect in the Data and Analytics Architecture, you will be an working in an dynamic and transformative organization with a goal to create the next generation data and analytic capabilities at Travelers, a Dow 30 company. As a member within the Enterprise Architecture and Emerging Technology organization, you’ll be joining a strategic and collaborative team that is passionate about transforming our business and technology capabilities and paving the way for best-in-class solutions. You will collaborate with the other architects , engineers and business to apply your technical expertise to create best solutions to solve impactful business problems.

In this role you will

Design of the next generation information architecture that enables a business vision
Be an expert in one or more areas across Data & Analytics domain including data storage (Data Lake & Data Warehouse), data integration, business intelligence, artificial intelligence & machine learning
Drive the implementations of domain driven designs of Data Models, Data APIs and Data Products
Partner with cloud and security architects, data and software engineers to implement cutting-edge but pragmatic solutions that will enable business outcomes with data and analytics using a combination of deep technical skills, business acumen, and strong interpersonal skills
Keep up with marketing trends in the Data & Analytics area and identify new opportunities of technologies & solutions; you will be part of the team driving the technology selection and partner with an engineering team to conduct proof of technologies

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities

Architecture responsibility within a major segment of Technology Architecture in support of the Enterprise Data & Analytics business unit
Leads technology proof of concepts to ensure feasibility of architecture solutions
Hands-on prototyping of new technology solutions
Partner with Software Engineering to execute proof of technologies
Provides architecture direction for engineers in support of a technical pattern
Displays strong thought leadership in pursuit of modern architecture principals and technology modernization
Drives continuous technology transformation to minimize technical debt
Create a partnership with Software Engineering
Looks for opportunities to capitalize on technology advances through analysis of key industry and technology trends to assess potential impact on the enterprise
Participates in defining target state technology architecture and roadmaps
Ensures alignment of IT initiatives with the target state

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree or its equivalent in work experience.
Five years of experience in engineering software or analytic applications within a line of business area

Education, Work Experience, & Knowledge

Bachelor’s in technology related field or equivalent with 4+ years of technology Engineering experience
Organizational experience in an agile operating model
Established work in proof of concepts and technology
Strong proven Software Engineering experience
Supports technology target state, roadmaps that aligned to Short- and Long-term business goals
Insurance technology experience desired
Strong grasp of value creation and business capability models
Innovation and Continuous Improvement

Job Specific Technical Skills & Competencies

Has hands on experience in build strategies, roadmaps and solution architecture in the last 3 years
Strong experience architecting big data solutions using Data Lake, Data Warehouse , Data Products
Champion of data technologies in areas of data integration, Business Intelligence and AI/ML
Expertise architecting and developing solutions in AWS, Snowflake and Databricks
Experience in AWS components including: Lambda, Kinesis/Firehose, Airflow, Glue,Spark, EC2, SageMaker, S3, NoSQL database and API Gateway
Experience in data streaming technologies
Experience with No SQL and GraphQL technologies
Experience in Data Modeling, Governance and Data Management
Experience with specific DevOps and MLOps (Machine Learning) practices
Cloud Architecture Certification (AWS, GCP, or Azure) or strong architecture experience on Cloud
Good understanding of security

Rich’s, also known as Rich Products Corporation, is a family-owned food company dedicated to inspiring possibilities. From cakes and icings to pizza, appetizers and specialty toppings, our products are used in homes, restaurants and bakeries around the world. Beyond great food, our customers also gain insights to help them stay competitive, no matter their size. Our portfolio includes creative solutions geared at helping food industry professionals compete in foodservice, retail, in-store bakery, deli, and prepared foods, among others. Working in 100 locations globally, with annual sales exceeding $4 billion, Rich’s is a global leader with a focus on everything that family makes possible. Rich’s®—Infinite Possibilities. One Family.

PURPOSE STATEMENT

Rich’s has been able to pull off something rare in the business world: a culture that successfully blends the latest business practices with family values. That means our associates can work for a great company while also benefiting from a work environment that fosters world class professionalism combined with family intimacy. Our benefit offerings are reflective of this unique blend of Life, Work and Family.

Rich’s is growing our global S/4HANA Transformation Office delivery team at our world headquarters in Buffalo, NY. We are looking for a collaborative, self-directed, and globally focused individual to join our team to support Rich Product’s corporate global growth strategy. Our team is focused on replacing manual and outdated processes and systems with newer digital solutions to modernize our ERP and supply chain capabilities. In this role you will routinely work with leaders from across the globe and at WHQ to create new solutions.

The Enterprise Master Data Lead reports to the ERP Systems Manager and is responsible for the successful expansion, design, delivery, and implementation of Master Data Management solutions to enable business capabilities and services across the enterprise.

The Enterprise Master Data Lead will be responsible for leading the design, development, and maintenance of master data management processes and systems within the SAP S/4HANA environment, as well as Master Data Management solutions supporting enterprise level initiatives. This includes working with business stakeholders to understand their data needs, designing and implementing data architectures, and ensuring the quality and integrity of master data within the SAP S/4HANA system. The Enterprise Master Data Lead will also be responsible for providing technical leadership and mentorship to the master data management team and collaborating with other teams to ensure the success of data-related projects.

Working at Rich’s, we believe in a flexible work environment. Whether that’s working a day in our newly renovated headquarters or a day at home by using our cutting-edge technologies to deliver results from anywhere.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES/OUTCOMES
Lead the design, development, and maintenance of master data management processes and systems within the SAP S/4HANA environment, in addition to supporting enterprise Master Data Management solutions
Collaborate with Enterprise Data and Analytics team to design and implement data architecture that meet the needs of enterprise data and analytics key outcomes
Work with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and translate these into functional requirements for the master data management team
Design and implement data architectures that meet the needs of the business and ensure the quality and integrity of master data within the SAP S/4HANA system
Provide technical leadership and mentorship to the master data management team
Collaborate with other teams to ensure the successful execution of data-related projects
Stay up to date with the latest developments in SAP S/4HANA master data management and related technologies
KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/EXPERIENCE
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field is required
Minimum of 5 years of experience working with enterprise grade MDM tools like SAP MDG and Informatica
Strong understanding of SAP MDG functionality and configuration
Knowledge of modern data architectures and data management
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Experience working with SAP S/4HANA
Experience with data governance and data management principles and best practices
Ability to travel up to 10% #CORP123

About the Company:

Avalon Healthcare Solutions, headquartered in Tampa, Florida, is the world's first and only Lab Insights company, bringing together our proven Lab Benefit Management solutions, lab science expertise, digitized lab values, and proprietary analytics to help healthcare insurers proactively inform appropriate care, reduce costs, and improve clinical outcomes. Working with health plans across the country, the company covers more than 36 million lives and delivers 7-12% outpatient lab benefit savings. Avalon is pioneering a new era of value-driven care with its Lab Insights Platform that captures, digitizes, and analyzes lab results in real time to provide actionable insights for earlier disease detection, ensuring appropriate treatment protocols, and driving down overall cost.

Studies show that 30% of clinical laboratory testing is unnecessary or overused. Inappropriate testing or missing a key screening can lead to complications and expense arising from unwarranted care, or not obtaining proper care when needed, leading to increased health risks and costs. Avalon helps ensure delivery of the right test, at the right time, and in the right setting. We seek to ensure the most effective patient treatment, improve clinical outcomes, and optimize cost and affordability.

Avalon is a portfolio company of Francisco Partners, a global private equity firm that specializes in investments in technology and technology-enabled service companies.

Avalon is a high growth company where every associate has an opportunity to make a difference. You will be part of a team that shapes a new market and business. Most importantly, you will help Avalon to achieve its mission and improve clinical outcomes and health care affordability for the people we serve.

For more information about Avalon, please visit www.avalonhcs.com.

Avalon Healthcare Solutions is proud to be an equal opportunity employer including disability/veteran. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

Avalon Healthcare Solutions provides and maintains a drug-free workplace for its employees.

About the Sr Data / Snowflake Engineer position:

Within the analytics department, the Senior Data Engineer will aid teammates by using various methods to transform raw data into useful data systems, prepping data for modeling, and assisting in maintaining the infrastructure used for analytics. The Senior Data Engineer will also be responsible for assessing and reporting on data quality and striving for efficiencies by aligning data systems with business goals. This position entails ensuring the reporting team and business owners have valid and reliable data available for consumption by internal and external clients.

Sr Data / Snowflake Engineer - Essential Functions and Responsibilities:

Evaluate business needs and objectives
Acquire data to meet project requirements
Analyze and organize raw data
Build data systems and pipelines to generate reliable and repeatable processes to onboard data
Interpret trends and patterns
Conduct complex data analysis and report on results with Data Analysis team
Build algorithms and prototypes
Combine raw information from different sources
Explore ways to enhance data quality, integrity, and reliability
Curate data for advanced analytics and data science
Support analytical tools and programs
Collaborate with team members on several projects at once
Employ strong analytical and organizational skills and attention to detail
Integrate and provide data for model and client data outputs

Sr Data / Snowflake Engineer - Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in relevant field, or relevant experience
5+ years of relevant work experience:
Strong, hands-on experience with SQL data management, database design, and data lake concepts, using Snowflake, Snowpark, Python in an AWS environment
Experience with orchestration tools such as AirFlow, AirByte
Healthcare experience – pharmacy, managed care, health plans, hospitals, pharmaceuticals
Experience is using medical and lab claims data for analysis
Experience with data warehousing and ETL, and supporting downstream analysis projects
Desire to learn new software and methods
Previous experience as a data engineer or in a similar role, especially in scaling infrastructure and large data migrations
Excellent problem solving and communication skills

Sr Data / Snowflake Engineer - Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with HL7, EDI, FHIR data sources
Experience with event streaming platforms such as Kafka
Experience in containerization tools such as Docker
DBA Experience and Snowflake performance tuning and virtualization are a real plus
Experience with data governance principles
Experience with data lineage and classification schemas for data discovery and flow tracking
Excellent numerical and analytical skills
Experience in data dashboarding in tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, etc.

JOIN TARGET DATA SCIENCES AS A SR DATA SCIENTIST – GUEST JOURNEY

Description:

Join Target’s Data Sciences team where your goal will be to accelerate data decision making as well as foster a culture of continuous innovation at Target. We believe that continuous innovation is critical to delivering and exceeding our brand promise of “Expect More Pay Less” to Target’s guests. You will enable continuous innovation and drive business performance in our Guest Data Sciences space.

A role with our Data Sciences team is a chance to help develop our in-house strength for getting the maximum value from Target’s many data assets. We see data as a product and an opportunity to experiment and refine our approach to new guest experiences across all pyramids (and emerging industry of AI/ML). Together on our guest journey team you can play a role in solving problems related to assessing and valuing the iterations of journeys the guests take as the navigate both our physical and digital store. Solutions to these problems have dual benefit both to Target and to our guests.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will:

Serve as an advocate of our data-driven culture with Product, Business and Engineering to help them utilize insights that’ll direct their efforts towards initiatives with highest impacts
Develop statistical models to drive efficient analysis, providing metrics on model performance
Execute solutions to business problems using data analysis, data mining, forecasting, optimization tools, and machine learning techniques and statistics
Analyze and explore data in our Hadoop ecosystem, work with the product manager to design in-product experiments, analyze the results, and provide strategic recommendations.
Synthesize analysis and results in compelling storylines with the ability to communicate/consult to key stakeholders. You should have the ability to tell a story around the problem, the solution, the impact and value of implementing a solution
Partner closely with our Product Managers and/or business partners to identify gaps in product offering by conducting comprehensive data analysis and accelerating the analytics maturity (predictive & prescriptive) in key product areas
Define data to be collected for measuring the success of new product features or business strategies, define KPIs, and work with engineering on tracking and instrumentation of data
Strive for query optimization problems on large data sets
Design and build self-service dashboards using a mixture of analytical and visualization techniques to derive actionable insight from data to influences business decisions
Democratize data and insights as you strive to deliver self-service tools to your partners and enable them to make better decisions quicker

Requirements:

MS in Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science or equivalent work experience
3+ years of experience designing and deploying algorithms in a production environment
4+ years of experience using data science and technology approaches to solve real business problems
Proficiency with the following: SQL, Python, R, Spark, Hive and visualization software, etc.
Demonstrated understanding of technical and analytical approaches - predictive modeling
Excellent communication skills with the ability to speak to both business and technical teams as well as clearly translate ideas between them
Comfort with ambiguity and open-ended problems

Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)

Target will provide reasonable accommodations (such as a qualified sign language interpreter or other personal assistance) with the application process upon your request as required to comply with applicable laws. If you have a disability and require assistance in this application process, please visit your nearest Target store or Distribution Center or reach out to Guest Services at 1-800-440-0680 for additional information.

The Data and Operations Analyst broadly supports the prioritized research and analytic initiatives of the Institute of Food Technologists, whose mission is to advance the science of food and its application across the global food system. The Data and Operations Analyst is responsible for the collection, analysis and application of quantitative analysis of primary data on behalf of IFT and its business processes, strategic initiatives and research initiatives related to the academic and industrial food science. He/she is responsible for the compilation, analysis, and integration of secondary data into process, product and strategic decision making to meet the organization's strategic plan objectives and goals. The Data and Operations Analyst works across the organization as a partner to product and business process teams to assist with a myriad of projects including membership strategy, marketing initiatives, audience acquisition and member retention. The Data and Operations Analyst will work closely with their supervisor to support the organization's short and long-term goals as well as strategic prioritization. Additionally, a core component of this role will be to oversee the accuracy of our data that is reported internally to stakeholders coming out of both analysis and from our systems like HubSpot for marketing, HubSpot CRM, our sales workbooks, and Personify for member management.

Essential Responsibilities

Data Collection and List Building

Collaborate with departments to provide analytic support to a wide range of initiatives covering food science to coordinate and create uniformity and efficiency in data collection programs related to membership and annual event attendance, utilizing best practices, conforming to privacy policies and laws and ensuring the best possible data integrity.
Work with teams to help identify gaps in data. Use currently available tools to fortify lists for the purposes of audience and membership acquisition.

Data Analysis

Uphold and disseminate information on organization-wide best practices for planning, monitoring and requirements collection and analysis, including tools and training for staff and leadership.
Partner with product teams for new product development support related to business analysis and requirements development leading to business case support.
Collaborate closely with sales, marketing, communications, publications and membership teams to enhance communications and marketing to members with increased attention to clearly communicated data, and year-over-year data trends, in support of IFT member initiatives.
In collaboration with IT staff, create and modify dashboards, reports, queries and data exports as required. Establish regular, automated reporting systems when possible.
In collaboration with IT staff, be a provider of responsive, accurate ad-hoc reporting service to IFT staff.
Work with IT and Membership staff to establish, maintain, and communicate standards for data access and reporting.
Receive, assign priorities, track, and respond to analysis requests from IFT departments while developing self-service analysis skills within the departments.

Business Intelligence

Working with cross-functional teams and the volunteers from academic and industrial science of food community, be the lead data & research analytics professional to prioritize and plan primary and secondary research data requirements.
Ability to implement new data analysis methodologies, monitor trends and key performance metrics
Develop processes and procedures for the collection, analysis, and reporting of data
To build, test, and maintain predictive models that will help guide decision making for the business.
Skill requirements include thorough knowledge in but not limited to –
Data mining algorithms
Tableau, Alteryx and other data visualization programs
Beginner level experience in R, Python, SQL
Database management and reporting
Regression Analysis (linear and multiple)
Excel, Origin, SPSS, Minitab or equivalent
Advanced GA Certification

Data Integrity & Literacy

Work with cross-functional teams to ensure the accuracy of the data received, reported on, and analyzed.
A core component of this role will be to oversee reporting coming out of the operations team and to double check that it is accurate and delivered on time.
Provide on-going staff trainings to build data literacy and comfort with basic data analysis throughout the organization. Eg: How to trainings on building pivot tables, de-duping records, advanced excel skills, cross tabbing data sets, etc.

This is not meant to be a complete or comprehensive list as responsibilities may change; other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned at any time.

Experience Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Statistics, Business Analytics or related area required
Master's degree in Business Analytics or Statistics or preferred area.
Certified Business Analyst Professional certification (CBAP) preferred but not required
Minimum three years' professional experience
Success in synthesizing multiple data sets to develop action plan and priorities
Proven successes in managing a variety of assignments simultaneously while maintaining close attention to detail
Proven experience in anticipating the needs of managers and working to innovate processes and procedures to create efficiencies
Demonstrated advanced proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite of products
Past use of tools like ZoomInfo, Hoovers, or other contact repository systems
Experience working in a diverse, international environment with key clients/customers/partners from a variety of countries and cultural backgrounds with sensitivity and awareness

Competency Requirements

High degree of rapid responsiveness and customer-centric attitude Flexible: dealing effectively with change and acclimating (adjusting) to a dynamic environment
Effective Communication: Conveying and receiving information and ideas efficiently and effectively through a variety of organizational mediums and modifying communications for multiple audiences
Initiative: Seeks new/additional responsibilities, projects, tasks; Acts independently in new/routine situations
Celebrate One Another: Creating and maintaining an environment that enables participants of all diverse demographics to contribute to their full potential in pursuit of organizational objectives
Building Collaborative Relationships: Able to develop, maintain, and strengthen partnerships with others inside or outside of the organization who can provide information, assistance and support

Skill Requirements

Help facilitate initiatives to improve customer experience & enhance engagement; take ownership of customer issues and follow problems through to resolution
Manage projects, processes, and/or people to accomplish individual, departmental, project, and organizational goals; when supervising, provide effective feedback and help develop direct reports
Recognize and address issues that are outside a single perspective/role; promote creative, novel thinking and apply it to existing and emerging situations
Pivot when change occurs or priorities shift; be an enthusiastic supporter of new processes or initiatives; continuously offer suggestions for improvement
Maintain fiscal accountability while ensuring appropriate use of resources; may oversee budgets and contracts
Successful collaborator; foster effective working relationships with colleagues, especially those on teams, projects, and within the reporting relationship
Ability to present complex data systems to audiences in a readily consumable way.
To work across teams to recommend actionable strategies drawn from insights using complex data models that will clarify information and help department heads make data informed decisions.

Work Conditions

Travel 5%, domestically, including the ability to occasionally attend evening, weekend and overnight meetings
Must be present and working for the entire IFT annual meeting each July.
Physical demands
Sitting for extended periods of time and may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time.

Overview:

Do you have a passion for technology and are naturally curious? If you have strong interpersonal skills and are driven to learn and grow, then come join and add value at OneNeck IT Solutions as a Data Center Technician – Operations in Waukee, IA.


**Please note this position is considered an essential worker for our business and therefore will be required to work in the data center facility for all working hours.**


This is a full-time opportunity, working Wednesday from 11:00am to 7:00pm CT, Thursday-Friday from 9:00am-7:00pm CT and Saturday from 7:00am to 7:00pm CT.
Responsibilities:

The Data Center Technician - Operations will operate, monitor, measure, and attain OneNeck IT Solutions’ Data Centers Service Level Commitments, and maintain facility appearance and integrity, especially during assigned shift. This role is responsible for providing assistance to customers and projects, as such situations arise. The data center is a critical aspect of the OneNeck business by ensuring availability, business continuity (no disruption), and security for internal and external customers. The data center must maintain high standards for assuring the integrity and functionality of its’ hosted computer environment and support services.

Monitor and Operate Data Centers critical functions and facilities to meet or exceed Service Levels. Monitor, correct, and report observed infractions of security policies and procedures. Detect and dispatch help for trouble situations within non-local facilities, and attempt remote troubleshooting if possible/practical
Measure and record vital statistics and produce appropriate reports, including shift and weekly reports. Record and maintain accurate incident and change records and logs.
Respond physically to trouble situations within the local facility and conduct troubleshooting (including of telecom circuits) as may be required.
Conduct routine walkthroughs of local facility, correcting both appearance and functional imperfections. Chaperone vendors and guests, as may become necessary.
Assist, as available, project activity including any of the following
Installation, termination, testing and labeling of all cross connects (cat5, coax, fiber) in the Data Center.
Moving and installation of cabinets and relay racks.
Hardware installation including: shelves, power strips, rails, cable management, and customer equipment.
Exhibit exemplary workmanship in such performance
Have a working knowledge of the responsibilities of the Data Center Technician – Security, and be able to assist with those responsibilities, as necessary.
Qualifications:

Required Qualifications

Associates Degree -OR- 2+ years professional work experience.
3+ years technical support experience in a data center and/or HVAC environment and/or electrical field -OR- 1+ years of technical support in a OneNeck Data Center Facility (internal only)
Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license and reliable transportation.
Must live within 30 minutes of the data center.
Ability to work Wednesday from 11:00am to 7:00pm CT, Thursday-Friday from 9:00am-7:00pm CT and Saturday from 7:00am to 7:00pm CT.
Must be able to lift and carry equipment up to 75 pounds; climb equipment and walk on rooftops and cat-walks.

Other Qualifications

ITIL Certification or the willingness to pursue certification within 12 months of hire or work with management to pursue a reasonable alternative within 18 months.
Availability to occasionally work extra hours (including weekends) per an on-call basis.
Excellent communications with others, especially regarding technical matters.
Working knowledge of HVAC, Power, Fire, Security building systems operations and safety.
Working knowledge of telecommunications technologies, systems, and circuits.
Data center skills and experience in installing/moving equipment and cabling on a large-scale basis.
Experience working with various networking hardware such as multiplexers, routers, and switches.
Knowledge of common network protocols such as TCP/IP.
Experience with fault isolation and troubleshooting networks including LAN and WAN.
Familiarity with configuring networking equipment such as routers, switches, and hubs.
Experience with data communication issues, including security, resource management, capacity planning, monitoring, and performance.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities and interruptions.

#OneNeck IT Solutions offers multi-cloud solutions, combined with managed services, professional IT services, hardware and local connectivity via top-tier data centers across the country. OneNeck's team of technology professionals deliver secure, modern platforms and applications for organizations embracing data-driven transformation and secure end-to-end solutions.


Employment at OneNeck is subject to post-offer, pre-employment drug testing.

Job_title: WGL - Research & Data Analyst (DIMP Analyst or Sr DIMP Analyst)
Job_description:
Job Description
WGL - Research & Data Analyst (DIMP Analyst or Sr DIMP Analyst)
WGL/Washington Gas has an immediate opening for a Research & Data Analyst to join our Distribution Integrity Management Program (DIMP) group.
You Will
Create reproducible research and is prepared to defend conclusions
Connect to databases, writes SQL queries, joins data, ‘wrangles data’, and creates data visualizations (charts, graphs) that illustrate relevant points
Support database management
Use statistical methods to measure the correlative relationship between datasets
Use statistical methods to evaluate predictive model performance (back-testing, benchmarking, sensitivity testing, etc.)
Build charts, graphs, dashboards, summary tables, and other graphical representations to illustrate key findings in data
Search for industry papers in academic and professional journals compiles papers and refers to key research with citation
Intentionally dedicates effort to employ inductive and deductive reasoning to frame complex problems
Understand decision heuristics and the importance of variable weighting
Develop mathematic models or algorithms to forecast outcomes using historical data
Meet with company engineering staff and subject matter engineers to elicit opinion, direction, support, and coordination
Present findings of research to internal company panels and outlines proposed solutions
Work closely with various staff (e.g. Analysis & Reporting, Replacements, System Planning, Mapping, IT, Operations, Construction, etc.) to develop knowledge of their systems’ data and needs.
You Have
Bachelor's Degree Computer Science, Information Technology, GIS, or other Data Engineering field
3+ Years of experience in Computer Science, Information Technology, GIS, or another related field
Ability to systematically debug code, reduce I/O strain on ETL processes, and troubleshoot SQL for performance gains.
Knowledge of data engineering best practices across the development lifecycle – including agile methodologies, sustainable coding standards, code reviews, source code management, testing, and maintaining code.
Experience administering ESRI, Open Source, or Spatial Databases (GIS)
Intermediate knowledge of SQL for data management in a relational database
Intermediate knowledge of scripting languages such as Python or Node.js
Knowledge of Safe Software FME for extract, transforming, and load data operations
Experience with programmatically automating the extraction of data from public or vendor data APIs
Automating server-side scripting for backend data update pipelines
Working knowledge of the energy industry
Working knowledge of Power BI, Magik, and cloud architectures such as Amazon AWS or Microsoft Azure
Experience in Data Engineering and/or Data Architecture
Why work at AltaGas?
AltaGas is a North American energy infrastructure company with a focus on owning and operating assets that provide clean and affordable energy to our customers. AltaGas assets include Washington Gas/WGL, SEMCO, ENSTAR, and Petrogas. Our talented team, nearly 3,000 strong, leverages the strength of our assets and expertise along the energy value chain to connect customers with premier energy solutions – from the well sites of upstream producers to the doorsteps of homes and businesses to new markets around the world.
We deliver clean and affordable natural gas to approximately 1.6 million customers’ homes and businesses through regulated natural gas distribution utilities across five jurisdictions in the United States and two regulated natural gas storage utilities in the United States. Learn more about our team, vision, and strategy.
To learn more about our mission:

Job Description:


Leidos is looking for a Data Scientist to join our team to support the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) at the Mike Monroney Aeronautical Center. The ideal candidate will be responsible for the following requirements:

Creates effective Business Intelligence (BI) solutions and analytical dashboards / analytical tools for business users.

Effectively utilizes features and Best Practices of visual analytics to maximize impact and utility of visualization products.

Aid in developing style guide for development of visualizations, design of components, naming of items, data source creation and naming.

Provide support for specialized data collection using query languages to create data and analyze data using artificial intelligence.

Provide support to development efforts through appropriate database use and project design.
Provide support in mining FAA datasets in conjunction with information analysis tools such as SPSS/R/Python to use appropriate algorithms/machine learning/artificial intelligence to analyze the data.
Perform information analysis across multiple data sources to identify patterns, relationship and other analytical and statistical models to support data and research needs.
Provide support in the collaboration efforts with international partners for the implementation of interoperable open standards and procedures, innovative technologies, cultural shifts related to standards, the harmonization of international and geographical standards and taxonomies of certifications, regulations, communication, and sharing of information technologies while protecting privacy.
Maintain a high degree of customer satisfaction through the implementation, investigation, analysis, training and relationship building efforts.
Clearly communicating and driving discussions on data and insights, context, and implications with business stakeholders.
Document and communicate technical specifications to ensure that proper and optimized techniques, queries, and final deliverables are understood and incorporated into data and analytics processes.


Basic Qualifications

BS degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Systems, Systems Engineering and 4 to 8 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 2 to 6 years of prior relevant experience.
Requires strong SQL development skills – writing complex queries and stored procedures – SQL, PL/SQL, T-SQL.
Strong understanding of Software development lifecycle.
Excellent communication, documentation and presentation skills.
Ability to analyze structured and unstructured data from data sources, mobile devices, NoSQL data systems, cloud, and the related query and analysis tools.

Experience analyzing complex data sets and creating dashboards and visualization to find trends and patterns in data.

Experience with statistical analysis and information analysis tools such as SPSS/R/Python.

Solid understanding of Agile Project Management methodologies.

**Must have the ability to obtain a Public Trust clearance. To qualified for the FAA Public Trust you must be a US Citizen or a Green Card Holder who has resided in the US for the past 3 years.

Pay Range $78,000.00 - $120,000.00 - $162,000.00

Job_title: Senior Threat & Risk Engineer - Data Science (Hybrid Schedule)
Job_description:
About Us

At SoCalGas, we believe that every Californian deserves a resilient energy future. We are working to achieve that future by empowering California to reach its sustainability goals through innovation, collaboration, and decarbonization. As our state’s energy needs change, we will be there providing reliable energy that is clean, safe, and affordable to our 22 million customers.

In addition to helping shape the future of hydrogen technology and clean energy, as an employee of SoCalGas you’ll also enjoy an aggressive total compensation plan, multiple upward mobility opportunities and the ability to find a true work life balance. We also strive to reflect the communities we serve by attracting top talent and maintaining a diverse workforce. To discover more about how rewarding it is to work here, we invite you to visit these pages on our website: Our Mission; Diversity, Equity and Inclusion, Sustainability, In the Community, and Employee Benefits. Join SoCalGas today to share in our mission to build the cleanest, safest, and most innovative energy company in America!

Position Summary

Applies superior technical expertise in engineering risk assessment principles and creative analytical ability to perform multi-dimensional systematic risk analysis in an often ambiguous and complex environment. Functions as a company expert in Risk and Threat assessment and potentially in other critical engineering disciplines. Provides increasingly integrated, data-driven and quantified safety and reliability assessments covering the full spectrum of Integrity Management Program assets including Transmission Pipeline Integrity Management Program (TIMP), Storage Integrity Program (SIMP), Distribution Integrity Management Program (DIMP) and Risk Assessment and Facilities Integrity Management Program (FIMP). Leverages a high level of technical expertise across a broad range of engineering disciplines to enable effective likelihood of failure and consequence of failure modeling. Integrates and balances findings in consideration of the full Integrity Management System, safety, regulatory compliance, and business need. Identifies and measures the effects of Preventative & Mitigative actions on system threats. Formulates analysis outcomes and serves as a key technical advisor to senior management to drive risk differentiation that will enable optimized resource decisions and potentially new programs. Plays a critical role in regulation and program development across all Integrity Management Programs to ensure the integrity of company assets are being managed based on comprehensive threat evaluation and risk assessment.

Area of risk & threat assessment: Data science using large data sets and data models.

Duties and Responsibilities


Performs Threat Evaluation and Risk Assessment of mature and complex Transmission Pipelines, Storage, Facilities and Gas Distribution Assets by applying engineering risk assessment principles toward increasingly integrated, data-driven, and quantified safety and reliability. Performs work with a high degree of autonomy and only high-level guidance and review of higher impact work for progress towards objectives. Aggregates results, in an often ambiguous environment and circumstances, from a broad range of technical disciplines, including but not limited to: - Geotechnical- Structural integrity/reliability theory- Assessment including non-destructive evaluation- Corrosion control, Fracture mechanics- Materials science, Statistics- Machine learning- Pipeline design- Human factors Translates complex results into a unified and integrated risk framework that clearly expresses threat likelihood, consequence, and business value (return on investment) balanced with safety and regulatory compliance. Creates solutions to highly complex issues independently or leads effort to collaboratively develop them.
Functions as a company expert in risk and threat assessment and potentially in some of the above specific engineering disciplines. Uses in-depth knowledge in regulations, standards, and evaluation of risk regarding integrity management programs to provide technical expertise to various project teams in System Integrity, Gas Engineering and Gas Operation Organizations. Leverages comprehensive understanding of different organizations in engineering and operations, and their distinct processes, services, and responsibilities to effectively lead and advise cross-functional teams. Manages and directs programs and/or projects that span multiple departments which provide department, division, or company-wide benefits. Makes decisions with impact on activities of his or her organization. Develops vision and directs team members, both Company employees and outside contractors, to achieve results and goals. Integrates input from, and participation with, various departments within the Company as needed to meet project objectives. May participate in the development of testimony for regulatory proceedings.
Develops new and improves existing Company standards, specifications, procedures and policies governing TIMP, SIMP, FIMP and DIMP, specifically regarding Threat Identification and Risk Assessment. Develops new programs related to research & development which may result from risk and threat analysis.
Communicates complex information with all levels of stakeholders, including senior management presentations. Confidently conveys thoughts, ideas, and/or solutions to management, while being respectful and mindful of other's contributions to the same discussion. Influences other leaders across the organization, as well as external stakeholders, to accomplish objectives.
Provides technical advice and may formally supervise a few less experienced staff members and reviews technical results, evaluations and analyses. Provides for the development of less experienced staff within the work group through mentoring and providing technical guidance.
Interprets state and federal codes, industry standards and Company specifications. Participates in industry and regulatory committees and provides technical input to external regulatory agencies for the review of proposed changes to regulatory requirements affecting codes and standards. Recommends modifications to Company policy and procedures that reflect regulatory changes. Stays abreast of the latest changes, trends and technological advancements in the industry through attendance at conferences and seminars, continuing education, literature, etc.
Performs other duties as assigned (no more than 5% of duties).

$118900 - $178400 / year

#scgjobs

NOTE: This position can be filled at a different level based on the final scope of job responsibilities and job requirements.

Education


Bachelor's Degree in Engineering is required.
Master's Degree Engineering or Mathematics Preferred

Experience


10 years Engineering experience including 6 yrs related to risk or reliability or threat evaluation or integrity management. Required OR
8 years Engineering experience including 4 yrs related to risk or reliability or threat evaluation or integrity management. Required
Preferred focus on integrity management and/or risk engineering in Data Science. Preferred

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities


Engineering & Technical Knowledge: Must have a thorough, up-to-date knowledge of specific engineering disciplines to analyze and solve problems as appropriate to area of assigned responsibility. Then able to implement the practical application. Advanced
Engineering & Technical Knowledge: Must be able to understand and analyze highly theoretical problems which are difficult to define, have rapidly changing variables, and for which engineering precedents are incomplete or lacking. Advanced
Creativity, Innovation & Problem Solving: Must possess the ability to propose innovative solutions to unique problems, which are complex and/or impact Company operations, compliance and system integrity, with thoughtful consideration of technical, operational, and economic issues, and may link new concepts and technologies. Advanced
Creativity, Innovation & Problem Solving: Must demonstrate ability to review complex problems, open-ended problems, and propose innovative solutions, which involve technical, operational, economic and strategic issues, and may link new concepts and technologies. Advanced
Project Management Skills: Must possess developed project management skills (e.g., leadership, communication, team management, scheduling, negotiation, decision-making, problem-solving, cost control, risk management, adaptability, execution) and concepts, and understands how it applies to their work. Intermediate
Project Management Skills: Assess the abilities within the work group, appropriately delegate project work to team members, and responsible for providing team goals and evaluating performance. Intermediate
Project Management Skills: Ability to assess the potential financial impact of a project in the Company, as well as the impact on existing Company facilities, programs, marketing and operating philosophies and procedures. Intermediate
Communication Skills: Possesses advanced oral and written communication skills. Advanced
Communication Skills: Effectively interacts with various departments to maintain open lines of communication. Advanced
Communication Skills: Clearly and concisely communicates technical and non-technical information and concepts with all levels of management in both formal and informal settings. Advanced
Communication Skills: Must be able to prepare clear and comprehensive oral and written communication on technical and non-technical matters for Executives. Advanced
Financial Acumen & Accountability: Ability to understand and use financial concepts, such as budgeting, forecasting and reporting. Intermediate
Financial Acumen & Accountability: Ability to manage cost and resources, and development of metrics. Intermediate
Company, Industry & Regulatory Awareness: Ability to interpret state and federal codes, industry standards and Gas Standards for clients. Advanced
Knowledge of risk or reliability analysis methodologies. Advanced
Knowledge of pipeline risk management or risk analysis is highly desirable. Intermediate
Knowledge of federal code, state code and other industry standards relating to natural gas business. Advanced

Licenses and Certifications


Registration as a Professional Engineer in the state of California (PE) Preferred
Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) and Engineer in Training (EIT) Preferred
Other technical discipline and business training is desirable (e.g., statistics, finance, data management) Preferred

Benefits

SoCalGas offers a comprehensive benefits program to help support employees both personally and professionally. These benefits include, but are not limited to:


Competitive pay & Annual Bonus program
Medical, dental, and vision packages (plus free Mental Health resources/sessions)
401K company match & Company provided Pension Plan
Work/Life Balance including generous PTO
Wellness Programs/Classes
Tuition/Education Reimbursement
Career Development Tools & Resources through SoCalGas University

The Challenge:

When our country’s cyber security is on the line, simply reacting is not enough – we need a plan. And when that plan needs to protect databases for federal financial agencies, we need SMEs to help ensure those databases are secured. That’s why we need you, a security specialist with the expertise required to analyze the databases that contain sensitive information.

As a database security tester on our team, you’ll lead the assessment of your client's current cyber security posture of their databases and areas of risk. You’ll evaluate how databases stack up to baselines, best practices, and industry standards. As you guide your client through understanding acceptable risk and availability, you’ll advance the development of a strategic cyber roadmap. You’ll work in a consultative role to ensure the client operates securely as they navigate an evolving IT environment. Join us as we protect the data of federal financial agencies. This position is a hybrid role with a combination of working at a Booz Allen office or client site and working remotely.

Empower change with us.

You Have:

5+ years of experience with database development, including Oracle and MS or SQL

2+ years of experience using a database vulnerability scanner, including Imperva

Knowledge of NIST SP 800 series and testing in accordance with NIST SP 800-53A

Knowledge of security best practices for Windows and Linux environments

Knowledge of federal information security policies, standards, procedures, directives, and frameworks, including FISMA, NIST 800-53 Revisions 4 and 5, and the Risk Management Framework (RMF)

Ability to obtain a security clearance

Bachelor's degree

Nice If You Have:

Description


Title: Senior Data Analyst (Specialized Services)

Department: Varies

Reports To: Administrative Superior

The School District of Philadelphia is the cornerstone provider of public education in Philadelphia. For forward-thinking administrators and educators, opportunities abound. Over 131,000 students entrusted to the District arrive at school every day with an extraordinary range of needs and aspirations. We are committed to delivering on their right to an excellent public school education, and we are particularly focused on ensuring every student has access to exceptional educational opportunities. Equity is our mandate. Will you join us?

Job Summary

Supports the development and implementation of the systems and processes that form the foundation upon which District leadership engages in systemic decision-making and executes change management activities in the assigned office. Gathers, analyzes, and reports on complex quantitative and qualitative data on departmental programs, initiatives and student performance. Works with leadership to ensure constant compliance with standards and practices to effect change.

This a full-time, non-represented position. The salary grade 4026.

Essential Functions

Develops and analyzes data sets and reports to inform decision-making processes regarding departmental or school improvement.
Displays complex information in meaningful and visually appealing ways.
Gathers quantitative and qualitative information from a wide array of stakeholders, including District administrators, school leaders, and community members.
Analyzes data from multiple sources.
Develops and adheres to processes and timelines for information gathering and analysis.
Works with members of various central office departments to coordinate the efficient flow of critical information.

Specialized Services Specialty

Uses reporting tools to access multiple systems, perform analysis and design reports to aid in the decision support and planning process for all facets of the Office of Specialized Services (OSS) central office and field operations.
Assists with the development and implementation of processes that ensure compliance with federal and state regulations and District policies and practices within OSS; monitors processes ongoing.
Works with the Senior Project Manager and Director, Special Education Services to fulfill data requests to monitor the behavioral and academic progress of special education students.
Identifies, evaluates and documents trends and evaluates data sources which support OSS initiatives.
Forecast trends and communicates findings to resolve data gaps that impact the fulfillment of the OSS functional requirements.
Identifies and communicates risks and issues in projects/programs initiated by the OSS; communicates this information to leadership.
Develops clear and uncomplicated visual displays of data that inform high stake decisions.
Qualifications


Minimum Requirements

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in computer science, management information systems or a related field.
Five years of full-time, paid, professional experience, two of which have involved working with large longitudinal data sets, educational data reporting or educational performance data.

OR

Master’s degree from an accredited college or university in computer science, management information systems or a related field.
Three years of full-time, paid, professional experience which have involved working with large longitudinal data sets, educational data reporting or educational performance data.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Demonstrated knowledge of:
standard methodology and procedures as applied to data analysis and presentation of findings and data visualization tools and technologies.
best practices in data management, including extraction, storage, documentation and database design.
measurement theory and practice.
applied statistics and using data to change outcomes.
Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint and Google Drive.
the services and programs for the assigned area.
Demonstrated ability to:
gather, analyze, and report on complex quantitative and qualitative data on either departmental, school or student performance.
collaborate with District staff at all levels of the District and work cross-functionally with multiple teams and stakeholders.
apply organizational methods to handle multiple complex projects through to completion.
meet multiple deadlines in a fast-paced work environment.
Ability to:
operate a personal computer.
communicate effectively, both orally and in writing.
establish and maintain effective working relationships.

The annual base salary range provided for this position is a nationwide market range and represents a broad range of salaries for this role across the country. The actual salary for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. As part of our comprehensive compensation and benefits program, employees are also eligible for performance-based cash incentive awards.

Salary Range

$130,600.00 - $215,400.00

Target Openings

1

What Is the Opportunity?

As a Sr. Architect, you will help lead the effort to create the "north star" technology architecture for the Data & Analytics Unit in Business Insurance of a global, Dow 30 company.
As a direct report to the Head of Information Architecture, Business Insurance you will interface directly with senior technology leaders to transform our current business and technology capabilities and pave the way for best-in-class solutions. You will be a dedicated partner to senior Technology and Business leaders as you define a target state, roadmaps and identify new and emerging technologies that will transform and optimize the business. As an organizational leader, you will humbly serve and inspire a team of high-performing Architects who you will coach, mentor, and empower. As a successful candidate, you are a visionary leader with a track record of building high-quality enterprise solutions. You are results-driven and bring strong Architecture and engineering skills and a deep understanding of modern technologies including Cloud-native, APIs, AI, and ML. You are a person of high integrity, who believes in challenging the status quo when needed, while always first seeking to understand. You will work within a community of architecture leaders, charged with establishing and evolving a unified architecture vision.

What Will You Do?

Expertise - Collaborate with Enterprise Architects, Business Architects, Line of business engineers and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as Athena, Glue, Lambda, S3, DynamoDB NoSQL, Relational Database Service (RDS), Amazon EMR and Snowflake.
Solutions - Deliver on technical engagements with partners and customers. This includes understanding customer requirements, creating packaged Data & Analytics service offerings.
Delivery – Engagements proving the use of AWS services to support new distributed computing solutions that often span private cloud and public cloud services. Engagements will include migration of existing datasets and development of new applications and datasets using AWS cloud services.
Insights - Work with delivery engineering and support teams to convey partner and customer needs and feedback as input to technology roadmaps. Share real world implementations and recommend new capabilities that would simplify adoption and drive greater value from use of cloud technologies.
Innovate - Engaging with the customer’s business and technology stakeholders to create a compelling vision of a data-driven enterprise for Business Insurance.
Ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Hands on experience leading large-scale global data lake/warehousing and analytics projects
Ability to collaborate effectively across organizations
Understanding of database and analytical technologies in the industry including NoSQL databases, Data lake design, BI reporting and Dashboard development
Demonstrated industry efficiency in the fields of database, data warehousing or data sciences
Implementing AWS data services in a variety of distributed computing, enterprise environments
Customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, best practices, project management and risk mitigation
Desire and ability to interact with different levels of the organization from development to C-Level executives
Manage and Monitor the data quality of the content in the data architecture and platforms.
Balance tactical vs strategic trade-offs when making decisions or proposing solutions.

What Will Our Ideal Candidate Have?

Bachelor’s in technology related field or equivalent with 5+ years of technology Architecture experience
Provided mentorship to architects
4+ years of experience of Data Lake implementation
3+ years of experience in AWS cloud
2+ years of hands-on experience in implementation and performance tuning in Object Storage (AWS S3 or similar.)
Experience with one or more relevant tools (Kafka, AWS Kinesis services, AWS Glue, Data Brew, DeeQu, and Drools.)
Experience with no SQL and GraphQL technologies.
Experience developing software code in one or more programming languages (Java, Python, Javascript and etc.,)
Organizational and transformational experience in an agile operating model
Establishes strategic technology direction and architecture vision for an organization
Strong proven Software Engineering experience
Developed technology target state, roadmaps that aligned to Short- and Long-term business goals
Proven track record of influencing senior leadership
Insurance technology experience
Strong grasp of value creation and business capability models
Innovation and Continuous Improvement
If Cyber; CISSP, CISM, Security+, CISA or equivalent Cybersecurity certification preferred
Must be passionate about technology transformations
Has hands on experience in the last 3 years
Executed technology modernization initiatives including migration to cloud native and API Strategy
Current deep experience with AWS, APIs, accelerators, DevSecOps
Cloud Architecture Certification (AWS, GCP, or Azure) or strong architecture experience on Cloud
Good understanding of security
Experienced with large scale technology platforms
Experience modernizing data technology and information architecture on cloud
Exposure and understanding of advanced analytics techniques using ML and AI
Hands on experience with data technologies on cloud

What is a Must Have?

Bachelor’s degree or its equivalent in work experience.
Six years of experience in enterprise, application, and/or information architecture within a line of business or enterprise area

What Is in It for You?

Health Insurance: Employees and their eligible family members – including spouses, domestic partners, and children – are eligible for coverage from the first day of employment.
Retirement: Travelers matches your 401(k) contributions dollar-for-dollar up to your first 5% of eligible pay, subject to an annual maximum. If you have student loan debt, you can enroll in the Paying it Forward Savings Program. When you make a payment toward your student loan, Travelers will make an annual contribution into your 401(k) account. You are also eligible for a Pension Plan that is 100% funded by Travelers.
Paid Time Off: Start your career at Travelers with a minimum of 20 days Paid Time Off annually, plus nine paid company Holidays.
Wellness Program: The Travelers wellness program is comprised of tools and resources that empower you to achieve your wellness goals. In addition, our Life Balance program provides access to professional counseling services, life coaching and other resources to support your daily life needs. Through Life Balance, you’re eligible for five free counseling sessions with a licensed therapist.
Volunteer Encouragement: We have a deep commitment to the communities we serve and encourage our employees to get involved. Travelers has a Matching Gift and Volunteer Rewards program that enables you to give back to the charity of your choice.

About the Role

Brivo is looking for a Director, Business Intelligence Systems who will be responsible for applying business, technical and analytical skills on various projects in support of strategic financial planning, budgeting, forecasting and implementation of practical business solutions. This individual will act as the analytical engine of the company’s data to provide insights and support ‘optimal’ business decision making. If you have excellent analytical, data query and financial modeling skills and you know how to present and evaluate business opportunities, we want to hear from you.

You will also be expected to:

Design and implement enterprise level data warehouse approach to capture and join critical raw data from disparate systems to enable systematic analytics and reporting of KPIs and ad hoc reporting
Evaluation and selection of tools to optimize data gathering and analysis, business intelligence reporting and executive dashboard reporting
Identify, quantify and model key metrics that drive growth and revenue
Monitor performance indicators, highlighting trends and enabling the quantification and determination of trendlines and movement in KPIs
Present recurring CXO summary reporting and findings of strategic KPIs
Enable data and reporting in support of detail pricing and gross margin analysis of products and service lines
Provide company-wide support in analytics, research and estimation
Perform data privacy and risk assessments in concert with security teams

About You

Bachelor's Degree in Data Science, Computer Science or Mathematics is required
Bachelor's Degree in Finance or Accounting will be considered based on experience
7+ years of experience in data warehouse and BI/dashboard reporting at large companies with extensive in-place systems and tools.
Previous financial analysis experience within SaaS and recurring revenue business models and technology is preferred
Experienced with the design and data architecture, pulling and creating data sets, relational databases, SQL queries is required
Experience with NetSuite and Salesforce preferred
Ability to boil down concepts, trends, financial results into simple visual presentations
Strong financial and analytical skills including experience creating complex financial models and efficiently communicating results
Excellent oral and written communication skills

About Us

Brivo is the global leader in mobile, cloud-based access control for commercial real estate, multifamily residential, and large distributed enterprises. Our comprehensive product ecosystem and open API provide businesses with powerful digital tools to increase security automation, elevate employee and tenant experience, and improve the safety of all people and assets in the built environment. Having created the category over twenty years ago, our building access platform is now the digital foundation for the largest collection of customer facilities in the world, trusted by more than 25 million users occupying over 300M square feet of secured space in 42 countries.

Our dedication to simply better security means providing the best technology and support to property owners, managers, and tenants as they look for more from buildings where they live, work, and play. Our comprehensive product suite includes access control, smart readers, touchless mobile credentials, visitor management, occupancy monitoring, health and safety features, and integrated video surveillance, smart locks, and intercoms. Valued for its simple installation, high-reliability backbone, and rich API partner network, Brivo also has the longest track record of cybersecurity audits and privacy protections in the industry.

Brivo is privately held and headquartered in Bethesda, Maryland. Learn more at www.Brivo.com

Brivo is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer
