Job_title: CHC Data Governance and Security Expert
Job_description:
Sanofi (NYSE: SNY) is a leading global integrated healthcare company that discovers, develops, and distributes therapeutic solutions to improve the lives of everyone. The company works to prevent and treat the diseases of today, as well as those we may face tomorrow. With over 100,000 dedicated professionals in more than 100 countries, Sanofi is devoted to advancing healthcare around the world. Sanofi operates across multiple therapeutic areas including General Medicines, Specialty Care, Vaccines and Consumer Healthcare.

Equal opportunity employer: Sanofi is an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity to foster positive, innovative thinking that will benefit people worldwide. Sanofi is also committed to employing qualified individuals with disabilities and, where warranted, will provide reasonable accommodation to applicants, as well as its employees.

Consumer healthcare business unit:

The role will regard Sanofi’ Consumer Healthcare. Becoming a standalone division, Consumer Healthcare’s purpose is to serve healthier, fuller lives by offering moments of relief to our Patients & Consumers in our key platforms, including Allergy, Physical & Mental Wellness, Pain, Digestive Health. CHC does business in 133 countries; 4000 professionals work in marketing, sales and services teams. Learn more at www.sanofi.com/en/your-health/consumer-healthcare.

Consumer Healthcare is becoming a standalone division within Sanofi in order to become a faster moving, consumer and customer centric business as part of project CHLOE (Consumer HealthCare Lead Optimize Empower). This business and IT transformation will entail a standalone ERP, Financial, Systems, Regulatory and People.

Global Digital Team:

The team is charged with accelerating the shift to precision marketing and to e-commerce sales, scaling best-in-class data driven decision making tools, capturing new opportunities in the digital health space and uphauling disjointed commercial systems. Thisteam leverages both dedicated expertise internally at Sanofi, and delivery and deployment partners. It builds products, runs service / outsourcing contracts, and develops centers of excellence in technology and digital.

IShift: IShift is the new generation of SAP S4/ HANA, with one common framework across Sanofi BUs and geographies replacing JDEdwards in the US, OEP and unity in all other geographies.

JOB PURPOSE:

A corner stone of CHC transformation in the coming years, the Data Governance and Master Data Management Team defines the strategy and operationalization of data practices to lead the change and transform internal practices:

This position reports to Head of Data Governance and Master Data in CHC business unit in Sanofi

Own and drive strategy, vision, and execution for Data Governance & Security Framework.

Understand the challenges and opportunities associated with intelligent access provisioning, fine-grained data security and proactive detection and prevention of risks.

This role will require an advanced skill set across a variety of technologies. This individual will often have to learn on their own and remain on the cusp of new technologies in the data security services, focused technology stack including Informatica IDMC, PowerBI, ERP such as SAP & JDE, and AWS services.

This role will work closely with Business Partners, Data Stewards, Master Data Leads, Cloud Services, and IT Security functions.

As part of this team the Data Governance & Security Expert will be working across different data projects, applications, and processes to ensure data governance and security rules are followed.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

The Data Governance and Security Expert will be responsible of

Understand, protect, and monitor the data needs

Comply with industry regulations and secure critical data, such as, GDPR, CCPA, HIPPA, SOX & GxP etc. by partnering with Compliant and Regulatory departments

Implement Data Privacy Management system to automate risk remediation and alert mechanism where data is at risk

Work with Data Analytics team to create Data Monitoring Dashboard to track Risk Score, identify unprotected data, and data locations etc.

Implement robust User Access Management with SOD matrix policy

This position will be responsible for Data Operations and will closely work with Master Data Management Leads for Data Cataloging

Identify sensitive data and work with data engineering team to mask and/or encrypt before sharing the information

Reviews all data/data repositories on a periodic basis and ensures data is properly classified according to use, sensitivity, and importance and is maintained according to the predefined data lifecycle

Audits security precautions to ensure adequate protection is in place

Documents the full data lineage of enterprise data assets to ensure compliance with contracts and data regulations

Focus on discovering and classifying sensitive data to understand how it moves around the organization, where it may be located from a geographical perspective, who owns the data, and which people and processes access that data

Ensure that data is managed in compliance with applicable quality, regulatory (Data Privacy, GxP, SOX, etc.) and cybersecurity requirement

PROFILE:

15 years or more experience in Digital, 5+ years’ experience in Master Data Management and Data Governance

Experience of Data Governance and Data Security, preferably in FMCG

Experience in IICS and Informatica MDM, Semarchy, SAP MDG

Enterprise software deployment (design, build, integration, migration, go live, core model)

Experience in Informatica Data Privacy and Data Governance Management

Agile ways of working and large projects phased delivery

Data & Business intelligence domain and software experience is a plus

Experience of Interfacing heterogeneous systems and data sources

Working knowledge of Snowflake, DataBricks, Python/R, Tableau, Power BI

Working knowledge of Informatica, Layer 7 and Apigee

Working knowledge of procuring data from ERPs (SAP, JDE, etc.)

Education

Bachelor's degree

Fluent in English

International program management skills

Leading multicultural and multi-sourced teams

Multi-country deployment, involving local stakeholders

Cross functional leadership and influencing

Lead people and timelines in a matrix organization in compliant and professional manner

Quarterly budgeting

Excellent presentation to executive teams, writing, power point and organizational skills

Contracting and contract managing software vendors and system integrators

Strategic development in a multi-dimensional and rapid changing environment

Digital Program Leadership

Leading cross-functional teams to create Digital strategies and roadmaps

Design thinking and product development methods (blueprint, iteration, fast pivot, etc.)

Transformative digital and/or technology solutions track record (design, develop, deliver)

Relentless & creative problem-solving to deliver in a complex governance environment

Outstanding risk management and “get things done” mindset

Educates on basics (SEO, UI/UX, Agile, etc.) and complexity (architecture, emerging tech)

Fast learner in new industries and functions (e.g., legal, finance)

People leadership

Outstanding relationship-building, effective in a matrixed, culturally diverse organization

Influence skills at all levels of seniority, including people who do not work for him/her

Balance pushing for change and bringing people along; conflict resolution mindset

Fast & high-quality written communications, business cases and analyses (MS Office)

FMCH / IT skills and competencies

Job in FMCG & Governance (advanced)

Lean & Agile practices (advanced)

User Experience (intermediate)

Program / Product & Portfolio Management (advanced)

Financial Planning (Intermediate)

Vendor Management (advanced)

Transversal Skills & Competencies (Soft skills)

Business Acumen (advanced)

Business Partnership (advanced)

Transversal collaboration (advanced)

Strategic Thinking (advanced)

Decision Making (advanced)

Change Management (advanced)

Unique Vacations, Inc. - an affiliate of the worldwide representative for Sandals Resorts and Beaches Resorts - is seeking a forward-thinking Senior Data Analyst to join its remarkable Miami-based, in-house team.


WHO ARE WE?


Unique Vacations, Inc. is an affiliate of the worldwide representative of Sandals Resorts and Beaches Resorts. We provide exclusive, marketing, public relations, advertising, promotions, and creative services to showcase the Luxury Included experience, which guests have come to adore for 40 years and counting for Sandals & Beaches Resorts.

The Senior Data Analyst will focus on delivering powerful capabilities across engagement touch points by leveraging data and tools to bring the voice of customer (VOC) and customer experience (CX) to life. The Data Analytics & Business Intelligence team plays a vital role in strategy and vision across the organization. This position leads consumer data selection (querying), organization, and visualization for key strategic initiatives. The Sr. Analyst/Lead accomplishes this through partnerships internally within the company, external vendors, and software/data suppliers. The individual we are seeking for this opportunity is expected to be driven by excellence and have a passion for data, technology, and business strategy. This role is responsible for using a mix of technologies and methodologies to identify highly customized customer opportunities for sophisticated product innovation. This role also acts as a consultant that interfaces between strategy, technology, and operational teams to provide options and identify new opportunities that will improve effectiveness across the company. In addition, this role will develop, support, and automate performance reports/dashboards to help monitor performance, identify anomalies, and evaluate business impact, as well as assist in the development of consumer models and segmentation.

JOB ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Responsible for delivering impactful insights through data analysis that will drive business strategy and operational efficiency
Analyze guest behavior to identify patterns, uncover opportunities and create a common understanding of how guests interact with our brands.
Collect, mine, analyze and report data from various databases and reporting sources.
Build intuitive presentations, interfaces, infographics, and data visualizations to tell stories with data that convey key performance metrics, significant trends, and relationships across contact centers
Ideate and develop new metrics and analytical approaches, measuring performance for both tactical and strategic decision-making
Lead projects and requests from end-to-end, defining business needs, developing strategies and solutions that empower internal teams to make decisions efficiently

Strong analytical skills - with a proficient ability to read/write complex SQL queries for data analysis
Strong understanding of relational database concepts (i.e. Oracle, SQL Server, Teradata)
Experience with data visualization tools (OBIEE, POWER BI, etc.) and strong storytelling skills for technical and non-technical audiences
Experience with voice of customer technologies – Medallia and Qualtrics is a plus
MS Office tools, i.e., Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a track record of leveraging data insights to influence business decisions
Strong and effective communication, presentation, and written skills and ability to work in a global environment
Collaborative, self-motivated with a desire to lead strategic problem-solving, execution, and ownership
Entrepreneurship mentality and willing to be a leader in learning new spaces
Experience with large organizations and/or broad role responsibilities
Strong data and process UAT and quality assurance aptitude

We’ve maintained strong growth for several years by offering a wide variety of research solutions that delight our clients large and small across consumer products, health care, private equity, consulting, and other industries. We’ve helped nine clients achieve Top 10 U.S. launches in recent years. Our culture is friendly, casual, non-bureaucratic, and hard-working with current employees averaging 10+ years with the company. Employees work from home 4 days/week (local employees are a plus).

This role primarily handles in-depth or more complex research reports, but also helps the VP to lead important strategic initiatives, automation, and other efforts across the department.

Developing the best data analysis plan for research projects to address client learning needs

In collaboration with the Account Manager (who writes the questionnaire and verbal report analysis), creation and editing of Powerpoint reports and at times dashboards, that most effectively communicate the story and learnings to clients and ensures all project objectives are met

PRIMARY PURPOSE: Under the general direction of the Vice-President of Integrated Risk Management, this role will have strategic oversight for the governance practices related to Wings’ Data Management, and Information Security programs. This role will serve as the program lead for these critical governance functions and will operate in a cross-functional manner across the Credit Union. As a component of the Risk Management team, this role will be integral in the ongoing maturation of the Credit Union’s Enterprise Risk Management function for data and security governance risk.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Data Governance Responsibilities

Responsible for developing, maintaining, and maturing Wings’ Data Governance Program.
Provide governance oversight and consultative guidance for solutions to secure data including, but not limited to, the implementation of data classifications and engagement with existing data loss prevention (DLP) practices.
Manages and directs the development, implementation, administration, and evaluation of data governance initiatives.
Works in a highly collaborative manner with the Analytics Team and the Vice President – Analytics and Business Consulting Services to ensure alignment with strategy and practices/controls implemented.
Monitors trends and developments within Data Governance and recommends strategic direction and priorities to Senior Leadership.
Develops and maintains a data stewardship structure, including all training and support in alignment with programmatic direction.
Acts as subject matter expert for pertinent data policies and regulations and engages directly on all enterprise projects impacting data governance, handling and/or management.
Actively participates in the vendor selection process for all new 3rd parties who access Credit Union data.

Security Governance Responsibilities

Responsible for the strategic leadership of the security governance program and providing ongoing oversight and enhancement.
Maintains responsibility for the management of the Security Roadmap in alignment with program goals and expectations.
Development and implement effective policies and practices to secure protected data.
Works in a highly collaborative manner with the Network and Security Services Team and the Vice President – Infrastructure Services to ensure alignment with strategy and practices/controls implemented.
Aligns regulatory requirements to the core components of the security program.
In collaboration with Internal Audit, leads the strategy and execution of internal and external reviews, audits, and regulatory exams related to Wings’ information security program.
Assumes leadership and accountability for ongoing internal training for all Wings employees related to Information Security Topics and Security Awareness requirements.



EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE:

College degree in Business, Risk Management or Information Systems required. Advanced degree in a related discipline preferred.
4+ years' experience leading a team and working with other stakeholders.
6-8 years of hands-on experience working with risk management systems, data governance and information security frameworks
Designation as a Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) or ability to obtain the CISSP within the first year of employment required.
Experience in banking or financial services is highly preferred.
Comfort in interacting and presenting to Senior Leadership and/or Board of Directors.
Strong understanding of risk management, data governance and information security frameworks and a demonstrated ability to implement such frameworks.
Experience working with Federal, State, and Local regulators on Data Governance and Information Security program reviews and audit.
Exceptional project and program management skills.
Strong interpersonal skills.
High level of adaptability and flexibility.
Collaborative nature is essential as this role will interact in a predominantly cross-functional manner.
Relevant domain designation(s) and/or involvement in professional workgroups or associations is highly preferred.

We are currently seeking a Resource Coordinator/Data Analyst to join our team. We are looking for an energetic professional who enjoys working outdoors and values the freedom of working independently. If you enjoy a fast-paced environment and the challenges of a rewarding profession, consider a career in vegetation management with ECI.

Some of the most important characteristics of an ECI Resource Coordinator/Data Analyst is a desire to learn, an ability to adapt, and a commitment to engage in safe, constructive interactions with the public. You are accountable for advancing a culture of safety and excellence while providing quality and value to our customers and clients.

WHAT WE OFFER:

Industry competitive pay.
Company vehicle with fuel card to take to and from home & work.
Medical/Health/Dental/Vision/VOYA/Vacation Accrual/Paid Holidays/EAP eligibility on day one of employment (Full-Time Employees).
401K, life insurance, long-term disability eligibility first of the month after 3 months of service.
Sick Time eligibility on day 90 of employment.
Weekly pay checks and direct deposit.
Participation in Employee Referral Program (must meet eligibility requirements).
Boot and clothing program (company funded).
Ongoing training and assistance with obtaining industry certifications.




WHAT YOU WILL DO:

Provides first level support to internal and external customers for work management software suite and associated programs relating to work unit identification, data input, and invoice reconciliation for vegetation management activities relating to the utility transmission network.
Track defects within production processes and performs root cause analysis for functional issues to develop checklist for recurring problems.
Works to solve organizational problems by analyzing processes, workflows and planning activities to identify opportunities for automation or improvement.
Inputs, tracks, and monitors vegetation-related relay and sustained circuit outages into Work Studio and provides metrics to the Reliability and Performance Standards Team monthly.
Act as a liaison under the utility Information Technology group to work with management software providers to provide timely deliverables, requested upgrades, user licensing allocation, troubleshooting issues, and software implementation to ensure system functionality and continuity.
Maintains user rosters and updated permissions to ensure IT security and integrity of the utility networks.
Provides training assistance and planning guidance to work management software desktop, tablet, and thin client users in both office and field environments.
Maintains metrics, analyzes statistical data, and makes recommendations for budget corrections based on trend analysis.
All other duties and projects as assigned.




WHAT YOU NEED TO HAVE:

5+ years experience administering a multi-user work management software program with an emphasis on bettering the end user experience.
Knowledge of GIS (Geographic Information Systems), programming and cartography including analyzing spatial data through mapping software and other data sets.
Knowledge of database language such as SQL.
Proven work experience as a software Analyst or similar role.
Experience in maintaining a production related software for large number of users.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Customer interface skills and experience.
Strong computer skills and knowledge of QA databases and applications.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Meticulous attention to detail.
Computer skills, including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, GIS.




WHAT WOULD BE AMAZING TO HAVE:

Degree in computer science, geography, surveying, engineering, or related field.
GIS and Database entry skills preferred.
Knowledge of utility forestry, logging or agricultural maintenance a plus.
Being Bi-Lingual (Spanish) is a plus.

A DAY IN THE LIFE OF AN ECI FORESTER:

Working Environment

Work alone in an outdoor field environment; vehicle and foot patrol of utility power lines; remote locations as well as urban, city environment; physical demands and travel from site to site, including walking/hiking on various surfaces including flat, dry, wet, slippery, uneven, rough, steep terrain, hills, and slopes; exposure to noise, dust, grease, and all types of weather and temperature conditions; exposure to hazardous traffic conditions. Reasonable accommodations, if available, may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions.

Physical

The team member must have sufficient physical ability and mobility to work in a field environment; to walk up to 10 miles per day, stand, sit, and operate a motor vehicle for prolonged periods of time; to frequently stoop, bend, kneel, crouch, run, crawl, climb, reach, twist, grasp and make repetitive hand, arm and shoulder movement in the performance of daily duties (e.g., forcefully beat down brush); carry, push and/or pull light to heavy amounts of weight, frequently lift up to 10 lbs. and occasionally lift up to 60 lbs. (sandbags); to operate assigned equipment and vehicles; ability to verbally communicate to exchange information with public; ability to see and hear in normal range with or without correction; operate assigned field equipment, including handheld computer, range finder, fyrake, water backpack, shovel, and traffic cone.

Company Overview

Environmental Consultants (ECI) is a leading provider of vegetation and asset management consulting services to the utility industry. Successful professionals at ECI have come from a variety of backgrounds, including: forestry, arboriculture, natural resource management, biology, landscape maintenance, horticulture, nursery management, environmental sciences, geology, agriculture, parks & recreation management, urban forestry, geography, and more. For more information visit our website www.eci-consulting.com

All candidates must possess a valid driver's license and have a good driving record.

ECI is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. EOE/AA : Minority/Female/ Vets/ Disabled.

Security Clearance



Sandia is required by DOE to conduct a pre-employment drug test and background review that includes checks of personal references, credit, law enforcement records, and employment/education verifications. Applicants for employment need to be able to obtain and maintain a DOE L-level security clearance, which requires U.S. citizenship. If you hold more than one citizenship (i.e., of the U.S. and another country), your ability to obtain a security clearance may be impacted.

Applicants offered employment with Sandia are subject to a federal background investigation to meet the requirements for access to classified information or matter if the duties of the position require a DOE security clearance. Substance abuse or illegal drug use, falsification of information, criminal activity, serious misconduct or other indicators of untrustworthiness can cause a clearance to be denied or terminated by the DOE, resulting in the inability to perform the duties assigned and subsequent termination of employment.

Position Information



This Limited Term Employee (LTE) position is a temporary position for one year term, which may be renewed at Sandia's discretion up to a maximum of seven years.

Individuals in LTE positions may bid on regular Sandia positions as internal candidates, and in some cases may be converted to regular career positions during their term if warranted by ongoing operational needs, continuing availability of funds, and satisfactory job performance.

Currently, ManTech is seeking a motivated, career and customer-oriented Database Engineer to join our team in Hanover, MD.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Performing SQL database and application server development and administration
Developing system design solution that satisfies the system requirements and fulfills functional analysis
Performing database and software life-cycle activities ensuring highest level of system performance and availability and compliance with business requirements
Maintaining the integrity, security, and availability of multiple databases.
Provide support for disaster recovery, performance analysis and tuning, index maintenance, and monitoring of data
Administering, maintaining, developing, and implementing policies and procedures for ensuring the security and integrity of the database.
Evaluating and recommending available database management system (DBMS) products.
Organizing and formatting data for efficient query and storage processes
Communicating with other program personnel, government overseers, and senior executives.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Communications Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Information Management, Program Management, or related degree and 20 years in a technical role in projects and programs for Government or Industry customers.
Shall have eight (8) years experience providing technical direction for the development, engineering, integration and testing of complex hardware/software systems
Shall have five (5) years experience in developing strategic and implementation plans for large-scale information systems.
Shall have seven (7) years experience developing documentation required in support of both technical and training requirements.
Shall have four (4) years experience in reverse engineering and re-engineering.
Shall have four (4) years experience in leading system definition, trade-off and design activities.
Shall have four (4) years experience in leading analysis of system requirements and components.
Shall have four (4) years experience in performing system audits to ensure intended system functionality, operation and performance requirements are achieved.
Shall have four (4) years experience in system performance analysis.
Shall have four (4) years experience in planning the next generation system
Shall have ten (10) years experience developing, delivering testing and supporting integrated hardware and software systems with functional requirements within a CMMI Level 2 or the customer way Process structure.
Shall have seven (7) years experience in developing system architecture and design including:
Software
Hardware
Communications
Interface requirements
Must possess experience in all phases of database engineering to include requirements analysis, development, testing and integration, maintenance and problem diagnosis/resolution and/or experience in phases of applications systems analysis to include evaluation and design, integration and optimization of complex systems
Shall have IAT Level II or willing to get within 6 months of start date.
Must have experience with communication applications, database management, use of programming languages and knowledge of storage and retrieval methods.



Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with PostgreSQL and PostGIS
Knowledgeable of Service Oriented Architecture
Knowledgeable of AWS System Development
Experience with tuning database performance
Experience with Atlassian Tool Suite (JIRA, Confluence)

Security Clearance Requirements:

Active/Current Top-Secret SCI with Poly

Physical Requirements:

Reaching, Speaking, Standing, Talking, Working with computers/certs, Working with data, Ability to handle stress & work under pressure, oral & written communication skills, ability to use MS office, ability to use a PC, Interpersonal & people skills, multi-tasking ability

As a member of our management team, responsibilities include setting the strategy and overseeing the execution of the department’s business plan, staff management and development, operations, technology and business development.

We bring old buildings back to life with cutting-edge technology and leading-edge designs. We evaluate; we collaborate; we innovate.

Job_title: Risk Adjustment Strategic Manager - Data Reporting
Job_description:
Location: The selected candidate must reside in on the Northeastern States: CT, DE, FL, GA, IN, KY, ME, MD, MA, MI, NH, NY, NJ, NC, OH, PA, RI, SC, TN, VT, VA, WV.

How will you make an impact:

The Risk Adjustment Strategic Manager is responsible for serving as a strategic partner for the Medicare business to Enterprise Risk Adjustment, Business Operations, Regulatory Compliance and Internal Audit business units. Identifies trends and strategizes how the business can be more efficient and effective in the market. Utilizes trend data to provide more strategic direction to providers. Primary duties may include, but are not limited to:

Assists management by overseeing day to day operations for risk adjustment programs including both prospective and retrospective, claims, vendor quality, and audits.
Develops metrics, policies, and procedures in support of required deliverables and validation of programs return on investment while ensuring the programs are in compliance with Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) program requirements.
Serves as a strategic partner to the business and contributes to ideas and solutions.
Influences others and works effectively to establish and develop working relationships both internally and externally with business stakeholders.
Obtains and complies trend data and educates providers.
Collaborates with the operations risk and compliance teams in implementing and deploying Enterprise Risk and Compliance initiatives, processes, and tools.
Effectively drives remediation of risks and issues by collaborating with Business Operations, Internal Audit and Regulatory Compliance.
Finds toot cause and recommends innovative solutions.
Provides oversight and ensures complete and accurate coding for Medical Revenue Management programs driving the revenue we receive from CMS.
Serves as a subject matter expert on Medicare risk adjustment payment methodology.
Leads and consults with operations on ad hoc requests/special projects.
Works collaboratively with Enterprise Risk Adjustment team, Business Operations, Regulatory Compliance, and Internal Audit.

Minimum Requirement: Requires a BA/BS in a related field and minimum of 5 years of experience in a managed care setting with extensive risk adjustment experience with a focus on CMS audit experience; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.

Preferred Qualification, Skills & Experiences: Experience working with data, reporting and analytics strongly preferred. Travel may be required.

For candidates working in person or remotely in the below locations, the salary* range for this specific position is $92,720 to $166,896

Locations: California; Colorado; Nevada; Washington State; Jersey City, NJ; New York City, NY; Ithaca, NY and Westchester County, NY

Be part of an Extraordinary Team

Elevance Health is a health company dedicated to improving lives and communities - and making healthcare simpler. Previously known as Anthem, Inc., we have evolved into a company focused on whole health and updated our name to better reflect the direction the company is heading.

We are looking for leaders at all levels of the organization who are passionate about making an impact on our members and the communities we serve. You will thrive in a complex and collaborative environment where you take action and ownership to solve problems and lead change. Do you want to be part of a larger purpose and an evolving, high-performance culture that empowers you to make an impact?

We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, and incentive bonus programs (unless covered by a collective bargaining agreement), medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, stock purchase plan, life insurance, wellness programs and financial education resources, to name a few.

The health of our associates and communities is a top priority for Elevance Health. We require all new candidates to become vaccinated against COVID-19. If you are not vaccinated, your offer will be rescinded unless you provide - and Elevance Health approves - a valid religious or medical explanation as to why you are not able to get vaccinated that Elevance Health is able to reasonably accommodate. Elevance Health will also follow all relevant federal, state and local laws.

Elevance Health has been named as a Fortune Great Place To Work in 2021, is ranked as one of the 2021 World's Most Admired Companies among health insurers by Fortune magazine, and a Top 20 Fortune 500 Companies on Diversity and Inclusion. Join Macquarie's Commodities Markets and Finance (CMF) division as a Chief Data Scientist responsible for building a global data analytics capability to increase data awareness and identify opportunities to leverage our information assets, enabling data informed actions across our business. You will achieve this through a program of education & training, data product development, and analytics technology leadership.

You will be passionate about developing communities of practice across our business, bringing people together to understand the potential of data & analytics and adopting best practices. To compliment this, you will develop a formal education and training program to uplift CMF’s capabilities in the understanding and use of data & analytics to derive real business value.

Working in close partnership with desk analysts, traders, and related teams, you will leverage your track record of consistent delivery and customer obsession to provide data analytics products of value across the CMF business using an agile methodology. In addition to this flow of near-term value deliverables, you will work with senior business management to propose, initiate, and manage innovation projects to push the boundaries of what’s possible at Macquarie: sponsoring moon-shot initiatives to make blue-sky ideas around data, digitisation, and automation real. This role provides a unique opportunity to combine both operational delivery and visionary innovation.

Your experience of leading the development and use of data analytics technologies will allow you to act as product owner of CMF’s data analytics platforms: guiding the technology organization on priorities and direction in the development of easy to use, governed and compliant, advanced data platforms. You will provide leadership and sponsorship for the development and adoption of new, innovative data analytics technologies and external services for CMF.

This unique opportunity to build out a green field function within an existing, successful commodities organization is unparalleled. To ensure its success you will draw upon your experience of successfully building and growing new green-field teams and capabilities, within the context of a large, mature global organization. You will be able to build strong relationships with staff across seniorities, global locations, and business lines to advance CMF’s data agenda.

There is an increasing importance attached to regulations relating to data, analytics, and AI. A deep appreciation of the role of risk management, compliance and governance on data and analytics, and the vision to develop data and analytics capabilities that are compliant by default will be key to the long-term success of the role.

As CMF Chief Data Scientist, you will have had exposure to financial and energy markets and to leading global teams. You will have a background in analytics with an advanced degree (Masters or Ph. D) in an engineering or mathematical subject.

If you are motivated to join a leading global provider within the markets industry, please apply online now.

About Commodities and Global Markets

Commodities and Global Markets provides clients with an integrated, end-to-end offering across global markets including equities, fixed income, foreign exchange and commodities.

Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths, and an inclusive workplace enables us to embrace that diversity to deliver more innovative and sustainable solutions for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. At Macquarie, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If you're inspired to deliver on our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’, we want you on our team. If you need adjustments made to the recruitment process, please reach out to your recruiter.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, marital status, gender identity or any other impermissible criterion or circumstance. Macquarie also takes affirmative action in support of its policy to hire and advance in employment of individuals who are minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

We equip our people with the support to work in a range of flexible ways. Talk to us about what working arrangements would help you thrive.

#LI-DS1




About Macquarie

A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.

Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 19,200+ employees and offices in 34 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.

You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.

Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

Job_title: Quantitative Analytics Tech Lead - Data Tools and Infrastructure (3 Days in Office)
Job_description:
At Freddie Mac, you will do important work to build a better housing finance system and you’ll be part of a team helping to make homeownership and rental housing more accessible and affordable across the nation.

Employees, contingent workers and visitors are no longer required to show proof of vaccination to be on-site. Effective January 2023, Freddie Mac’s hybrid work arrangement is 3 days in the office (specifically Tuesday, Wednesday & Thursday).

Position Overview:

Are you looking for an opportunity to contribute to research and analytic tools? Do you want to work with a team that provides insights to stakeholders to help drive decisions and help achieve company objectives? We are looking for a team member who is ready to apply their analytic skills to support data infrastructure for analytics that matters for Freddie Mac’s mission.

Our Impact:

The Housing Insights and Solutions team in Freddie Mac’s Single-Family Client and Community Engagement Division offers research and technical expertise on housing data and policy issues with a focus on access to credit and underserved communities. We conduct and present research and analytics to provide insights for the affordable housing goals, duty to serve underserved markets, and business decisions in pursuit of our community mission.

Your Impact:
Create automated Tools to provide senior management and our stakeholders with insights to achieve DTS, Affordable, Equity and ESH objectives.
Data SME for Housing Insights and Solutions and POC within Freddie Mac
Support Housing Insights and Solutions team through data preparation, complex data and statistical analysis, and model output assessment.
Design and implement processes and analytical tools to proactively support our community mission.
Write programs to clean and analyze large volumes of structured and unstructured data.
Research data tools and sources to develop efficient processes to retrieve and use relevant information.
Refresh information, tools, processes and analytical systems with modifications as needed.
Prepare and maintain documentation of data processes and programs in use.
Maintain working relationships with other departments and divisions.

Qualifications:
Master's degree in data science, economics, statistics or a related quantitative field
Coursework or work experience conducting analysis with programming languages such as SAS, STATA, R, Python, or Matlab and database skills such as SQL.
8 to 10 years of experience·

Keys to Success in this Role:
Strong programming background and experience
Knowledge of best data structuring practices
Experience with large and complex datasets across various environments

Current Freddie Mac employees please apply through the internal career site.

Today, Freddie Mac makes home possible for one in four home borrowers and is one of the largest sources of financing for multifamily housing. Join our smart, creative and dedicated team and you’ll do important work for the housing finance system and make a difference in the lives of others.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion at our company. Job_title: Senior Business Process & Data Analyst, Energy
Job_description:
CHS Inc. is a leading global agribusiness owned by farmers, ranchers and cooperatives across the United States that provides grain, food and energy resources to businesses and consumers around the world. We serve agriculture customers and consumers across the United States and around the world. Most of our 10,000 employees are in the United States, but today we have employees in 19 countries. At CHS, we are creating connections to empower agriculture.

Summary


CHS has an exciting opportunity in our Enterprise Global Process group. We are looking for a Senior Business Process and Data Analyst supporting Energy, to participate in the design and documentation of business processes. You must have excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, be a strong team player who thrives in a team-oriented environment and comfortable working with ambiguity and a fast paced and changing environment. This position is located at our Corporate Headquarters in Inver Grove Heights, MN. To be considered, candidates must live in the Minneapolis/St. Paul metro area in order to work a flexible hybrid schedule (2-3 days in the office per week).

Responsibilities

Analyze and evaluate current state work methods, procedures, security roles, controls, information, and documentation systems.
Conduct interviews to extract process knowledge and translate into process maps.
Document core operational processes, creating detailed best practices and associated materials.
Prepare and communicate regular project status reports with project stakeholders and business process owners.
Follow change management process to ensure that updates are fully documented. Work closely with functional and business areas to ensure documented operational processes are understood and implemented consistently.
Develop materials, conduct training and provide coaching to ensure staff across the company understand how to effectively use the process improvement methodology and tools.
Monitor use of new process documentation by developing and maintains standard, custom and ad-hoc reports.
Identify critical success factors, metrics and KPIs in process analysis and design.
Support project feasibility and business case development, matching projects to the strategic priorities of the Business Partners.
Develop and track business process related metrics.
Maintain and promote a strong safety culture and follow all safety policies, procedures and regulations. Identify and communicate workplace hazards and correct or seek assistance in correcting unsafe actions or conditions.
Minimum Qualifications (required)

Bachelor's degree preferred in Finance, Business, Information technology, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology Management (or equivalent in years of experience, education or training)
4+ years of business analysis and/or project management experience to include:
Knowledge of process mapping and analysis techniques
Broad knowledge of different qualitative and quantitative analytical methods, approaches and tactics
Background in Finance support and capabilities
Additional Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree or higher specifically in Business or Engineering
SAP security role mapping
PMP, Lean certification or LSS Green/ Black Belt
5+ years of experience and/or participation in cross functional project teams
Knowledge of Project Management or Process Improvement techniques (Six Sigma, Lean, etc.)
Understanding of or experience with centralized processes and organizations that support SAP functional areas (Shared Services/CoE)
Physical Requirements

Pre-employment screening is based on the job requirements and industry guidelines and may or may not be required for the position. If required, selected candidates must pass pre-employment screenings to include all or a combination of drug, criminal, motor vehicle check, physical requirements and FMSCA Clearinghouse.

CHS offers a competitive total compensation package. Benefits include Health, Dental, Vision, Hearing, Life Insurance, Health and Day Care Savings Accounts, Paid Vacation, 401K, Company Funded Pension, Profit Sharing, Long and Short Term Disability, Tuition reimbursement, and Adoption assistance.

CHS is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Full Time, Flexible weekday schedule. 36 hours/week.

Pay Range is between $23.21-$34.80/hr, depending on years of relevant and like experience.

Boulder Community Health is a Certified Level II Trauma Center. In 2022, we celebrated the 100thanniversary of the founding of our organization. We are honored to hold the awards of 2021 U.S. News & World ‘Best Hospitals for Maternity Care’, 2019 Best Medical Facility from Boulder Weekly, and Best Local Employer from Daily Camera. Come be part of an independent, community-focused health system; feel good knowing that your work will make a difference in people’s lives and positively contribute to the community.

POSITION SUMMARY

Coordinates the cancer data management system to promote quality care for the cancer patients at Boulder Community Health. Maintains compliance with the requirements for an approved cancer program and national accreditation program for breast centers set forth by the American College of Surgeons Commission on Cancer. Maintains compliance with the requirements for mandatory statewide reporting set forth by the Colorado Cancer Registry and Department of Public health.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS

Education or Formal Training

Accredited Record Technician (RHIT) or Registered Record Administrator (RHIA) preferred. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) required. ICD-9 Coding, cancer staging and word-processing. Expertise required with Excel spreadsheets and CNExT (or similar automated cancer registry system) ACOS web-based data upload process including but not limited to the National Call for Data (NCDB) and the Facility Identifiable data (FIPS level 1 & 2). State of Colorado Public Health and Environment compliance with state and federal laws mandating data collection and compliance in the research of those diagnosed with and treated for cancer. The Cancer Registry is responsible for guarding the hospitals compliance and fostering a cohesive relationship with the State liaisons and personnel and providing documentation to them upon request, to evidence the hospitals compliance with the state and federal statutes.

Special Qualifications (Licensure, Registration, etc.)

Bachelor or Associate Degree in health information technology are related field preferred. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) required.

Knowledge, Skill and Ability

Knowledge of all American College of Surgeons and State of Colorado requirements for Cancer Registry accreditation process. Working knowledge of all levels of accreditation and evidence of experience with standards.
Evidence of ability to produce an annual report and comply with procedures for reporting to the state as required by American College of Surgeons.
Demonstrated ability for successful completion of ACOS accreditation survey.
Demonstrated excellent communication skills:
Writing ability including accurate grammar and spelling as evidenced by concise and clear report writing, compilation and organization of annual reports, preparation of tumor conference agendas, and synopses of data.
Verbal skills as evidenced by ability to communicate with all members of the health care team, the state tumor registry and patients when appropriate.
Demonstrated ability to execute a successful breast & cancer conference.
Demonstrated ability to accurately analyze and abstract patient records with an average time of 60 minutes or less per abstract.
Detail-oriented with ability to make independent decisions and use critical thinking skills.
Demonstrated ability to execute accomplishment of ACOS required registry data studies
Demonstrated ability to execute scientific studies leading to sound data to be presented to the Cancer Committee as a source of outcomes analysis.
Demonstrated ability to keep apprised of the ever-changing policies and procedures of the state of Colorado and the data reporting elements involved in this process.
Demonstrated ability to research and comply with changing federal agency regulations.
Demonstrated ability to stay up to date with regulatory and complementary agencies to adjust hospital abstracting when a specific precedent has been changed or set. The agencies include but are not limited to; coding schemes (CPT, ICD-0-3, ICD-9-CM), Surveillance Epidemiology & End Results (SEER), American Joint Commission on Cancer (AJCC).
Must have knowledge and ability to perform required aspects of the computer and its programs: follow-up letters, statistical reports, Colorado State Cancer Registry reporting and other required medical and cancer data.

Experience

At least five years of experience as a cancer data registrar in an ACOS accredited Cancer Program.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Assists in developing and maintaining cancer program standards by ACoS/COC and NAPBC.
Coordinates maintenance of appropriate files, reports and other cancer related data to ensure approval standards by the American College of Surgeons and the Colorado State Cancer Registry. Preparing graphs and statistics.
Prepares cancer reports and statistical data of the cancer program and breast center activities to administration, physician, outside agencies and/or Colorado State Cancer Registry.
Develops and implement changes in cancer registry policies and procedures to ensure CoC and NAPBC requirements
Monitors quality data (including periodic audits) to ensure data quality and compliance with state and CoC and NAPBC requirements.
Coordinates, plans, attends, documents, and promotes attendance at all Tumor Conferences.
Schedules a minimum of 4 Cancer Committee meetings a year on the medical staff calendar.
Drafts Cancer Committee agendas to represent each standard outlined by the ACOS. Allocate time on the agenda for each coordinator and specialty to give report, at the designated intervals required by the ACOS, if not more often.
Serves as a member of the Cancer Committee.
Coordinates Cancer Registry abstractors and oversight of all of their encompassing cancer registry activities.

About Boulder Community Health and Boulder, Colorado

Uncompromising medical excellence delivered with respect and compassion. Since 1922, Boulder Community Health has built a strong reputation on these values. As community-owned and operated not-for-profit hospital and clinic locations, we remain dedicated to the evolving needs of our citizens and providing access to high-quality care. Nestled in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains, the Boulder lifestyle is conductive to enjoying the outdoors and brings a fresh perspective to healthcare practice. Surround yourself by natural beauty and an active, life-embracing community. Enjoy state-of-the-art facilities and equipment along with competitive compensation and benefits, including health/dental/life, tuition reimbursement, on-site fitness center, Employee Wellness, Employee Activities & Discounts, and many more!


Location: Boulder Community Health · Oncology Services Admin
Schedule: Full-time, Days - 8 hour shifts, M - F, flexible schedule

Job_title: Global Risk Data & Business Intelligence Manager
Job_description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO

Global Risk Management (RM) is dedicated to identifying and managing significant risk exposure at BCG.

The Data & Business Intelligence Manager position involves designing, managing, and deploying data analytics, reports, and dynamic dashboards. The tools and dashboard created will be utilized by both the Assurance and Advisory team and key functional stakeholders. This position is responsible for extracting data from multiple sources, processing and validating data, and conducting root cause and trend analysis. The Data & Business Intelligence Manager will also present analytic findings to various stakeholders.


In addition, this role will participate in risk assessment for BCG Offices, functions and processes and looks to provide management with an independent and objective assessment of business risk and internal controls.

The successful candidate should be comfortable performing the following: writing queries in programing languages such as SQL and Python, developing analytical visualizations using Alteryx and Tableau (e.g. building complex dashboards), understanding cloud data warehousing (e.g. Snowflake), business intelligence architecture, application and design, Machine Learning & AI concepts. The candidate must also understand and assess risks across a wide variety of business areas, build relationships with diverse stakeholders, manage a complex network of individuals, influence change management across the organization, prioritize issues, and escalate appropriately.

YOU'RE GOOD AT
We are looking for someone with a passion and understanding of data analytics and business intelligence, risk management, change management, and global business. The role will entail the following:

Data & Business Analytics (60%)
Assist the team with developing short-, medium- and long-term data analytics strategy
Review, update, and investigate pertinent data from various data sources to ensure a high level of quality, accuracy, and timeliness
Query multiple data sources using programing languages such as SQL and Python
Produce visualization and developing dashboards using Tableau/Alteryx
Analyze data and provide insights and recommendations for organizational planning and operations.
Create business analytics by synthesizing information from multiple sources of data for business decisions and strategic planning.
Demonstrate continuous effort to improve operations, streamline work processes, and work cooperatively and jointly to provide quality deliverables
Provide training and education to the team on data and analytics related topics

Office Risk Review Program (20%)
Meet with Office Leadership and the Global Functions to lead the planning, execution, and post-review efforts for a portfolio of Office risk reviews and BCG’s extension businesses.
Travel to any BCG’s Office throughout the world and work with the team to develop and maintain the risk review work program
Assist the team with the execution of risk reviews to assess the risk and controls environment in the offices and test the effectiveness of controls
Perform substantive tests of transactions
Prepare timely and comprehensive documentation of findings and recommendations, including local management comments
Maintain risk profiles for each office and prioritizing offices for a visit
Act as a risk liaison with the local office, providing support and education on important risk issues
Global Process Review Program (20%)
Lead targeted functional/operating risk reviews, which are focused on global or regional processes.
Responsibilities will include defining the project scope and strategy, conducting process walk-throughs, performing detailed testing, drafting detailed reporting/action plans, and following up on implementation efforts.
Focus on the scope and objectives of each review to ensure the highest risk areas are addressed and the key findings are communicated
Evaluate, in detail, the use of new digital technologies and the risks these solutions may pose to the global functions as BCG’s business operations continue to evolve and modernize.
Develop relationships with key functional leaders.
Work with Global Risk Management Senior Director to develop an annual plan of global functional risk reviews; align staffing and coordinate scheduling with key stakeholders.
Monitor trends and emerging issues for reporting to leadership (i.e., Audit and Risk Committee).
Act as a risk liaison with the global functions, providing support and education on important risk issues.
YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)
An academic degree in a relevant discipline: Data Science, Business Analytics, Mathematics or Computer Science
5+ years successful experience related to Data Warehouse and Data Analytics, preferably in professional services, or the consulting industry.
Understanding of enterprise data warehouses (Snowflake), business intelligence architecture, application and design, ML & AI concepts
Deep knowledge of current analytics technologies and software applications such as SQL/Python query language, Alteryx, Tableau and Microsoft tools
Strong analytical skills with detail orientation; strong communication skills – written and verbal
Ability to work cross-functionally in a global environment
Ability to travel to all BCG office locations Worldwide
Travel is required approximately 15% of the time, with the need to be flexible if additional travel is required. Travel is typically one week in length (may include weekends) but must be adaptable for risk reviews of up to 2+ weeks if required. Travel is generally planned well in advance but must be flexible to travel on limited notice.
Travel will align with BCG’s Covid-19 protocols and applicable laws and regulations.
YOU'LL WORK WITH
Local/system/regional operational leaders, global functional leaders, and BCG leadership. BCG's Chief Risk Officer leads the team, which is comprised of team members across various cities and countries. This role will report to the Global Risk Management Director
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
Candidates should be aware that BCG currently maintains a policy requiring all US & Canada based employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Newly hired employees must be fully vaccinated prior to their employment start date. BCG is an equal opportunity employer and will provide a reasonable accommodation to those unable to be vaccinated for medical or religious reasons where it is not an undue hardship to the company to do so as provided under applicable federal, state, provincial and local law.

Job_title: Americas Credit, Fixed Income Corporate Actions Data Specialist
Job_description:
Bloomberg runs on data. In Data, we are responsible for onboarding, analyzing, and supplying data to answer our clients' most pressing questions. Our product is responsible for corporate action events affecting corporate bonds and preferred shares.
Whether you are sourcing relevant market data from new or existing providers, processing complex financial data or implementing technology solutions to enhance our processes and software, your work will ensure that we deliver accurate market data to the financial world first!

What you can expect from this opportunity:
You are the type of person that looks beyond the headline. You live for the detail and understand the importance of the underlying data that drives news and analysis. You enjoy the challenge of solving complex problems. You are just the sort of person we are looking for to join Data.

Bloomberg Data is looking for a highly motivated and driven individual to develop and expand the scope of Bloomberg's Fixed Income Corporate Actions Product. You will be part of a fast-paced environment and will be responsible for secondary market transactions happening on North American corporate bonds and preferred shares. Analysts within the team are in constant communication with liability management desks and other market participants who are involved with voluntary and mandatory distribution, redemption, and reorganization events. You will play a key role in producing financial content, calculations, research notes and analyses for our clients using the Bloomberg Terminal. Demonstrating a commitment to learning and a passion for the Fixed Income industry is required.

We'll trust you to:
Build positive and accountable relationships with clients, colleagues, and partners of the Fixed Income Corporate Actions product (including buy- and sell-side firms)
Acquire an understanding of the workflows designed to deliver class-leading quality while meeting or exceeding the timeliness demands of the market
Collaborate with colleagues to implement solutions and frameworks to enhance our processes, software, and data offerings
Maintain the existing proprietary database
Improve the relationships of our Terminal users to provide subject matter expertise by quickly and accurately answering client inquiries
Integrate your natural interests and strengths with the Fixed Income product to add value beyond data acquisition and remediation. Explore new strengths and opportunities by upskilling.
Support product development
You'll need you to have:
Relevant experience in a role within the financial markets, data analysis, information technology, credit document analysis, or research
2+ years of work experience is highly preferred
Proven ability to build and maintain client relationships
Effective research and analysis skills with attention to detail
Excellent communication, customer service, and teamwork skills
An interest in technology (Python, SQL, etc) and data analysis
Ability to spot market trends and act on them to enhance depth and breadth of coverage
Legal authorization to work in the US without visa sponsorship now or in the future
Does this sound like you?
Apply if you think we're a good match! We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are.

Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, ancestry, color, gender identity or expression, genetic predisposition or carrier status, marital status, national or ethnic origin, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, sexual and other reproductive health decisions, parental or caring status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy or parental leave, protected veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, or any other classification protected by applicable law.

Oasis Systems has an exciting opportunity for a Senior Python Data Scientist to support the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) in Washington, DC. The contractor shall provide support in data analytics (including descriptive and predictive analytics and data mining), large data manipulation, data visualization, and the use of data analytic tools. Activities that the contractor may be tasked to perform include gathering requirements from stakeholders, conducting financial data analysis in a Big Data environment, and creating reports and documentation.

TRAVEL: N/A

Job_title: Supervisor, QA Data Integrity, Computer Software Validation
Job_description:
Jubilant HollisterStier LLC, a well-established member of the business community in Spokane, Washington, provides a complete range of services to support the pharmaceutical and biopharmaceutical industries. The Allergy business is a worldwide leader in the manufacture of allergenic extracts, targeted primarily at treating allergies and asthma. Jubilant HollisterStier is also a nationally recognized contract manufacturer of sterile injectable vials, and lyophilized products. Jubilant HollisterStier is a proud member of the Jubilant Pharma family.

Our Promise: Caring, Sharing, Growing

We will, with the utmost care for the environment and society, continue to enhance value for our customers and stakeholders by providing innovative products and economically efficient solutions’ through growth, cost effectiveness and wise investment of resources.


Job Description:

Supervisor, QA Data Integrity/Governance and Computer Software Validation - Responsible for the overall supervision and execution of CSV activities/systems compliance and data governance and will be accountable for all computer and IT related compliances at the JHS-Spokane site. Support deviation investigations related to site level IT system and applications. SME for site external & internal audit DI/CSV support. SME for site in managing IT system compliance related issues and leading efforts related to compliance in these areas.



The QA Supervisor oversees the Quality Assurance team and assures that team outputs meet necessary quality standards.
Provides daily tactical planning and oversight of QA CSV and Data Integrity programs to ensure that all work meets the requirements as defined by Standard Operating Procedures and GMP.
Establishes and maintains standard operating procedures and records associated with the above listed areas of responsibility.
This position provides direction and support of the daily operations in the Quality Assurance Validation and Quality Systems Department through scheduling, assignment of tasks among the QA team.
The individual in this position will establish and maintain a program to ensure the appropriate training and documentation of training of QA team (including safety, cGMP, and job functions).
The individual in this position will also be responsible for providing supervisor oversight for the QA team, including conducting performance evaluations of that staff.
Partner with other departments to ensure site is compliant.


Qualifications:

Bachelor of Science required.
Minimum 5 years related experience with Bachelor of Science, -OR- 10 years experience without Bachelor of Science.

Bloomberg runs on data, and Data is responsible for acquiring it, contributing value and providing that value to our clients. We collect, analyze, process and publish the data which is the backbone of our iconic Bloomberg Terminal.

The Debt Capital Markets Automation (DCMA) team builds solutions that introduce efficiencies in data workflows, ensure optimum data quality and add new value for our clients.

What's the role?
The DCMA Team is a dynamic group of individuals who love to tackle challenging problems with technical solutions. Our focus is to use our technical skills to introduce efficiencies in workflow processes, improve data quality, ensure timely execution of published data and add new value for our clients.

As a Data Analyst, you will apply your problem-solving skills to develop and manage the data pipelines, and use your data analysis skills to find opportunities that require us to build automation processes and human-in-the-loop workflows within Debt Capital Markets. The work involved would vary from using our Bloomberg Data Technology Stack to write and productionize data pipelines using python, develop regression, classification and data-point extraction techniques using machine-learning methodologies, generating reports with data visualizations highlighting KPIs, and building prototypes using BQNT with our product teams.

As an experienced data analyst, you will be expected to drive projects, lead conversations, collaborate with Engineering and Product and mentor junior members of the group who are looking to develop technically. We are looking for highly motivated and driven individuals with a passion for data and the technology that surrounds it.

We'll trust you to:
Use your engineering skills and data science knowledge to develop and support the data pipelines and processes that we build for our clients and firm-wide partners
Use your data analysis skills to find opportunities to build automated solutions for data standardization, ETL pipelines, and human-in-the-loop data processing
Design, develop, and deploy data quality validations to drive quality improvements
Use your statistical knowledge and data visualization to report on results of ongoing operations and projects, as required
Partner with a wide variety of collaborators, including Engineering, Product and Sales, to drive and lead product development and execution
Stay on top of the latest developments in your field and suggest improvements to supported workflows
You'll need to have:
Bachelor's/Master's degree in STEM-related field or equivalent professional working experience
Preferable experience in Data Science/ML, Computational Finance, Statistical modeling
Python programming experience addressing business problems and working on big data sets
Proficiency with python, git, UNIX, software engineering principals, SDLC, MDLC
Proven track record of using technology to innovate data products and processes
Strong passion for data, technology and finance with the aspiration to work in the financial/FinTech services industry
Problem-solving mentality and attention to detail
Legal authorization to work full-time in the United States and not require visa sponsorship now or in the future

We'd love to see:

Financial Market experience, including an understanding of how benchmarks are used by our clients
Experience using Data Tech Stack components
Experience using data analysis and visualization tools to complement our research and approach

Job_title: Product Manager - Data Management Lab, Bloomberg Data Dictionary
Job_description:
Bloomberg's Data Management Lab enables internal and external users to efficiently leverage an elite data set to perform analysis, uncover vital insights. and make financial decisions. To this end, the Data Management Lab empowers our Data professionals to understand their domains end-to-end, make their products "ready-to-use", and improve the way users interact with our data. We focus on five areas of data management: discoverability, accessibility, appraisability, interoperability and consistency.

In this role you will be working with the Bloomberg Data Dictionary (BDD) team. We are in the midst of taking our metadata models and data management products to the next level. The goal is to promote the use of our data models by both external clients and internal applications. This person will have a high level of business, communication, and technology skills, so that they can build working prototypes as well as work optimally with internal stakeholders and clients.

The Role:

We are enhancing existing metamodels and metadata management systems. This includes building new tools and systems to manage, govern, link and discover metadata. It also involves developing and improving new functions and services to distribute metadata.

In this exciting role, we expect you to deliver a product vision and implement that vision in collaboration with Engineering, Product, and Data. You will be a key person in developing technical products that provide best-in-class customer experience. You will understand the requirements of both internal users, and external clients, and then shape the product offering to meet their needs. You would be familiar with specifying requirements including writing JIRA stories. You would have deep technical experience around using structured data models and data sets to solve complex business demands.

What's in it for you:
An influential business role within a fast-growing area of Bloomberg's Data business.
Broad scope to craft and specify meta-model for the company.
We'll trust you to:
Take responsibility for Bloomberg Data Dictionary's technology products.
Develop a product roadmap by evaluating what is possible and viable
Communicate the roadmap across the organization, and work with engineering to execute the roadmap
Develop functional and technical requirements by leading conversations among internal partners (Engineering, Product, Data, Sales), and clients
You'll need to have:
Bachelor's (or Master's) degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related technical discipline
4+ years of relevant work experience
Experience in developing and implementing technology systems
Understanding of data modelling (either ER, RDF, or other similar techniques)
Understanding of financials markets and how Bloomberg's clients use our data
The ability to address multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment
We'd love to see:
Knowledge of metadata systems and models
Knowledge of linked data and knowledge graphs
Knowledge of Market Data and Reference Data

Job_title: Senior Software Engineer - Data Platform - Bloomberg Second Measure
Job_description:
Bloomberg is a data company that is redefining how people use alternative data. This transformation started with Bloomberg Second Measure (BSM), a data product for understanding company performance and consumer trends using consumer transaction data. These financial transactions are the foundation upon which we build as we acquire, ingest, enrich, and distribute additional alternative data sets to innovate through our novel and valuable data products.

The Alternative Data Platform team is a software and systems engineering team focused on providing a usable, scalable, and reliable platform for building data products from alternative data. Our platform provides primitives and abstractions enabling our users to creatively solve problems and run the powerful analytical workflows necessary for alternative data. We empower our users to focus on the data by reducing the pain and frustration of using existing data and analytics tools, and adopt new and innovative technologies to enable the continuous evolution necessary for innovation.

As the foundational engineering team supporting alternative data, the team has two core responsibilities:

Design, build, and maintain the data processing platform that empowers data scientists, data analysts, and data engineers to rapidly prototype and autonomously build, develop, and release data products
Design, build, and maintain the query and data infrastructure critical to the research, development, and publication of alternative data
We run our platform in AWS. We build upon open-source technologies such as Kubernetes, Spark, Argo Workflows, Argo Events, and Trino in addition to adopting and supporting open standards such as OpenAPI, CloudEvents, and Open Lineage. Our users inform and guide our roadmap. Together, we evolve and deliver an ambitious vision for how to develop data products.


What's in it for you:
You'll be part of a diverse team with varying levels of experience and backgrounds that work together to create the platform. We support each other where we have expertise and become experts together where we have none. We seek input and feedback from our teammates, valuing open discussion and collaboration.

You'll have an opportunity to:
Building APIs to orchestrate deployments and execution of data processing systems.
Prototype data and analytics technologies to adopt and incorporate into our platform.
Use established and existing technologies in novel ways to solve our problems.
Integrate and manage cloud resources and services.
Create tools and UIs to enhance usability and developer autonomy
We'll trust you to:
Build and maintain systems that are scalable, reliable, and usable while simplifying the complexities for the benefit of our users
Take ownership in the design and implementation of technical solutions from start to finish including prototyping, development, testing, and release.
Collaborate with your team and the wider engineering organization and Alternative Data product teams to achieve the team's goals.
Own the infrastructure, services, systems used to provide the platform.
Write and review code, develop documentation, debug problems with large, distributed, and complex systems.
You'll need to have:
4+ Years working with one or more of our development language (Python, Go, Typescript) and libraries, frameworks, and APIs within those languages.
A Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, similar field of study or equivalent work experience
Experience building, maintaining, and debugging production systems and services such as cloud infrastructure, load balancers and APIs.
Curiosity for investigating and understanding all areas of the platform whether it is working with AWS VPCs, improving a CLI used by developers, or understanding the primitive and logical types in a supported file format.
Experience with distributed systems and service architectures.
We'd love to see:
Polyglot engineers that are comfortable with using multiple languages for building production systems
Experience in and around technical data systems such as Spark, Flink, Dask, Clickhouse, Druid and technologies such as Parquet, Iceberg, and cloud object-stores.
Support of production systems with knowledge of Linux, networking (transport and application layer protocols), and deploying systems and services using Kubernetes, Mesos or Nomad.
Experience building on Kubernetes using the operator pattern, admission webhooks, and other services that work with the Kubernetes API.
Prior design and automating operations cloud infrastructure such as AWS, GCP, Azure using tools such as Terraform and Ansible
