Job_title: Data Center Automation Systems - Junior CAD Operator
Job_description:
Posted
07-Mar-2023
Service line
GWS Segment
Role type
Full-time
Areas of Interest
Construction, Data Centers
Location(s)
Charleston - South Carolina - United States of America, Moncks Corner - South Carolina - United States of America, North Charleston - South Carolina - United States of America, Summerville - South Carolina - United States of America
Job Summary
The Datacenter Automation Systems (DAS) team is committed to the successful implementation of autonomous and semi-autonomous vehicles throughout multiple datacenters. CBRE is seeking a full-time, permanent, CAD Operator with experience in MEP design, manufacturing or data center robotics-centric automation solutions. The DAS CAD Operator will report to the Client-approved location:
Moncks Corner, SC - full time / on site
The DAS CAD Operator requirements may vary according to Client-determined assignments, but most content relates to creating detailed designs for industrial automation equipment and systems in the DAS robotics portfolio at the Client's data centers. This position is part of a multi-disciplinary team creating engineering documentation and design drawing packages. The individual will collaborate with project engineers, technical writers, project managers, and other CAD/BIM Operators. Ideal candidates would be familiar with establishing and managing a design environment. Ideal candidates must be comfortable communicating regularly via video conference, email and internal ticketing systems.

Job Duties:
Acquire clear understanding of product requirements by reviewing, understanding, interpreting and revising technical specifications, blueprints and engineering illustrations, mockups, and prototypes.
Ability to read and interpret design standards and specifications, blueprints, drawings, redlines, etc
Coordinate the CAD design for Navigation Tape and GeoMarker installation package
Installation Drawings
Navigation DesignLayout
GeoMarker datum development
Material Takeoff
Working understanding of construction design package development for field installation.
Ability to translate existing field conditions from documentation and redlines to revise/edit design drawing packages.
Ability to learn software such as Lucidchart to generate shape files for navigation translated from design drawings. .
Capable of managing shifting design production to coordinate with field installation schedules.
Coordinate file management with 3rd party teams for document file transfer.
Maintain audits of latest design revisions against floor plan modifications.
Ability to perform repetitive field measurement tasks for long durations such as bending, kneeling, squatting ,walking, climbing stairs, etc.
Must have excellent organizational skills
Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing

Other duties as assigned.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position.

QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree in Architecture, Engineering, Construction Management, or related field. Minimum two or more years' construction administration, architecture, engineering or similar experience.

Preferred experience with some data center infrastructure projects. Experience in mission critical data centers is a strong plus. Preferred experience with robotic process automation.

CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES

Working towards or eligible for licensure as either a Professional Engineer or Registered Architect is desired.

COMMUNICATION SKILLS

Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.

FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE

Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis.

REASONING ABILITY

Ability to understand and carry out general instructions in standard situations. Ability to solve problems in standard situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.

OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES

Intermediate skills with Microsoft Office Suite. Ability to read and understand architectural drawings. Working knowledge in MS Project is helpful. Knowledge of leases, contracts, and construction practices preferred. 3+ years of minimum proficiency in the use of AutoCAD and Revit. Knowledge of Best Management Practices CAD/BIM environment. Autodesk Software - CAD BIM Solidworks BIM360 etc.

Basic knowledge of the entitlement/permitting process and construction delivery methods and agreements. Some familiarity with construction best practices, general building codes, and various building types and systems. Passion for being detail oriented and highly organized.

SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY

Decisions made with general understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.

Job_title: Cloud Data Engineer I - AWS, Python, Snowflake, SQL
Job_description:
Who Are We?

Taking care of our customers, our communities and each other. That’s the Travelers Promise. By honoring this commitment, we have maintained our reputation as one of the best property casualty insurers in the industry for over 160 years. Join us to discover a culture that is rooted in innovation and thrives on collaboration. Imagine loving what you do and where you do it.

Compensation Overview

The annual base salary range provided for this position is a nationwide market range and represents a broad range of salaries for this role across the country. The actual salary for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. As part of our comprehensive compensation and benefits program, employees are also eligible for performance-based cash incentive awards.

Salary Range

$102,600.00 - $169,200.00

Target Openings

1

What Is the Opportunity?

Travelers Data Engineering team constructs pipelines that contextualize and provide easy access to data by the entire enterprise. As a Data Engineer, you will play a key role in growing and transforming our analytics landscape. In addition to your strong analytical mind, you will bring your inquisitive attitude and ability to translate the stories found in data. You will leverage your ability to design, build and deploy data solutions that capture, explore, transform, and utilize data to support Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and business intelligence/insights.

What Will You Do?

Build and operationalize complex data solutions, correct problems, apply transformations, and recommend data cleansing/quality solutions.
Design data solutions.
Analyze sources to determine value and recommend data to include in analytical processes.
Incorporate core data management competencies including data governance, data security and data quality.
Collaborate within and across teams to support delivery and educate end users on data products/analytic environment.
Perform data and system analysis, assessment and resolution for defects and incidents of moderate complexity and correct as appropriate.
Test data movement, transformation code, and data components.
Perform other duties as assigned.

What Will Our Ideal Candidate Have?

Bachelor’s Degree in STEM related field or equivalent
Six years of related experience
Proficient use of tools (Snowflake, Databricks), techniques, and manipulation including Cloud platforms (AWS), programming languages (Python and/or Java), and an understanding of software engineering practices.
The ability to deliver work at a steady, predictable pace to achieve commitments, decompose work assignments into small batch releases, and contribute to tradeoff and negotiation discussions.
Demonstrated track record of domain expertise including the ability to understand technical concepts and possess in-depth knowledge of immediate systems worked on.
Proven problem solving skills including debugging skills, allowing you to determine source of issues in unfamiliar code or systems and the ability to recognize and solve repetitive problems.
Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact with team members and business partners.
Leadership - Intermediate leadership skills with a proven track record of self-motivation in identifying personal growth opportunities.

What is a Must Have?

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent training with data tools, techniques, and manipulation.
Four years of data engineering or equivalent experience.

What Is in It for You?

Health Insurance: Employees and their eligible family members – including spouses, domestic partners, and children – are eligible for coverage from the first day of employment.
Retirement: Travelers matches your 401(k) contributions dollar-for-dollar up to your first 5% of eligible pay, subject to an annual maximum. If you have student loan debt, you can enroll in the Paying it Forward Savings Program. When you make a payment toward your student loan, Travelers will make an annual contribution into your 401(k) account. You are also eligible for a Pension Plan that is 100% funded by Travelers.
Paid Time Off: Start your career at Travelers with a minimum of 20 days Paid Time Off annually, plus nine paid company Holidays.
Wellness Program: The Travelers wellness program is comprised of tools and resources that empower you to achieve your wellness goals. In addition, our Life Balance program provides access to professional counseling services, life coaching and other resources to support your daily life needs. Through Life Balance, you’re eligible for five free counseling sessions with a licensed therapist.
Volunteer Encouragement: We have a deep commitment to the communities we serve and encourage our employees to get involved. Travelers has a Matching Gift and Volunteer Rewards program that enables you to give back to the charity of your choice.

Employment Practices

Travelers is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that we can deliver the very best products and services when our workforce reflects the diverse customers and communities we serve. We are committed to recruiting, retaining and developing the diverse talent of all of our employees and fostering an inclusive workplace, where we celebrate differences, promote belonging, and work together to deliver extraordinary results.



If you are a candidate and have specific questions regarding the physical requirements of this role, please send us an email so we may assist you.


Travelers reserves the right to fill this position at a level above or below the level included in this posting.

To learn more about our comprehensive benefit programs please visit http://careers.travelers.com/life-at-travelers/benefits/.

Job_title: Supervisor, QA Data Integrity, Computer Software Validation
Job_description:
Jubilant HollisterStier LLC, a well-established member of the business community in Spokane, Washington, provides a complete range of services to support the pharmaceutical and biopharmaceutical industries. The Allergy business is a worldwide leader in the manufacture of allergenic extracts, targeted primarily at treating allergies and asthma. Jubilant HollisterStier is also a nationally recognized contract manufacturer of sterile injectable vials, and lyophilized products. Jubilant HollisterStier is a proud member of the Jubilant Pharma family.

Our Promise: Caring, Sharing, Growing

We will, with the utmost care for the environment and society, continue to enhance value for our customers and stakeholders by providing innovative products and economically efficient solutions’ through growth, cost effectiveness and wise investment of resources.


Job Description:

Supervisor, QA Data Integrity/Governance and Computer Software Validation - Responsible for the overall supervision and execution of CSV activities/systems compliance and data governance and will be accountable for all computer and IT related compliances at the JHS-Spokane site. Support deviation investigations related to site level IT system and applications. SME for site external & internal audit DI/CSV support. SME for site in managing IT system compliance related issues and leading efforts related to compliance in these areas.



The QA Supervisor oversees the Quality Assurance team and assures that team outputs meet necessary quality standards.
Provides daily tactical planning and oversight of QA CSV and Data Integrity programs to ensure that all work meets the requirements as defined by Standard Operating Procedures and GMP.
Establishes and maintains standard operating procedures and records associated with the above listed areas of responsibility.
This position provides direction and support of the daily operations in the Quality Assurance Validation and Quality Systems Department through scheduling, assignment of tasks among the QA team.
The individual in this position will establish and maintain a program to ensure the appropriate training and documentation of training of QA team (including safety, cGMP, and job functions).
The individual in this position will also be responsible for providing supervisor oversight for the QA team, including conducting performance evaluations of that staff.
Partner with other departments to ensure site is compliant.


Qualifications:

Bachelor of Science required.
Minimum 5 years related experience with Bachelor of Science, -OR- 10 years experience without Bachelor of Science.
Experience with technical writing, building and manufacturing computer control processes/systems, QA operation systems and validation, computer software validation, data integrity, and risk assessment is required.
Experience with GMP records storage, and SAP is preferred.


Shift: Days

Compensation:

The salary range for this position is $76,817 - $128,005 depending on experience.

Benefits:

Medical, Dental, Vision, Flexible Spending and Health Savings Accounts
Life, AD&D, Short and Long Term Disability
401(k) with company match
Generous paid time off plan
Employee Assistance Program

Optional Benefits:

Voluntary Life and AD&D for employee & family
Supplemental Medical coverage (Critical Illness, Hospital Indemnity and Accident coverages)
Pet Insurance
ID Theft Protection
Perk Spot Discount Program



Jubilant HollisterStier is a great place to grow!
If you’re up for a rewarding challenge, we invite you to take the first step and apply today!

HResources@jhs.jubl.com

POSITION SUMMARY: As the Program Manager this position is responsible for staff training, data reporting, coordination with community partners, and management of all grant related professional learning activities. Travel is required. Additional duties include data collection and analysis and the development and implementation of professional learning directed towards district initiatives.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
This list of Essential Duties and Responsibilities is not exhaustive and may be supplemented.


Supervision and evaluation of Content Area Specialists and professional development staff
Designs, develops, and implements district wide comprehensive professional learning for all employees (Pre-K through 12th grade).
Provides regularly scheduled learning opportunities for principals and other administrators to foster organizational alignment and commitment to system-wide goals and initiatives
Facilitate and support the New Teacher Academy
Coordinates the capacity building and coaching of teacher leaders
Coordinate relevant grant project activities.
Collaborate and support professional staff regarding grant projects.
Prepare performance and other reports as required.
Use data to analyze instructional strategy use, program effectiveness, and teacher effectiveness.
Coordinate monitoring activities of various grants.
Provide or support Professional Development to all school staff in ELA, Math, Science, Social Studies, NEPF, technology, and other content areas.
Manage various Learning Management and Data Systems.
Data collection and assimilation for district, state and national tests
Other duties assigned.

POSITION EXPECTATIONS:
Ability to acquire research and review effective instructional strategies in all content areas.
Personnel leadership and supervision skills.
Ability to train and supervise personnel, and follow up to ensure effective implementation
Excellent written and oral communication skills as well as technical writing skills.
Provide professional learning opportunities that support District initiatives; plan and deliver professional learning in accordance with national professional learning standards
Ability to present ideas effectively, verbally and in writing; dealing constructively with conflict and developing consensus;
Train administrators on how to best support the data analysis and grant initiatives.
Ability to work cooperatively with professional administrative, certified and classified staff.
Mobility and stamina to maintain an active schedule, with frequent travel to each of the school sites within the district and meetings within and out of the district.



POSITION REQUIREMENTS:
Education and Training:
Three years of public school teaching experience.
Instructional coaching background and experience preferred.
Master’s Degree in Educational Leadership from an accredited institution preferred.

Licenses and Certifications: Must possess a teacher license issued by the Nevada Department of Education. NDE Administrator Endorsement preferred.

When applying for a certificated licensed position, candidates must meet the minimum qualifications as listed on the appropriate position vacancy announcement.

PHYSICAL AND MENTAL REQUIREMENTS:
The physical and mental requirements described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job.

Strength, dexterity, coordination, and vision to use keyboard and video display terminal for prolonged periods. Strength and stamina to bend, stoop, sit, and stand for long periods of time. Dexterity and coordination to handle files and single pieces of paper; occasional lifting of files, stacks of paper or reports, references, student work, and other materials. Some reaching for items above and below waist and head level. Some reaching, bending, squatting, and stooping to access files, student work, and other items is necessary. The manual dexterity and cognitive ability to operate a personal computer and other educational technology (LCD projector, SmartBoard, iPads/Tablets, etc.) to enhance student learning. Involves hearing and speech to communicate in person or over the telephone. Light lifting (up to 25 pounds) may occasionally be required.

In compliance with applicable disability laws, reasonable accommodations may be provided for qualified individuals with a disability who require and request such accommodations. WORKING CONDITIONS:

May involve exposure to noise levels ranging from moderate to very loud on occasional to frequent time periods. May involve work in crowded environments. Travel is required.

Hazards: Office/classroom furniture, playground/office equipment, communicable diseases, chemicals (as related to specific assignment), and power/hand operated equipment and machinery (as related to specific assignment).

Full Time, Flexible weekday schedule. 36 hours/week.

Pay Range is between $23.21-$34.80/hr, depending on years of relevant and like experience.

Boulder Community Health is a Certified Level II Trauma Center. In 2022, we celebrated the 100thanniversary of the founding of our organization. We are honored to hold the awards of 2021 U.S. News & World ‘Best Hospitals for Maternity Care’, 2019 Best Medical Facility from Boulder Weekly, and Best Local Employer from Daily Camera. Come be part of an independent, community-focused health system; feel good knowing that your work will make a difference in people’s lives and positively contribute to the community.

POSITION SUMMARY

Coordinates the cancer data management system to promote quality care for the cancer patients at Boulder Community Health. Maintains compliance with the requirements for an approved cancer program and national accreditation program for breast centers set forth by the American College of Surgeons Commission on Cancer. Maintains compliance with the requirements for mandatory statewide reporting set forth by the Colorado Cancer Registry and Department of Public health.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS

Education or Formal Training

Accredited Record Technician (RHIT) or Registered Record Administrator (RHIA) preferred. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) required. ICD-9 Coding, cancer staging and word-processing. Expertise required with Excel spreadsheets and CNExT (or similar automated cancer registry system) ACOS web-based data upload process including but not limited to the National Call for Data (NCDB) and the Facility Identifiable data (FIPS level 1 & 2). State of Colorado Public Health and Environment compliance with state and federal laws mandating data collection and compliance in the research of those diagnosed with and treated for cancer. The Cancer Registry is responsible for guarding the hospitals compliance and fostering a cohesive relationship with the State liaisons and personnel and providing documentation to them upon request, to evidence the hospitals compliance with the state and federal statutes.

Special Qualifications (Licensure, Registration, etc.)

Bachelor or Associate Degree in health information technology are related field preferred. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) required.

Knowledge, Skill and Ability

Knowledge of all American College of Surgeons and State of Colorado requirements for Cancer Registry accreditation process. Working knowledge of all levels of accreditation and evidence of experience with standards.
Evidence of ability to produce an annual report and comply with procedures for reporting to the state as required by American College of Surgeons.
Demonstrated ability for successful completion of ACOS accreditation survey.
Demonstrated excellent communication skills:
Writing ability including accurate grammar and spelling as evidenced by concise and clear report writing, compilation and organization of annual reports, preparation of tumor conference agendas, and synopses of data.
Verbal skills as evidenced by ability to communicate with all members of the health care team, the state tumor registry and patients when appropriate.
Demonstrated ability to execute a successful breast & cancer conference.
Demonstrated ability to accurately analyze and abstract patient records with an average time of 60 minutes or less per abstract.
Detail-oriented with ability to make independent decisions and use critical thinking skills.
Demonstrated ability to execute accomplishment of ACOS required registry data studies
Demonstrated ability to execute scientific studies leading to sound data to be presented to the Cancer Committee as a source of outcomes analysis.
Demonstrated ability to keep apprised of the ever-changing policies and procedures of the state of Colorado and the data reporting elements involved in this process.
Demonstrated ability to research and comply with changing federal agency regulations.
Demonstrated ability to stay up to date with regulatory and complementary agencies to adjust hospital abstracting when a specific precedent has been changed or set. The agencies include but are not limited to; coding schemes (CPT, ICD-0-3, ICD-9-CM), Surveillance Epidemiology & End Results (SEER), American Joint Commission on Cancer (AJCC).
Must have knowledge and ability to perform required aspects of the computer and its programs: follow-up letters, statistical reports, Colorado State Cancer Registry reporting and other required medical and cancer data.

Experience

At least five years of experience as a cancer data registrar in an ACOS accredited Cancer Program.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Assists in developing and maintaining cancer program standards by ACoS/COC and NAPBC.
Coordinates maintenance of appropriate files, reports and other cancer related data to ensure approval standards by the American College of Surgeons and the Colorado State Cancer Registry. Preparing graphs and statistics.
Prepares cancer reports and statistical data of the cancer program and breast center activities to administration, physician, outside agencies and/or Colorado State Cancer Registry.
Develops and implement changes in cancer registry policies and procedures to ensure CoC and NAPBC requirements
Monitors quality data (including periodic audits) to ensure data quality and compliance with state and CoC and NAPBC requirements.
Coordinates, plans, attends, documents, and promotes attendance at all Tumor Conferences.
Schedules a minimum of 4 Cancer Committee meetings a year on the medical staff calendar.
Drafts Cancer Committee agendas to represent each standard outlined by the ACOS. Allocate time on the agenda for each coordinator and specialty to give report, at the designated intervals required by the ACOS, if not more often.
Serves as a member of the Cancer Committee.
Coordinates Cancer Registry abstractors and oversight of all of their encompassing cancer registry activities.

About Boulder Community Health and Boulder, Colorado

Uncompromising medical excellence delivered with respect and compassion. Since 1922, Boulder Community Health has built a strong reputation on these values. As community-owned and operated not-for-profit hospital and clinic locations, we remain dedicated to the evolving needs of our citizens and providing access to high-quality care. Enjoy state-of-the-art facilities and equipment along with competitive compensation and benefits, including health/dental/life, tuition reimbursement, on-site fitness center, Employee Wellness, Employee Activities & Discounts, and many more!

Office and Data Manager Job Description

Job Summary: Response is a non-profit in Aspen that works with survivors of domestic and sexual abuse. The office and data manager is responsible for managing the Response office and data collection and reporting as well as supporting the fundraising and outreach functions of the organization. (part time considered for the right applicant).

Responsibilities:

1. General Office:

Performs the full range of administrative duties for the office, including office management, maintaining office supplies and equipment. Answers incoming calls; assists visitors; handles mail.
Maintains agency files, ensures payment requests are submitted to the executive director, processes reports and renewals.
Works with vendors and other agencies to ensure the highest level of service.
Paying bills and processing payments.
Support other staff as needed.

2. Crisis Helpline:

Communicating with volunteer advocates with updates and scheduling to ensure that crisis helpline is adequately staffed.
Maintains volunteer and back up staff records and individual hours.
After completing the 30-hour volunteer advocate training, may be asked to work up to one week per month on the crisis line for evenings and a full weekend (additional compensation).

3. Fundraising and Outreach

Maintains Response website and social media outlets with accurate and timely postings.
Maintains donor database for fundraising and outreach efforts.
Provide logistical support for all Response events including volunteer management, soliciting donations, working with sponsors, marketing and more.
Works with executive director to create email and print newsletters on a regular basis.

4. Grant and Data Management

Coordination of Response’s annual grant calendar.
Assist executive director with grant reporting and tracking.
Coordination of program evaluation systems.
May include grant writing and proofing under the supervision of the executive director.
Maintains organizational databases and is responsible for overall records management.

Qualifications:

At least three years of work in an office setting.
Strong computer skills: Microsoft office, including Excel and Word and database experience.
A professional office manner and careful attention to detail.
The ability to maintain confidentiality and a calm manner when dealing with people in crisis.
A strong team player who is flexible with time and duties as they evolve.
Passionate about Response’s mission, culturally sensitive and trauma informed.
Background check and work verification required.
Ability to work 9 am -5 pm at the Aspen office (only applicants with housing in the Roaring Fork Valley will be considered)
Bilingual language skills (English and Spanish) preferred.

General Physical Requirements:

Hearing and vision corrected to normal ranges; able to work in high-stress situations; able to use the telephone and able to function in an office environment, including operation of office equipment.

Salary Range: $$27-$30/hour depending on experience. Benefits after 90 day trial period: 10 days of vacation per year, 11 paid holidays, 78 hours of wellness leave, health insurance, health spending account and retirement contribution.

To Apply: Send a short letter explaining why you would be a good fit for this position and your professional resume. WILL NOT CONSIDER WITHOUT BOTH

Job_title: Actuarial Data Scientist II - Personal Auto (Hybrid)
Job_description:
At American Family Insurance, we believe people are an organization’s most valuable asset, and their ideas and experiences matter. From our CEO to our agency force, we’re committed to growing a diverse and inclusive culture that empowers innovation that will inspire, protect, and restore our customers’ dreams in ways never imagined.


American Family Insurance is driven by our customers and employees. That’s why we provide more than just a job – we provide opportunity. Whether you’re already part of our team in search of a new challenge or new to our company and ready for what’s next, you’re in the right place. Every dream is a journey that starts with a single step. Start your journey right here. Join our team. Bring your dreams.

Job ID:
R30594 Actuarial Data Scientist II - Personal Auto (Hybrid) (Open)

Compensation may vary based on the job level and your geographic work location.

Compensation Minimum:$90,200 Annual

Compensation Maximum:$144,500 Annual

Summary:

American Family Insurance Auto Center of Excellence (CoE) Predictive Analytics team is looking for an experienced actuarial data scientist to help support and enhance our Auto and Specialty lines insurance pricing.

Prior experience creating insurance pricing models a big plus. Candidates with actuarial and/or data science experience are encouraged to apply.

Data scientists in the Auto COE provide data-driven solutions to new and complex business problems, develop innovative strategies, and monitor/adjust solutions based on changing markets and future trends. They apply and integrate statistical, mathematical, predictive modeling and business analysis skills to manage and manipulate complex high volume data from a variety of sources. You will collaborate closely with business teams (product, state management, actuarial) and the Data Engineering teams to build modeling pipeline, iteratively enhance model performance, and share out results to stakeholders.

Job Profile Summary
Develops, analyzes and models operational, economic, management, accounting and other organizational data to quantify the competitive performance of business segments, evaluate potential operational changes, and design new approaches and methodologies. Analyzes organizational data to recommend solutions to new and complex problems, develops innovative strategies, quantifies the competitive performance of the organization's operations and/or markets; models and evaluates the potential impact of changes. Applies and integrates statistical, mathematical, predictive modeling and business analysis skills to manage and manipulate complex high volume data from a variety of sources.

Job Description:

Responsibilities:

Explores data using a variety of statistical techniques to proactively identify relationships, creates insights and answers business questions or guides future model development
Translates business needs into viable predictive modeling solutions and brings new and innovative ideas or approaches
Identifies proper model structure and statistical measurement to support various hypothesis testing
Incorporates findings and provides industry and competitor insights as part of model development and enhancement
Writes clean and production ready code that can be easily maintained and leveraged by engineering and IT teams
Builds and tests models and investigates areas for future improvement with minimal guidance
Participates in Team's Agile ceremonies (sprint planning, retrospective, demo)
Translates quantitative analyses into business friendly visuals for non-technical audience, present model findings by tailoring messages to various audiences
Supports actuarial and state management teams in state specific model customization, filing, and roll out
Provides sufficient model documentation
Collaborates with IT to bring models into production
Keeps abreast of latest relevant technologies and proposes new ones to the team

Travel Requirements

This position requires travel up to 10% of the time.

Specialized Knowledge and Skills Requirements

Demonstrated experience providing customer-driven solutions, support or service.
Ability to work as part of a team and to communicate effectively.
Proficiency in programming languages suitable for database access, scripting, statistical analysis, and system development. Understanding of software development best practices including source control, coding standards and testing frameworks.
Demonstrated experience formulating, approaching, and solving complex analytical problems using a quantitative, scientific approach.
Demonstrated experience working with large, complex datasets using big data technologies and script.
Solid knowledge and understanding managing data to scale using data summarization, query and analysis software and tools.

Education and Licenses

Preferred: Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Sciences or Engineering, or related field or equivalent experience.

Additional Job Information:

Prior experience creating insurance pricing models a big plus.

Depending on qualifications, candidates may be considered at different levels.

Offer to selected candidate will be made contingent on the results of applicable background checks.

Offer to selected candidate is contingent on signing a non-disclosure agreement for proprietary information, trade secrets, and inventions.

This position is a hybrid role that involves working a minimum of 10 days per month in the office. We know flexibility is important to our employees and their families, and we will continue to offer flexibility in this flex office/home role. This approach will guide us in balancing the needs of the business, customers and our employees.

Preferred locations for this role include:

Madison, WI; Chicago, IL; Boston, MA; Minneapolis, MN; Denver, CO; Phoenix, AZ; Nashville, TN; Atlanta, GA; Seattle, WA; Las Vegas, NV; St. Joseph, MO; Kansas City, MO; St. Louis, MO; Green Bay, WI; Milwaukee, WI; Akron, OH; Keene, NH; Jacksonville, FL

Other locations and remote work may be considered.

Internal candidates are encouraged to apply regardless of location and will be considered based upon the needs of the role.

#LI-Hybrid

When you work at American Family you can expect benefits that support your physical, emotional, and financial wellbeing. You will have access to comprehensive medical, dental, vision and wellbeing benefits that enable you to take care of your health. We also offer a competitive 401(k) contribution, a pension plan, an annual incentive, and a paid-time off program. In addition, our student loan repayment program and paid-family leave are available to support our employees and their families. Interns and contingent workers are not eligible for American Family Enterprise benefits.

We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

Job_title: ETL Data Analyst - Third Party Indices Automation
Job_description:
Bloomberg runs on data, and as part of the Data team, we're responsible for acquiring it, providing it to our clients and helping derive significant insights out of it. We collect, analyze, process, and publish the data, which is the backbone of our iconic Bloomberg Terminal and our enterprise products - the facts and figures which ultimately move the financial markets. We apply problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow efficiencies, and we implement technology solutions to improve our systems, products, and processes - and all this while providing platinum customer support to clients.


The Third Party Index Data team supports Bloomberg's suite of Indices to fulfill our clients' needs. We process over 15,000 files per day and as such need to have highly efficient data pipelines and quality processes to support the timely execution and publishing of that data for our clients.


What's the role?

The Third Party Automation Team is a dynamic group of individuals who tackle the more challenging technical aspects of our data product including data pipelining and sophisticated data analysis. Our Data Analysts possess a unique combination of technical skills and eye for business, as well as good communication and interpersonal skills. As such, we are looking for a highly motivated individual with a passion for data and the technology that surrounds it.


As a Data Analyst you will apply your problem-solving skills to handle the data pipelines, automation processes and human-in-the-loop workflows that feed our Third Party Indices Data Products. In addition to the data pipelining work, you will analyze our data from an operational as well as product standpoint. This might be by building the associated ETLs and Data Visualizations to report on our most important Operational Metrics or by building prototype applications in BQNT with our product teams. You will be expected to lead projects, collaborate with Engineering and Product and mentor junior members of the group who are looking to develop technically.


We'll trust you to:
Develop and support the data pipelines and processes that feed our Bloomberg Index Database
Find opportunities and build automated solutions for data standardization, ETL pipelines, and human-in-the-loop data processing
Design, develop, and deploy data quality validations written in Python to drive quality improvements and standards across the team, improving areas such as accuracy, completeness, consistency, reliability and more
Draw on your knowledge of scripting and programming to scale and standardize pipelining across our team and the department, always identifying improvements to current workflows
Use statistics and data visualization to report on results of ongoing operations and projects, as required
Leverage data analysis skills to find opportunities to optimize our operations or create prototypes to advance the third-party index data product
Partner with a wide variety of collaborators including Engineering, Product and Sales on product development and execution
You'll need to have: (from other DA2 role)
A BA/BS degree or higher in Computer Science, Mathematics, or relevant data technology field, or equivalent professional work experience
2+ years of Python programming and scripting in a production environment
2+ years of experience working with databases either SQL or NoSQL
Understanding of large-scale, distributed systems
Strong aptitude for problem solving, particularly to modify and enhance processes and workflows
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, especially when explaining technical processes and solutions to business stakeholders and management
High attention to detail and degree of demonstrated decision-making and problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment
Ability to influence others and lead change
Experience training and mentoring others
Legal authorization to work full-time in the United States and not require visa sponsorship now or in the future
We'd love to see:
Financial Market experience including an understanding of how benchmarks are used by our clients
Agile/Scrum Project Management experience
Experience using data analysis and visualization tools such as Tableau or QlikSense
Does this sound like you?

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are.

JOB SUMMARY

This role utilizes diverse skills to perform preventative maintenance and corrective repairs in a 24/7 Data Center operation working a 12-hr. shift schedule. The role also includes inspection of electrical and mechanical systems, including but not limited to: Uninterruptable Power Supply (UPS) systems, generators, chillers, Electrical Distribution, HVAC systems, and Building Management Systems (BMS) systems.

This position sits onsite in Altoona, Iowa.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Perform daily site inspections of all Mechanical & Engineering (M&E) systems and technical equipment, including servicing and maintenance. Under general supervision, complete assigned work according to established processes and procedures in accordance with CBRE's Environment, Health and Safety Policy - ensuring all safety processes and PPE requirements are followed. Also, ensure all regulatory requirements and quality standards are met. Oversee third-party vendors, ensuring compliance with CBRE's developed processes, procedures, and all applicable laws/regulations. Accompany vendors on site visits on an as needed basis and ensure site standards are met. Help create and develop work processes, Job Hazard Analysis reports, and SOPs for critical work with risk assessment. Complete all required training to ensure successful completion of all job-related responsibilities.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

No formal supervisory responsibilities are required in this position. Other tasks may require informal assistance such as providing technical guidance and/or training to coworkers. Additional coordination of work and assigning tasks may also be required, as needed.



QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE
High School Diploma/GED required, with more than 2 years of experience in basic mechanical, electrical, plumbing, and carpentry preferred.
Knowledge of emergency response/standby/call out activities and protocols is a plus. Advanced training and experience in mechanical, electrical, plumbing, and carpentry is a plus but not required.
CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES
None
COMMUNICATION SKILLS
Ability to comprehend and interpret instructions, short correspondence, memos and ask clarifying questions to ensure understanding. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from clients, co-workers, and/or supervisor. Ability to effectively present information to an internal department and/or large groups of employees.
FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE
Ability to perform basic math skills is essential. Basic knowledge of financial terms and principles is helpful.
REASONING ABILITY
Ability to understand and carry out general instructions and to perform problem solving in workplace situations. Basic analytical skills are essential.
OTHER SKILLS and/or ABILITIES
Ability to work in a 24/7 12-hr shift schedule environment. Shift schedules are generally consistent but are subject to change based on business need and continuity of operations.
Basic knowledge/skills in the use of personal computer and smartphone.
General knowledge/ability using Microsoft Products (Word, Excel, etc.).
Familiarity with instant messaging, text messaging and chats is a plus.
Ability to work alone with minimal supervision and together with coworkers in a team environment is essential.
Ability to effectively present information to an internal department and/or large groups of employees.
An additional requirement for this role is the ability to comply with COVID-19 health and safety protocols, including COVID-19 vaccination proof and/or rigorous testing.
SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY
Decisions are made with general understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Doing the right thing is expected of all employees.

Job_title: Principal Data Solutions Analyst, Personal Lines
Job_description:
The Personal Lines Modeling Data Solutions (MDS) team is actively searching for a new member to join our team as a technical expert in support of data initiatives within Product Design & Modeling (PDM).
The MDS teams works closely with modeling and delivery stakeholders to curate and deliver comprehensive data solutions that support sophisticated model development and the successful calibration and launch into market of high-quality home and auto personal insurance products.
As a member of the MDS team, analysts will contribute towards process and query enhancements within existing and emerging platforms, support and maintain operational data production, as well as collaborate within the team and with our technology and data partners to design and implement modern solutions leveraging cloud-based tooling to increase speed, efficiency, and accuracy of essential data products.
Responsibilities will include:
Working both autonomously and collaboratively design, prototype, develop, and scale data solutions of moderate to high complexity to meet the needs of business customers and progress organization initiatives.
Lead routine production and validation of data deliverables, overseeing stakeholder engagement, prioritization and planning, and communication. Continuously seek improvement and enhancement opportunities within existing processes.
Leverage agile techniques to gather and distill requirements, accurately scope work efforts, and drive successful development and testing of data products and processes. Proactively identify project risks and propose solution-oriented strategies.
Ability to think critically, analyze data, accurately diagnose data issues, and articulate impacts to varying audiences.
Eagerness to continuously learn and test new technologies and programming languages, adapt and deliver in a dynamic environment, and inspire and influence change through collaboration.
Ideal candidate will have:
Experience coding with SQL, SAS, or Python preferred. Additional experience with AWS, Spark, or Snowflake strongly preferred.
In-depth knowledge of data concepts, strategies, and methodologies for manipulating and curating structured and unstructured data preferred.
Familiarity with database design and data warehousing in an enterprise environment helpful.
Prior knowledge of insurance business operations helpful.
Strong written and oral communication skills required
Experience in communicating recommendations to senior business leaders preferred
BA/BS, or relevant work experience, in Computer Science or related field preferred
MBA or advanced degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or other quantitative discipline strongly preferred
3-5+ years of experience working in coding and data solutions design principles, particularly in open source tools and technology

Job Description:

At CoBank, our Audit Manager – Audit and Digital Innovation manages plans and/or assigns audits based on risk assessments and requests from CoBank Management, the Board of Directors, or the Audit Committee. Responsible for coordinating the execution of audit analytics and championing initiatives aimed at improving analytic capabilities within the audit function. Develops expertise in navigating the application infrastructure and data environments within CoBank, and provides data analysis solutions to audit team members and business partners. Builds and maintains an Internal Audit Center of Excellence for data-driven auditing techniques in alignment with CoBank’s Enterprise Information Management’s program and other best practices. Assists the Audit management team with annual planning activities for the department. Proposes departmental procedural changes as needed. Supervises the performance of audit work, assists audit managers, senior and staff auditors in the performance of audit work, and independently performs audit work when necessary. Provides ongoing training and career development opportunities for supervised staff. Maintains professional expertise in leading practices of the audit profession and in the technical areas of responsibility.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Plans and/or assigns audits based on risk assessments and requests from CoBank management, the Board of Directors, or the Audit Committee. Aids in the development of annual audit plans and schedules work based on the audit plan and special requests. Performs high level, detailed planning for audit engagements as necessary.
Assists Audit management with annual planning activities for the department. Assistance includes, but is not limited to the establishment of a comprehensive audit plan to evaluate the design and effectiveness of control environments across bank functions in the mitigation of known, emerging, or perceived risks.
Proposes departmental procedural changes to Audit management, as needed. Monitors appropriateness and accuracy of policies and procedures within the department, and assists management with the establishment and compliance of department procedures, CoBank policy/directives and bank wide guidance.
Builds and maintains relationships by actively working with CoBank management and the Board, the FCA and external auditors. Facilitates productive two-way communication channels among CoBank stakeholders.
Manages and/or executes advanced audit services, and supervises/mentors audit team in the effective design and implementation of work products, scope, execution, work paper review, and reporting.
Supports and participates in advancing the Internal Audit team’s ability to assess the organization’s control environment through the use of data analytics or other non-traditional methods. Generates insights resulting in high-quality audits that ensure the mitigation of risks to the bank.
Supports audit leadership by utilizing data models to identify and solve a variety of business issues. Reviews tools, techniques and best practices. Leverages technology through the implementation and use of automated analytics.
Partners with technology teams, and develops and implements quantitative solutions that leverage structured and unstructured data from internal and external sources. Utilizes existing and new systems and solutions to develop automated approaches to auditing. Develops and maintains continuous monitoring tools, and conducts follow-ups as needed. Performs pre-implementation reviews for significant changes in the IT environment.
Assists with peer reviews and internal self-compliance reviews with department quality standards and externally published standards (IIA, AICPA, COSO, et al).
Evaluates the effectiveness and efficiency of manual and automated controls used to mitigate complex processes and their associated risks for both Internal Audit and Sarbanes-Oxley requirements. Manages SOX 404 testing to maximize external auditor’s reliance, if applicable.
Mentors and trains staff through the development and presentation of fraud/data mining-related training and intranet materials.
Supervises audit managers, seniors and staff auditors in the performance of audit work. Ensures audit work is performed in accordance with professional audit standards and department procedures. Sets performance standards, manages workflow, evaluates performance, and recommends personnel actions within delegated authorities. Consults with Human Resources, as appropriate.
Maintains professional expertise in the leading practices of the audit profession, the banking industry, and the specific technical areas of responsibility including data analytics, robotics process automation and similar initiatives.
Serves as a subject matter expert, and provides a center of excellence (COE) and advisory service on data analytics and related controls to the business. Increases auditor efficiency and quality by promoting leading practices for conducting integrated audits and incorporating analytics.
Manages co-sourced and outsourced resources, as necessary.
Manages or performs special reviews, projects, and additional duties as assigned.

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in business, accounting, finance, information technology or other relevant discipline.
Six (6) or more years of industry-related audit experience, with Big 4 accounting experience preferred; or an appropriate combination of education and experience.

Preferred Qualifications

CISA, CISSP, CIA, CPA, CAP, DASCA SDS or PDS, CCP Data Engineer, IBM Data Architect, MCSE, SAS Data Scientist, or other related professional certification preferred.
Expertise with COSO/COBIT and leading data analytics and automation practices. Understanding of the COSO framework, GAAS, GAAP, and regulatory requirements for financial institutions.
Advanced knowledge, understanding and application of auditing, data science, and statistical and analytical tools, techniques, principles and best practices.
Advanced understanding of bank processes, systems, controls and related standards.
Strong proficiency in identifying, analyzing and evaluating complex business and technology risks, and identifying internal controls, tools and methods to mitigate risk and improve quality and control.
Proven analytical reasoning, strategic thinking and creative problem-solving abilities.
Demonstrated teambuilding and leadership skills, with the ability to manage a high performing, effective, diverse and inclusive team. Able to effectively oversee and positively motivate team members, instill accountability and facilitate successful achievement of individual, team, business and strategic goals.
Proven executive presence and interpersonal and negotiation skills. Able to lead teams, work collaboratively and build and maintain effective working relationships with all levels of associates, management, executive leadership, and internal and external customers and partners.
Excellent organizational and time management skills. Able to manage and schedule workload and projects in order to navigate peaks and prioritize multiple competing commitments. Skilled at managing short-term objectives to meet long-term goals.
Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills, including the ability to understand and translate abstract concepts and ideas, and communicate in both a business and technical context to non-technical audiences at all levels of the organization. Able to establish credibility and facilitate clear understanding of audit issues, and influence change as appropriate.
Excellent attention to detail and customer focused orientation.
Ability to work independently with minimal guidance, as well as collaboratively in a team environment.
Knowledge of and skills in using automation, data analytics, as well as intermediate ability with query languages (Automation Anywhere, Tableau, SAS, SQL, etc.). Familiarity with data warehouse and data mart concepts.
Knowledge of Microsoft Office (e.g., Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel) and other business applications and management reporting tools (e.g., Cognos, Outlook, Hyperion).
Availability for occasional work outside normal business hours.
Some travel may be required to complete job assignments and fulfill responsibilities.

Compensation Information

Estimated Base Salary Range: $125,000-$150,000
Target short-term incentive opportunity: 18%
About CoBank:

CoBank stands strong as an enterprise dedicated to the financial needs of rural communities. That means we help fund new ways to grow food, generate energy, access technology, and otherwise improve life in America. When you choose a career with us, you make a difference by doing work that matters. A career at CoBank can offer you the opportunity to make a personal impact on the people and communities where we do business. We also provide competitive compensation, health and wellness benefits, company-funded retirement plan, matching 401(k), and professional development programs.


CoBank will not consider a work visa H1B, EAD (Employment Authorization Document or Permit) or OPT (Optional Practical Training) for this position.

Any offer of employment will be conditioned upon an applicant supplying proof of vaccination against COVID-19; provided, however that CoBank may provide a reasonable accommodation for an applicant’s known disability or sincerely held religious belief.

Our consultants on the Advanced Analytics & Intelligent Automation (AAIA) team help clients maximize the value of their data and automate business processes. Our services enable our clients to define their information strategy, enable mission critical insights and data-driven decision making, reduce cost and complexity, increase trust, and improve operational effectiveness. The Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) is the corporate repository of integrated operational data. Nutrisystem is moving from on-premises management of it’s Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence to cloud Data Management and reporting. Working with EIS and offshore resources, this role will lead the development of the cloud DW while supporting the current DW environment.

External Contact: This position will work with external data and system vendors to exploit cutting edge Data Management technologies and integrate/export data following Nutrisystem security guidelines.

Internal Contact: This position will have significant contact with

Offshore development resources
EIS physical IT resource management and Architecture staff

Internal business sponsors and subject matter experts.

Working with IT and business resources, support the Data Warehouse strategy and Business Intelligence initiatives:

Lead development activities to migrate the current on-premises SQL Server DW to Snowflake on AWS.
Gather requirements for Data Warehouse improvements and translate them to high level design documents including Physical Data Models. Provide technical architecture vision and recommend strategy/solutions.
Design and develop transformation processes and data structures for the Data Warehouse following best practice procedures.
Lead resolution of Data Warehouse load issues.
Support the analytical needs of the business users. Build strong relationships to help identify opportunities to enhance the analytical capabilities of the Data Warehouse.
Partnering with business stakeholders and technical report developers, establish, maintain, and promote consistent methodology for reporting and analytics deployment. Perform ad hoc data analysis to meet business unit data validation needs.
Participate in Data Quality initiatives and lead the data transformation component design to improve and maintain high quality data. Support performance tuning.
Foster teamwork through cooperative interactions with co-workers. Where needed, ensure project integration by communicating activities and status to project manager, appropriate project team members, and business users.

5-8+ years of Data Warehousing/ BI experience.

Be well versed in Data Warehouse design concepts including Kimball and Inmon methodologies

Experience with business reporting requirements analysis.

understanding and experience with building and deploying Business Intelligence and analytics applications.
Familiarity with Financial, Sales, Marketing, and Logistics reporting environments.
Strong sense of leadership, strong analytical skills, excellent communication Have expert skills and good technical abilities.

SSAS.

Comfortable working in a fast-paced team. Capable of grasping new concepts quickly and acting with a sense of urgency.

Job_description:
Job Description
WGL - Research & Data Analyst (DIMP Analyst or Sr DIMP Analyst)
WGL/Washington Gas has an immediate opening for a Research & Data Analyst to join our Distribution Integrity Management Program (DIMP) group.
You Will
Create reproducible research and is prepared to defend conclusions
Connect to databases, writes SQL queries, joins data, ‘wrangles data’, and creates data visualizations (charts, graphs) that illustrate relevant points
Support database management
Use statistical methods to measure the correlative relationship between datasets
Use statistical methods to evaluate predictive model performance (back-testing, benchmarking, sensitivity testing, etc.)
Build charts, graphs, dashboards, summary tables, and other graphical representations to illustrate key findings in data
Search for industry papers in academic and professional journals compiles papers and refers to key research with citation
Intentionally dedicates effort to employ inductive and deductive reasoning to frame complex problems
Understand decision heuristics and the importance of variable weighting
Develop mathematic models or algorithms to forecast outcomes using historical data
Meet with company engineering staff and subject matter engineers to elicit opinion, direction, support, and coordination
Present findings of research to internal company panels and outlines proposed solutions
Work closely with various staff (e.g. Analysis & Reporting, Replacements, System Planning, Mapping, IT, Operations, Construction, etc.) to develop knowledge of their systems’ data and needs.
You Have
Bachelor's Degree Computer Science, Information Technology, GIS, or other Data Engineering field
3+ Years of experience in Computer Science, Information Technology, GIS, or another related field
Ability to systematically debug code, reduce I/O strain on ETL processes, and troubleshoot SQL for performance gains.
Knowledge of data engineering best practices across the development lifecycle – including agile methodologies, sustainable coding standards, code reviews, source code management, testing, and maintaining code.
Experience administering ESRI, Open Source, or Spatial Databases (GIS)
Intermediate knowledge of SQL for data management in a relational database
Intermediate knowledge of scripting languages such as Python or Node.js
Knowledge of Safe Software FME for extract, transforming, and load data operations
Experience with programmatically automating the extraction of data from public or vendor data APIs
Automating server-side scripting for backend data update pipelines
Working knowledge of the energy industry
Working knowledge of Power BI, Magik, and cloud architectures such as Amazon AWS or Microsoft Azure
Experience in Data Engineering and/or Data Architecture
Why work at AltaGas?
AltaGas is a North American energy infrastructure company with a focus on owning and operating assets that provide clean and affordable energy to our customers. AltaGas assets include Washington Gas/WGL, SEMCO, ENSTAR, and Petrogas. Our talented team, nearly 3,000 strong, leverages the strength of our assets and expertise along the energy value chain to connect customers with premier energy solutions – from the well sites of upstream producers to the doorsteps of homes and businesses to new markets around the world.
We deliver clean and affordable natural gas to approximately 1.6 million customers’ homes and businesses through regulated natural gas distribution utilities across five jurisdictions in the United States and two regulated natural gas storage utilities in the United States. Learn more about our team, vision, and strategy.
To learn more about our mission:

Job_title: Americas Credit, Fixed Income Corporate Actions Data Specialist
Job_description:
Bloomberg runs on data. In Data, we are responsible for onboarding, analyzing, and supplying data to answer our clients' most pressing questions. Our product is responsible for corporate action events affecting corporate bonds and preferred shares.
Whether you are sourcing relevant market data from new or existing providers, processing complex financial data or implementing technology solutions to enhance our processes and software, your work will ensure that we deliver accurate market data to the financial world first!

What you can expect from this opportunity:
You are the type of person that looks beyond the headline. You live for the detail and understand the importance of the underlying data that drives news and analysis. You enjoy the challenge of solving complex problems. You are just the sort of person we are looking for to join Data.

Bloomberg Data is looking for a highly motivated and driven individual to develop and expand the scope of Bloomberg's Fixed Income Corporate Actions Product. You will be part of a fast-paced environment and will be responsible for secondary market transactions happening on North American corporate bonds and preferred shares. Analysts within the team are in constant communication with liability management desks and other market participants who are involved with voluntary and mandatory distribution, redemption, and reorganization events. You will play a key role in producing financial content, calculations, research notes and analyses for our clients using the Bloomberg Terminal. Demonstrating a commitment to learning and a passion for the Fixed Income industry is required.

We'll trust you to:
Build positive and accountable relationships with clients, colleagues, and partners of the Fixed Income Corporate Actions product (including buy- and sell-side firms)
Acquire an understanding of the workflows designed to deliver class-leading quality while meeting or exceeding the timeliness demands of the market
Collaborate with colleagues to implement solutions and frameworks to enhance our processes, software, and data offerings
Maintain the existing proprietary database
Improve the relationships of our Terminal users to provide subject matter expertise by quickly and accurately answering client inquiries
Integrate your natural interests and strengths with the Fixed Income product to add value beyond data acquisition and remediation. Explore new strengths and opportunities by upskilling.
Support product development
You'll need you to have:
Relevant experience in a role within the financial markets, data analysis, information technology, credit document analysis, or research
2+ years of work experience is highly preferred
Proven ability to build and maintain client relationships
Effective research and analysis skills with attention to detail
Excellent communication, customer service, and teamwork skills
An interest in technology (Python, SQL, etc) and data analysis
Ability to spot market trends and act on them to enhance depth and breadth of coverage
Legal authorization to work in the US without visa sponsorship now or in the future
Does this sound like you?
Apply if you think we're a good match! We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are.

Job_title: Product Manager - Data Management Lab, Bloomberg Data Dictionary
Job_description:
Bloomberg's Data Management Lab enables internal and external users to efficiently leverage an elite data set to perform analysis, uncover vital insights. and make financial decisions. To this end, the Data Management Lab empowers our Data professionals to understand their domains end-to-end, make their products "ready-to-use", and improve the way users interact with our data. We focus on five areas of data management: discoverability, accessibility, appraisability, interoperability and consistency.

In this role you will be working with the Bloomberg Data Dictionary (BDD) team. We are in the midst of taking our metadata models and data management products to the next level. The goal is to promote the use of our data models by both external clients and internal applications. This person will have a high level of business, communication, and technology skills, so that they can build working prototypes as well as work optimally with internal stakeholders and clients.

The Role:

We are enhancing existing metamodels and metadata management systems. This includes building new tools and systems to manage, govern, link and discover metadata. It also involves developing and improving new functions and services to distribute metadata.

In this exciting role, we expect you to deliver a product vision and implement that vision in collaboration with Engineering, Product, and Data. You will be a key person in developing technical products that provide best-in-class customer experience. You will understand the requirements of both internal users, and external clients, and then shape the product offering to meet their needs. You would be familiar with specifying requirements including writing JIRA stories. You would have deep technical experience around using structured data models and data sets to solve complex business demands.

What's in it for you:
An influential business role within a fast-growing area of Bloomberg's Data business.
Broad scope to craft and specify meta-model for the company.
We'll trust you to:
Take responsibility for Bloomberg Data Dictionary's technology products.
Develop a product roadmap by evaluating what is possible and viable
Communicate the roadmap across the organization, and work with engineering to execute the roadmap
Develop functional and technical requirements by leading conversations among internal partners (Engineering, Product, Data, Sales), and clients
You'll need to have:
Bachelor's (or Master's) degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related technical discipline
4+ years of relevant work experience
Experience in developing and implementing technology systems
Understanding of data modelling (either ER, RDF, or other similar techniques)
Understanding of financials markets and how Bloomberg's clients use our data
The ability to address multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment
We'd love to see:
Knowledge of metadata systems and models
Knowledge of linked data and knowledge graphs
Knowledge of Market Data and Reference Data
Does this sound like you?

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are.

Job_title: Senior Software Engineer - Data Platform - Bloomberg Second Measure
Job_description:
Bloomberg is a data company that is redefining how people use alternative data. This transformation started with Bloomberg Second Measure (BSM), a data product for understanding company performance and consumer trends using consumer transaction data. These financial transactions are the foundation upon which we build as we acquire, ingest, enrich, and distribute additional alternative data sets to innovate through our novel and valuable data products.

The Alternative Data Platform team is a software and systems engineering team focused on providing a usable, scalable, and reliable platform for building data products from alternative data. Our platform provides primitives and abstractions enabling our users to creatively solve problems and run the powerful analytical workflows necessary for alternative data. We empower our users to focus on the data by reducing the pain and frustration of using existing data and analytics tools, and adopt new and innovative technologies to enable the continuous evolution necessary for innovation.

As the foundational engineering team supporting alternative data, the team has two core responsibilities:

Design, build, and maintain the data processing platform that empowers data scientists, data analysts, and data engineers to rapidly prototype and autonomously build, develop, and release data products
Design, build, and maintain the query and data infrastructure critical to the research, development, and publication of alternative data
We run our platform in AWS. We build upon open-source technologies such as Kubernetes, Spark, Argo Workflows, Argo Events, and Trino in addition to adopting and supporting open standards such as OpenAPI, CloudEvents, and Open Lineage. Our users inform and guide our roadmap. Together, we evolve and deliver an ambitious vision for how to develop data products.


What's in it for you:
You'll be part of a diverse team with varying levels of experience and backgrounds that work together to create the platform. We support each other where we have expertise and become experts together where we have none. We seek input and feedback from our teammates, valuing open discussion and collaboration.

You'll have an opportunity to:
Building APIs to orchestrate deployments and execution of data processing systems.
Prototype data and analytics technologies to adopt and incorporate into our platform.
Use established and existing technologies in novel ways to solve our problems.
Integrate and manage cloud resources and services.
Create tools and UIs to enhance usability and developer autonomy
We'll trust you to:
Build and maintain systems that are scalable, reliable, and usable while simplifying the complexities for the benefit of our users
Take ownership in the design and implementation of technical solutions from start to finish including prototyping, development, testing, and release.
Collaborate with your team and the wider engineering organization and Alternative Data product teams to achieve the team's goals.
Own the infrastructure, services, systems used to provide the platform.
Write and review code, develop documentation, debug problems with large, distributed, and complex systems.
You'll need to have:
4+ Years working with one or more of our development language (Python, Go, Typescript) and libraries, frameworks, and APIs within those languages.
A Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, similar field of study or equivalent work experience
Experience building, maintaining, and debugging production systems and services such as cloud infrastructure, load balancers and APIs.
Curiosity for investigating and understanding all areas of the platform whether it is working with AWS VPCs, improving a CLI used by developers, or understanding the primitive and logical types in a supported file format.
Experience with distributed systems and service architectures.
We'd love to see:
Polyglot engineers that are comfortable with using multiple languages for building production systems
Experience in and around technical data systems such as Spark, Flink, Dask, Clickhouse, Druid and technologies such as Parquet, Iceberg, and cloud object-stores.
Support of production systems with knowledge of Linux, networking (transport and application layer protocols), and deploying systems and services using Kubernetes, Mesos or Nomad.
Experience building on Kubernetes using the operator pattern, admission webhooks, and other services that work with the Kubernetes API.
Prior design and automating operations cloud infrastructure such as AWS, GCP, Azure using tools such as Terraform and Ansible

Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, ancestry, color, gender identity or expression, genetic predisposition or carrier status, marital status, national or ethnic origin, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, sexual and other reproductive health decisions, parental or caring status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy or parental leave, protected veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, or any other classification protected by applicable law.

Bloomberg is a disability inclusive employer. Please let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments to be made for the recruitment process. If you would prefer to discuss this confidentially, please email amer_recruit@bloomberg.net.

Interviewing with us:
We believe interviewing is a two way street. It's a way for us to get to know you and your skills, and also a way for you to learn more about the team, our technical challenges, and what you'd be working on. The content of each interview round will be tailored to the role and your background.

We want to ensure you can put your best foot forward throughout the process, so if you have any questions or need any accommodations to be successful, please let us know!

We have a lot of opportunities to choose from in Engineering, and it is important to us that your skills and experience align best with the team you are interviewing with. To help ensure you are placed on the right team, your application will be considered for all of our current vacancies in Engineering at the first stage of the interview process.

Salary Range: 160,000 - 240,000 USD Annually + Benefits + Bonus

The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as geographic location, work experience, market conditions, education/training and skill level.
