In a nutshell

LOCATION

San Diego - CA, US

TEAM

IT

WORK EXPERIENCE

3-7 years

JOB CATEGORY

Computer science & software engineering, Data science

TRAVEL

10%
JOB ID: J-00252297-997
Introduction to the job
ASML US, including its affiliates and subsidiaries, bring together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon.
Job Mission
ASML and its subsidiaries, including Cymer Light Source, are critically dependent on their ability to leverage enterprise / business process data from internal business systems and applications, from suppliers, and from customers to run, optimize, and improve our business operations and services.The processing, enrichment, and consumption of this data is essential to improve business processes, drive operational performance improvements and continuously increase efficiencies in customer service and business operations.
The mission of this position is to extend and sustain the Cymer Light Source enterprise / business process data foundation to enable business benefits and improvement that support our business growth and new requirements in business insight, business capabilities, and integration as well as technical data volume, data processing, and trusted data enablement.
This position may require access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require the Company to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.

Role and responsibilities

This role is based in San Diego. The selected candidate will be part of the ASML IT Solution Delivery Analytics US team and is responsible for understanding and delivering new analytics capabilities on the Cymer Light Source enterprise / business process data landscape (including data repositories, data pipelines, applications, analytics, etc.) in order to support, maintain, and improve business operations and processes dependent on the CLS information management landscape.As a business intelligence analyst, the selected candidate will collaborate with business counterparts to understand and co-deliver data management and analytics improvements within an Agile SCRUM team.
ASML is a crucial player in a fast moving semiconductor industry which means change is a constant. You will work with your team to capture the constant and dynamic refinement of business priorities and data & analytics user stories. You are looked upon, and rewarded for, being able constantly switch between business value and technical implementation. Together with your team you will work constantly to drive ASML’s ambition by building a modern Data & Analytics platform and data foundation, using modern DevOps and Cloud components and leveraging the Agile mindset fully.
Duties and Responsibilities
Assess, design, and implement enterprise analytics solutions for CLS by working.
Understanding CLS business processes, industry trends and innovations, and their impact on technology.
Understand and enable tactical and strategic enterprise goals that provide traceability through the organization and are mapped to metrics that provide ongoing governance.
Ensures the Program Backlog is visible, maintained, prepared, documented and prioritized.
Actively participate in relevant Scrum and SAFe rituals and take part in continuous journey toward a more agile organization.
Develop a business architecture strategy based on a situational awareness of various business scenarios and motivations. Apply a structured business architecture approach and methodology for capturing the key views of the enterprise.
Understand the primary business operations of the enterprise and understand the data and analytics linkage to customer-facing, supplier-related, business execution and business management functions.
Understands how products, operations, systems, and data interoperate within the organization.
Orchestrate end-to-end business data model needle across the entire CLS enterprise organization, including steering and governing the definition and maintenance of the conceptual, logical and physical end-to-end (product) data model for the full CLS business process landscape (D&E, Manufacturing, Supply Chain, Service and Support).
Ensure solutions developed across organization are aligned to enterprise architecture standards and principles, leverage common solutions and services, and meet financial targets (cost and benefits).
Drive the priority and need for robust, enterprise-grade data pipelines from external and internal data sources into on-premise and on-cloud data targets.
Strengthen existing data pipelines to improve reliability and availability.
Strong partner in discussions with solution team system architect and other stakeholders within the internal customer departments.
Contribute to the design and implementation to the innovation and improvement of the ASML data foundation
Keep abreast with relevant business and IT domains, literature, means and methods.
Other duties as assigned.
Job description subject to change at any time.

Education and experience

Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics and Data Analytics, Operations Management and Analysis, or equivalent technical domain.Master’s degree a plus.
Business Management or Operational Excellence degree or equivalent certificates (i.e. Lean Six Sigma, etc.) a plus
Supply Chain Operations Reference (SCOR-P), American Productivity & Quality Center (APQC) certifications a plus.
Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience working on improving business operations via data and analytics capabilities

Minimum of 3 years working in Agile SCRUM teams as an analyst, developer, data engineer, or similar role
Demonstrated knowledge in implementing data and analytics capabilities business process operational excellence through, key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics
Demonstrated competence with benefits, design and management of leveraging structured and unstructured data for business operations improvements
Demonstrated expertise in complex products business environment and business domains (Innovation/R&D, Supply chain, Manufacturing, Customer Service); experience with semiconductor industry, discrete high-tech manufacturing, and global supply chain / logistics a plus. Solid understanding of ASML and Cymer environments and business operations a plus.
Demonstrated expertise with assessing and implementing data-centric initiatives, information policy formation, information taxonomy and business data modeling
Demonstrated competence in business domain analysis
Familiar with data warehousing (design and operations) and database design concepts
Working knowledge with enterprise business systems (Oracle EBS, SAP, Agile PLM, etc.)
Working knowledge and understanding of benefits and positioning of data virtualization
Working knowledge of data science, data mining, OLAP programming, database management and programming, business process modeling and analysis
Working knowledge of open source or commercial data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, QlikView, Spotfire, etc.)
Working knowledge of statistical computing and graphics programming languages
Familiar with data governance principles, enterprise data modeling, and data management practices
Familiar with model-based representations that can be adjusted as required to collect, aggregate or disaggregate complex and conflicting information about the business

Skills

Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:
Strong customer focus and commitment to customer success through prioritization, quality, efficiency and professionalism.
Strong communication skills and the ability to communicate appropriately at all levels of the organization; this includes written and verbal communications as well as visualizations
Effective team leadership, team-building and communication skills
Broad, enterprise-wide view of business functions and passion for understanding business strategy, processes and capabilities, enabling technologies, and governance
Ability to recognize and tackle structural issues within the organization, functional interdependencies and cross-silo redundancies
Ability to appreciate and apply architectural principles and position innovative ideas to business solutions
Ability to visualize and create high-level models that can be used in future analysis to extend and mature the business architecture
The ability to act as liaison conveying information needs of the business to IT and data constraints to the business; applies equal conveyance regarding business strategy and IT strategy, business processes and work flow automation, business initiatives and IT initiatives, and benefit realization and service delivery
Team player able to work effectively at all levels of an organization with the ability to influence others to move toward consensus
Strong situational analysis and decision making abilities
Can observe and respond to people and situations and interact with others encountered in the course of work.
Can learn and apply new information or skills.
Must be able to read and interpret data, information, and documents.
Ability to complete assignments with attention to detail and high degree of accuracy.
Proven ability to perform effectively in a demanding environment with changing workloads.
Result driven-demonstrate ownership and accountability.
Identifies bottlenecks and drives improvements.
Work independently or as part of a team and follow through on assignments with minimal supervision.
Demonstrate open, clear, concise and professional communication.
Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with co-workers and customer.
Work according to a strict set of procedures within the provided timelines.
Proficient use of all Microsoft Office suite programs

About Us*
Dolls Kill is the go-to brand globally for those who are going to be whoever the $#%@ they want to be. About the Role

Job_title: Cloud Data Engineer I - AWS, Python, Snowflake, SQL
Job_description:
Who Are We?

Taking care of our customers, our communities and each other. That’s the Travelers Promise. By honoring this commitment, we have maintained our reputation as one of the best property casualty insurers in the industry for over 160 years. Join us to discover a culture that is rooted in innovation and thrives on collaboration. Imagine loving what you do and where you do it.

Compensation Overview

The annual base salary range provided for this position is a nationwide market range and represents a broad range of salaries for this role across the country. The actual salary for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. As part of our comprehensive compensation and benefits program, employees are also eligible for performance-based cash incentive awards.

Salary Range

$102,600.00 - $169,200.00

Target Openings

1

What Is the Opportunity?

Travelers Data Engineering team constructs pipelines that contextualize and provide easy access to data by the entire enterprise. As a Data Engineer, you will play a key role in growing and transforming our analytics landscape. In addition to your strong analytical mind, you will bring your inquisitive attitude and ability to translate the stories found in data. You will leverage your ability to design, build and deploy data solutions that capture, explore, transform, and utilize data to support Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and business intelligence/insights.

What Will You Do?

Build and operationalize complex data solutions, correct problems, apply transformations, and recommend data cleansing/quality solutions.
Design data solutions.
Analyze sources to determine value and recommend data to include in analytical processes.
Incorporate core data management competencies including data governance, data security and data quality.
Collaborate within and across teams to support delivery and educate end users on data products/analytic environment.
Perform data and system analysis, assessment and resolution for defects and incidents of moderate complexity and correct as appropriate.
Test data movement, transformation code, and data components.
Perform other duties as assigned.

What Will Our Ideal Candidate Have?

Bachelor’s Degree in STEM related field or equivalent
Six years of related experience
Proficient use of tools (Snowflake, Databricks), techniques, and manipulation including Cloud platforms (AWS), programming languages (Python and/or Java), and an understanding of software engineering practices.
The ability to deliver work at a steady, predictable pace to achieve commitments, decompose work assignments into small batch releases, and contribute to tradeoff and negotiation discussions.
Demonstrated track record of domain expertise including the ability to understand technical concepts and possess in-depth knowledge of immediate systems worked on.
Proven problem solving skills including debugging skills, allowing you to determine source of issues in unfamiliar code or systems and the ability to recognize and solve repetitive problems.
Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact with team members and business partners.
Leadership - Intermediate leadership skills with a proven track record of self-motivation in identifying personal growth opportunities.

What is a Must Have?

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent training with data tools, techniques, and manipulation.
Four years of data engineering or equivalent experience.

What Is in It for You?

Health Insurance: Employees and their eligible family members – including spouses, domestic partners, and children – are eligible for coverage from the first day of employment.
Retirement: Travelers matches your 401(k) contributions dollar-for-dollar up to your first 5% of eligible pay, subject to an annual maximum. If you have student loan debt, you can enroll in the Paying it Forward Savings Program. When you make a payment toward your student loan, Travelers will make an annual contribution into your 401(k) account. You are also eligible for a Pension Plan that is 100% funded by Travelers.
Paid Time Off: Start your career at Travelers with a minimum of 20 days Paid Time Off annually, plus nine paid company Holidays.
Wellness Program: The Travelers wellness program is comprised of tools and resources that empower you to achieve your wellness goals. In addition, our Life Balance program provides access to professional counseling services, life coaching and other resources to support your daily life needs. Through Life Balance, you’re eligible for five free counseling sessions with a licensed therapist.
Volunteer Encouragement: We have a deep commitment to the communities we serve and encourage our employees to get involved. Travelers has a Matching Gift and Volunteer Rewards program that enables you to give back to the charity of your choice.

Employment Practices

Travelers is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that we can deliver the very best products and services when our workforce reflects the diverse customers and communities we serve. We are committed to recruiting, retaining and developing the diverse talent of all of our employees and fostering an inclusive workplace, where we celebrate differences, promote belonging, and work together to deliver extraordinary results.



If you are a candidate and have specific questions regarding the physical requirements of this role, please send us an email so we may assist you.


Travelers reserves the right to fill this position at a level above or below the level included in this posting.

To learn more about our comprehensive benefit programs please visit http://careers.travelers.com/life-at-travelers/benefits/.

GFS Chemicals is a family owned and operated business in Columbus, Ohio serving customers worldwide since 1928. You will be joining an established, close knit family organization that has been proudly dedicated to quality, service, and innovation in the specialty chemicals market. We are currently seeking a ERP Business Analyst to join our GFS Chemicals Family.

Required Skills: ERP Configuration; D365; Advanced SQL and SQL DB skills, DB Management, .net and X+ experience. Microsoft Office 365 and managing projects;
Understanding of the relational databases and basic programming skills (SQL, HTML, Microsoft.Net, etc.); and
Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with all levels internally and externally, both in writing and verbally. This includes the ability to present information in one-on-one and small group situations.

Responsibilities:
Under the general direction and supervision of the IT Manager, the ERP Business Analyst will be responsible for all things ERP, including leading the ERP transition to the cloud, security, database management and working in partnership with our business unit leaders to understand their business requirements to maximize our use of the ERP system. Individuals with temporary visas or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future are not eligible for hire.

Job_title: Senior Software Engineer - Data Platform - Bloomberg Second Measure
Job_description:
Bloomberg is a data company that is redefining how people use alternative data. This transformation started with Bloomberg Second Measure (BSM), a data product for understanding company performance and consumer trends using consumer transaction data. These financial transactions are the foundation upon which we build as we acquire, ingest, enrich, and distribute additional alternative data sets to innovate through our novel and valuable data products.

The Alternative Data Platform team is a software and systems engineering team focused on providing a usable, scalable, and reliable platform for building data products from alternative data. Our platform provides primitives and abstractions enabling our users to creatively solve problems and run the powerful analytical workflows necessary for alternative data. We empower our users to focus on the data by reducing the pain and frustration of using existing data and analytics tools, and adopt new and innovative technologies to enable the continuous evolution necessary for innovation.

As the foundational engineering team supporting alternative data, the team has two core responsibilities:

Design, build, and maintain the data processing platform that empowers data scientists, data analysts, and data engineers to rapidly prototype and autonomously build, develop, and release data products
Design, build, and maintain the query and data infrastructure critical to the research, development, and publication of alternative data
We run our platform in AWS. We build upon open-source technologies such as Kubernetes, Spark, Argo Workflows, Argo Events, and Trino in addition to adopting and supporting open standards such as OpenAPI, CloudEvents, and Open Lineage. Our users inform and guide our roadmap. Together, we evolve and deliver an ambitious vision for how to develop data products.


What's in it for you:
You'll be part of a diverse team with varying levels of experience and backgrounds that work together to create the platform. We support each other where we have expertise and become experts together where we have none. We seek input and feedback from our teammates, valuing open discussion and collaboration.

You'll have an opportunity to:
Building APIs to orchestrate deployments and execution of data processing systems.
Prototype data and analytics technologies to adopt and incorporate into our platform.
Use established and existing technologies in novel ways to solve our problems.
Integrate and manage cloud resources and services.
Create tools and UIs to enhance usability and developer autonomy
We'll trust you to:
Build and maintain systems that are scalable, reliable, and usable while simplifying the complexities for the benefit of our users
Take ownership in the design and implementation of technical solutions from start to finish including prototyping, development, testing, and release.
Collaborate with your team and the wider engineering organization and Alternative Data product teams to achieve the team's goals.
Own the infrastructure, services, systems used to provide the platform.
Write and review code, develop documentation, debug problems with large, distributed, and complex systems.
You'll need to have:
4+ Years working with one or more of our development language (Python, Go, Typescript) and libraries, frameworks, and APIs within those languages.
A Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, similar field of study or equivalent work experience
Experience building, maintaining, and debugging production systems and services such as cloud infrastructure, load balancers and APIs.
Curiosity for investigating and understanding all areas of the platform whether it is working with AWS VPCs, improving a CLI used by developers, or understanding the primitive and logical types in a supported file format.
Experience with distributed systems and service architectures.
We'd love to see:
Polyglot engineers that are comfortable with using multiple languages for building production systems
Experience in and around technical data systems such as Spark, Flink, Dask, Clickhouse, Druid and technologies such as Parquet, Iceberg, and cloud object-stores.
Support of production systems with knowledge of Linux, networking (transport and application layer protocols), and deploying systems and services using Kubernetes, Mesos or Nomad.
Experience building on Kubernetes using the operator pattern, admission webhooks, and other services that work with the Kubernetes API.
Prior design and automating operations cloud infrastructure such as AWS, GCP, Azure using tools such as Terraform and Ansible

Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, ancestry, color, gender identity or expression, genetic predisposition or carrier status, marital status, national or ethnic origin, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, sexual and other reproductive health decisions, parental or caring status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy or parental leave, protected veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, or any other classification protected by applicable law.

Bloomberg is a disability inclusive employer. Please let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments to be made for the recruitment process. If you would prefer to discuss this confidentially, please email amer_recruit@bloomberg.net.

Interviewing with us:
We believe interviewing is a two way street. It's a way for us to get to know you and your skills, and also a way for you to learn more about the team, our technical challenges, and what you'd be working on. The content of each interview round will be tailored to the role and your background.

We want to ensure you can put your best foot forward throughout the process, so if you have any questions or need any accommodations to be successful, please let us know!

We have a lot of opportunities to choose from in Engineering, and it is important to us that your skills and experience align best with the team you are interviewing with. To help ensure you are placed on the right team, your application will be considered for all of our current vacancies in Engineering at the first stage of the interview process.

Salary Range: 160,000 - 240,000 USD Annually + Benefits + Bonus

The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as geographic location, work experience, market conditions, education/training and skill level.

We offer one of the most comprehensive and generous benefits plans available and offer a range of total rewards that may include merit increases, incentive compensation [Exempt roles only], paid holidays, paid time off, medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, life insurance, and various wellness programs, among others. The Company does not provide benefits directly to contingent workers/contractors and interns.

The Mobile Workforce Business Analyst will provide technical support to the Unified Mobile Computing Platform including aligning user requirements between IT and the operating departments, understand and document stakeholders needs, analyze technical and business impacts of proposed changes, conduct day to day maintenance and administration, create and manage reports, perform user training, manage security, roles, and permissions and troubleshoot and resolve production issues. Meets with governing body of stakeholders to obtain sponsorship and arranges funding for changes to existing functionality and new features

Valid California Driver License

Experience working in an Scrum environment

Ability to communicate effectively; both verbally and in writing, with agencies, contractors, consultants, customers, employees, and vendors

Knowledge and ability to use Microsoft Office applications to create presentations, spreadsheets, and Word documents

Demonstrated organizational and time management skills

Experience writing Scrum user stories

Job_title: Global Risk Data & Business Intelligence Manager
Job_description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO

Global Risk Management (RM) is dedicated to identifying and managing significant risk exposure at BCG.

The Data & Business Intelligence Manager position involves designing, managing, and deploying data analytics, reports, and dynamic dashboards. The tools and dashboard created will be utilized by both the Assurance and Advisory team and key functional stakeholders. This position is responsible for extracting data from multiple sources, processing and validating data, and conducting root cause and trend analysis. The Data & Business Intelligence Manager will also present analytic findings to various stakeholders.


In addition, this role will participate in risk assessment for BCG Offices, functions and processes and looks to provide management with an independent and objective assessment of business risk and internal controls.

The successful candidate should be comfortable performing the following: writing queries in programing languages such as SQL and Python, developing analytical visualizations using Alteryx and Tableau (e.g. building complex dashboards), understanding cloud data warehousing (e.g. Snowflake), business intelligence architecture, application and design, Machine Learning & AI concepts. The candidate must also understand and assess risks across a wide variety of business areas, build relationships with diverse stakeholders, manage a complex network of individuals, influence change management across the organization, prioritize issues, and escalate appropriately.

YOU'RE GOOD AT
We are looking for someone with a passion and understanding of data analytics and business intelligence, risk management, change management, and global business. The role will entail the following:

Data & Business Analytics (60%)
Assist the team with developing short-, medium- and long-term data analytics strategy
Review, update, and investigate pertinent data from various data sources to ensure a high level of quality, accuracy, and timeliness
Query multiple data sources using programing languages such as SQL and Python
Produce visualization and developing dashboards using Tableau/Alteryx
Analyze data and provide insights and recommendations for organizational planning and operations.
Create business analytics by synthesizing information from multiple sources of data for business decisions and strategic planning.
Demonstrate continuous effort to improve operations, streamline work processes, and work cooperatively and jointly to provide quality deliverables
Provide training and education to the team on data and analytics related topics

Office Risk Review Program (20%)
Meet with Office Leadership and the Global Functions to lead the planning, execution, and post-review efforts for a portfolio of Office risk reviews and BCG’s extension businesses.
Travel to any BCG’s Office throughout the world and work with the team to develop and maintain the risk review work program
Assist the team with the execution of risk reviews to assess the risk and controls environment in the offices and test the effectiveness of controls
Perform substantive tests of transactions
Prepare timely and comprehensive documentation of findings and recommendations, including local management comments
Maintain risk profiles for each office and prioritizing offices for a visit
Act as a risk liaison with the local office, providing support and education on important risk issues
Global Process Review Program (20%)
Lead targeted functional/operating risk reviews, which are focused on global or regional processes.
Responsibilities will include defining the project scope and strategy, conducting process walk-throughs, performing detailed testing, drafting detailed reporting/action plans, and following up on implementation efforts.
Focus on the scope and objectives of each review to ensure the highest risk areas are addressed and the key findings are communicated
Evaluate, in detail, the use of new digital technologies and the risks these solutions may pose to the global functions as BCG’s business operations continue to evolve and modernize.
Develop relationships with key functional leaders.
Work with Global Risk Management Senior Director to develop an annual plan of global functional risk reviews; align staffing and coordinate scheduling with key stakeholders.
Monitor trends and emerging issues for reporting to leadership (i.e., Audit and Risk Committee).
Act as a risk liaison with the global functions, providing support and education on important risk issues.
YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)
An academic degree in a relevant discipline: Data Science, Business Analytics, Mathematics or Computer Science
5+ years successful experience related to Data Warehouse and Data Analytics, preferably in professional services, or the consulting industry.
Understanding of enterprise data warehouses (Snowflake), business intelligence architecture, application and design, ML & AI concepts
Deep knowledge of current analytics technologies and software applications such as SQL/Python query language, Alteryx, Tableau and Microsoft tools
Strong analytical skills with detail orientation; strong communication skills – written and verbal
Ability to work cross-functionally in a global environment
Ability to travel to all BCG office locations Worldwide
Travel is required approximately 15% of the time, with the need to be flexible if additional travel is required. Travel is typically one week in length (may include weekends) but must be adaptable for risk reviews of up to 2+ weeks if required. Travel is generally planned well in advance but must be flexible to travel on limited notice.
Travel will align with BCG’s Covid-19 protocols and applicable laws and regulations.
YOU'LL WORK WITH
Local/system/regional operational leaders, global functional leaders, and BCG leadership. BCG's Chief Risk Officer leads the team, which is comprised of team members across various cities and countries. This role will report to the Global Risk Management Director
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
Candidates should be aware that BCG currently maintains a policy requiring all US & Canada based employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Newly hired employees must be fully vaccinated prior to their employment start date. BCG is an equal opportunity employer and will provide a reasonable accommodation to those unable to be vaccinated for medical or religious reasons where it is not an undue hardship to the company to do so as provided under applicable federal, state, provincial and local law.

Job_description:
Job Locations: US-VA-Smithfield Your Opportunity:
The Finance/Accounting team is seeking out driven, detail-oriented professionals to exercise GAAP principles while preserving the superior financial standing of our company.

The Accounting Senior Business Analyst - Internal Tax is responsible for multi-state and local sales and use tax, property tax, and other business tax administration and compliance, including research and analysis of related tax laws and communication with state and local jurisdictions and authorities, for multiple legal entities.
Core Responsibilities:
Accurate and timely payment and reporting of sales and use taxes. Review some returns.
Accurate and timely payment of property taxes. Be aware of business activities impacting property tax liability and ensure accruals are appropriate.
Accurate and timely payment and reporting of other business taxes
Research and respond to organization inquiries regarding taxability issues and tax law changes
Respond to sales and use tax exemption certificate inquiries
Lead tax audits
Complete and/or approve tax account reconciliations
Lead response gathering and preparation of Federal and State corporate income tax packages for multiple legal entities
Manage Unclaimed Property reporting and administration
Create SOPs and maintain process documentation
Demonstrate continuous efforts to improve processes, increase data integrity and provide quality customer service to business partners
Complete project work and special request assignments as needed
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. May perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals to perform the essential functions.
Bachelor’s Degree from a regionally accredited four-year college or university in Accounting or related field and 5+ years’ experience with sales and use tax, property tax, other business taxes, and general accounting; or equivalent combination of education or experience, required.
Thorough knowledge of financial and business principles, including GAAP.
Experience in manufacturing industry a plus.
Experience with RIA Checkpoint or other tax research software.
Solid math skills.
Strong initiative and ability to manage multiple projects, as well as strong follow through skills.
Detail oriented and strong organizational skills.
Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Ability to complete projects timely and accurately.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work well with others in fast paced, dynamic environment.
Ability to be respectful, approachable and team oriented while building strong working relationships and a positive work environment.

To learn more about Smithfield’s benefits, visit smithfieldfoods.com/careerbenefits.



PEOPLE MATTER


More than 63,000 employees globally drive our success. We strive to create a fair, ethical and rewarding work environment.



GROWTH & DEVELOPMENT


Working at Smithfield isn't just a job – it's the foundation for a lifelong career with training designed to help you advance professionally.



BENEFITS


Our people matter. That's why we offer excellent, comprehensive benefits packages to our full-time employees.



SUSTAINABILITY PLEDGE


Sustainability is ingrained in our culture and guides how we operate. We believe in innovating for the future.



About Smithfield Foods:
Headquartered in Smithfield, Va. since 1936, Smithfield Foods, Inc. is an American food company with agricultural roots and a global reach. With more than 60,000 jobs globally, we are dedicated to producing "Good food. Responsibly®" and serve as one of the world's leading vertically integrated protein companies. We have pioneered sustainability standards for more than two decades, including our industry-leading commitments to become carbon negative in our U.S. company-owned operations and reduce GHG emissions 30 percent across our entire U.S. value chain by 2030. We believe in the power of protein to end food insecurity and have donated hundreds of millions of food servings to our communities. Smithfield boasts a portfolio of high-quality iconic brands, such as Smithfield®, Eckrich® and Nathan's Famous®, among many others. For more information, visit www.smithfieldfoods.com, and connect with us on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn and Instagram.

Job_description:
Benefits Overview:

Job Description:
The Enterprise Data Architect – Analytics & Insights, drives collaboration on ideation, design, development, and execution of long-range data & analytic technology, architecture, and capability roadmaps across all business and enterprise technology disciplines which anticipate future business needs and maximize long-term investment. This role works closely with strategy and executive business leaders to create alignment between business and technology as well as best practices and solutions around (disciplines) and operations to align with strategic intentions, identifies expected business outcomes, and explores implications and risks associated analytic engineering investment decisions. The Enterprise Data Architect establishes standards and solutions which align to CoBank’s strategic goals, and which provide clear constraints and guidelines for other architects and product delivery teams. The architect translates business drivers into hands-on analysis, architecture development and tactics, and communicates strategic direction to business and technology partners in the areas of advanced analytics, business intelligence (BI) reporting, data mining, visualization, data science, and AI. This role consults with information technology, data governance, data engineering, platform architecture, data analytics, product creation and development staff to understand desired business outcomes, design and implement scripts, programs, databases, software components and analyses that will support product quality and an in depth understanding of potential uses of the data in service of short and long term business objectives as guided by CoBank’s Key Strategic Priorities and prioiritized use cases. Serves as a primary contributor in the determination of what information/data the enterprise captures, leverages and retains. Advises and mentors other direct and indirect team members.


Essential Duties

The essential functions include, but are not limited to:

Serves as a key enterprise resource and subject matter expert (SME) in the areas of advanced data technologies and techniques, including data visualization, data virtualization,text mining, data discovery, statistical methods, reporting and analytics, data modeling, data product, and consults on data access, data integration, database design and implementation.
Assists with the definition of the multi-year EIM strategy and Digital Transformation roadmap. Defines supporting data strategies to help achieve the Enterprise Information Management roadmap for the enterprise; informing implementation and data management for the enterprise data warehouse and advanced data analytics and reporting systems informed by new data sources, publicly available data, and business-to-business partnerships. Defines and develops a solution architecture approach to data and analytic consumption strategy.
The enterprise data architect establishes an analytic and insights strategy and roadmap that enables a business function to leverage and support current and future business capabilities. They drive design, analytic patterns, reusable semantic layer, and envision architectures which promotes centralization of core capabilities and federation through self-service. Relying on continuous business and technical feedback, the architect will foster adaptive design, engineering practices, and drive the teams to rally around a shared technical vision.
Influence future-state data science, modeling, experimentation, and in collaboration with engineering and platform facilitate scale through modern compute such Machine Learning (ML)
Leads Business Intelligence, Analytic, or Data Science projects and works with the Business SMEs and IT Business Analysts to understand business objectives and strategies and recommend innovative data solutions. Collect business requirements from business partners and transform the requirements into data processes and data schemas. Draws conclusions and effectively communicates findings with both technical and non-technical team members, providing active leadership skills across project team and business community and ensure a successful implementation.
Creates and maintains the enterprise data architecture, strategy, standards, policies, and best practices to support the business and technology initiatives in support of analytic and insight capability.
Establishes standards and guidelines for the design & development, tuning, deployment and maintenance of information, advanced data analytics, and data mining models and physical data persistence technologies. Evaluates and designs data collection, data staging, data movement, analytics delivery, data quality and archiving strategies.
Act as an Analytic and Insights Subject Matter Expert (SME) on strategic initiatives and ensure that all aspects of the solution are compliant with established Enterprise data architecture best practices and the Digital Transformation roadmap.
Develops and maintains enterprise data dictionary as part of the multi-year IT strategy and Enterprise Information Management roadmap. Resolve semantic discrepancies in data definitions that arise among multiple sources and projects.
Collaborates with the business and other IT areas to create and implement a long term data storage and business continuity strategy including backup & recovery and data storage and archiving.
Measures the effectiveness of various enterprise data standards and policies and proactively recommends and activates additional guidelines, standards and policies. Socializes, refines and implements reccomendations with Architecture Review Board.
Collaborate with leaders within the Enteprise Data Capabilities and Data Products team and Enterprise Architecture to develop and monitor Key Risk Indicators (KRI), enabling measurement of successful adoption and adherence of architecture standards, processes, and guidelines.
Represent Enterprise Information Management (EIM) at the Architecture Review Board (ARB), ensuring that Enterprise Data Standards are actively adopted across application, technology, and analytic initiatives.
Work closely with other Enterprise Information Management and Data Capabilities and Product leaders to establish an actionable Analytics and Insights Center of Enablement (COE), continuously mentoring and evolving a disciplined practice of refer enable and repeatable standards and guidelines, creating a framework where project teams can self-serve their specific project needs in a federated manner.

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Information Technology, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, or a related field
Ten (10) or more years of progressively responsible experience in a directly-related field, including five (5) or more years of information technology experience in data architecture, design and system integration.

Preferred Qualifications

Expert level understanding of Reporting, Business Intelligence, Diagnostic, and Descriptive Analytic capabilities and supported tools.
Demonstrated experience with advanced analytic capabilities such as Predictive and Prescriptive approaches using Data Science, Machine Learning, AI is required.
Advanced level ability to work with Diverse tools such as Tableau, SSRS, Cognos, Alteryx, Denodo, RapidMiner, SAS, Alteryx etc.
Extensive knowledge of relational SQL databases and SQL in at least one of the following environments: Oracle. Microsoft SQL Server or MySQL, as well as data modeling, both logical and physical.
Good understanding of fit-for-purpose NoSQL data stores such as Graph, Document, Key-Value Stores etc.
Extensive experience in multidimensional data modeling, such as star schemas, snowflakes, normalized and de-normalized models, handling “slow-changing” dimensions/attributes, and presentation through data virtualization, semantic layers, Enterprise Service Bus (ESB), and Data Services (API)
Extensive experience providing practical direction on information and analytics platforms in conjunction with EDW tools and technologies.
Experience with project management methodologies (e.g. SCRUM), ITIL and SDLC methodologies (e.g. DevOps, Data Observability, CI/CD etc.). Posesses a demonstrated ability to lead, with knowledge of project management concepts and implementation techniques, process reengineering, and change management.
Strong knowledge of business process, data or information management, data flows, data relationships, data quality standards, processes and proficiency with data analytical and quality tools.
Knowledge of the Microsoft Azure and/or AWS infrastructure and solution stacks operating in on-premise, cloud, and hybrid hosting environments preferred.
Experience in the creation and maintainence of canonical data models
Proficient in all aspects of enterprise data and information lifecycle management, and with proven experience and an understanding of a wide variety of analytical processes (governance, measurement, information security, etc.).
Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills, with demonstrated ability to translate technical information to a non-technical audience at all levels of the organization; strong reporting and analytical skills with a focus on detail, thoroughness, and quality. Able to build consensus and communicate effectively with customers, business partners, IT resources and vendors.
Experience in the Financial Services and/or agricultural industry preferred, with a basic knowledge of banking and lending terminology preferred.


Special Requirements

Availability for occasional work outside normal business hours.
Availability for occasional travel.


Compensation Information

Estimated Base Salary Range: $140,000-$190,000
Target short-term incentive opportunity: 20%
About CoBank:

CoBank stands strong as an enterprise dedicated to the financial needs of rural communities. That means we help fund new ways to grow food, generate energy, access technology, and otherwise improve life in America. When you choose a career with us, you make a difference by doing work that matters. A career at CoBank can offer you the opportunity to make a personal impact on the people and communities where we do business. We also provide competitive compensation, health and wellness benefits, company-funded retirement plan, matching 401(k), and professional development programs.


CoBank will not consider a work visa H1B, EAD (Employment Authorization Document or Permit) or OPT (Optional Practical Training) for this position.
CoBank is an Equal Opportunity Employer.


CoBank requires all newly hired associates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, and new hires will be asked to register their proof of vaccination. Any offer of employment will be conditioned upon an applicant supplying proof of vaccination against COVID-19; provided, however that CoBank may provide a reasonable accommodation for an applicant’s known disability or sincerely held religious belief.

Job_title: Data Center Automation Systems - Junior CAD Operator
Job_description:
Posted
07-Mar-2023
Service line
GWS Segment
Role type
Full-time
Areas of Interest
Construction, Data Centers
Location(s)
Charleston - South Carolina - United States of America, Moncks Corner - South Carolina - United States of America, North Charleston - South Carolina - United States of America, Summerville - South Carolina - United States of America
Job Summary
The Datacenter Automation Systems (DAS) team is committed to the successful implementation of autonomous and semi-autonomous vehicles throughout multiple datacenters. CBRE is seeking a full-time, permanent, CAD Operator with experience in MEP design, manufacturing or data center robotics-centric automation solutions. The DAS CAD Operator will report to the Client-approved location:
Moncks Corner, SC - full time / on site
The DAS CAD Operator requirements may vary according to Client-determined assignments, but most content relates to creating detailed designs for industrial automation equipment and systems in the DAS robotics portfolio at the Client's data centers. This position is part of a multi-disciplinary team creating engineering documentation and design drawing packages. The individual will collaborate with project engineers, technical writers, project managers, and other CAD/BIM Operators. Ideal candidates would be familiar with establishing and managing a design environment. Ideal candidates must be comfortable communicating regularly via video conference, email and internal ticketing systems.

Job Duties:
Acquire clear understanding of product requirements by reviewing, understanding, interpreting and revising technical specifications, blueprints and engineering illustrations, mockups, and prototypes.
Ability to read and interpret design standards and specifications, blueprints, drawings, redlines, etc
Coordinate the CAD design for Navigation Tape and GeoMarker installation package
Installation Drawings
Navigation DesignLayout
GeoMarker datum development
Material Takeoff
Working understanding of construction design package development for field installation.
Ability to translate existing field conditions from documentation and redlines to revise/edit design drawing packages.
Ability to learn software such as Lucidchart to generate shape files for navigation translated from design drawings. .
Capable of managing shifting design production to coordinate with field installation schedules.
Coordinate file management with 3rd party teams for document file transfer.
Maintain audits of latest design revisions against floor plan modifications.
Ability to perform repetitive field measurement tasks for long durations such as bending, kneeling, squatting ,walking, climbing stairs, etc.
Must have excellent organizational skills
Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing

Other duties as assigned.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position.

QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree in Architecture, Engineering, Construction Management, or related field. Minimum two or more years' construction administration, architecture, engineering or similar experience.

Preferred experience with some data center infrastructure projects. Experience in mission critical data centers is a strong plus. Preferred experience with robotic process automation.

CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES

Working towards or eligible for licensure as either a Professional Engineer or Registered Architect is desired.

COMMUNICATION SKILLS

Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.

FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE

Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis.

REASONING ABILITY

Ability to understand and carry out general instructions in standard situations. Ability to solve problems in standard situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.

OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES

Intermediate skills with Microsoft Office Suite. Ability to read and understand architectural drawings. Working knowledge in MS Project is helpful. Knowledge of leases, contracts, and construction practices preferred. 3+ years of minimum proficiency in the use of AutoCAD and Revit. Knowledge of Best Management Practices CAD/BIM environment. Autodesk Software - CAD BIM Solidworks BIM360 etc.

Basic knowledge of the entitlement/permitting process and construction delivery methods and agreements. Some familiarity with construction best practices, general building codes, and various building types and systems. Passion for being detail oriented and highly organized.

SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY

Decisions made with general understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.

We are looking for someone who understands business needs, analyzes existing systems and processes, and recommends areas for automation or improvement. The ERP Business Analyst is responsible for researching and solving functional issues within the ERP and solving simple to complex business problems related to the use of the ERP and other related systems. This position will help guide development, provide testing and oversee deployment of solutions across multiple functional departments. The ERP Business analyst is also responsible for documenting and training users on new features and upgrades.

What you'll be doing:

Initial point of contact for training and troubleshooting end user issues with Oracle and other corporate software.
Record, document and track user issues through resolution using help desk software.
Leverage team resources to gather requirements for new or enhanced application systems and design any required additions/changes. Ensure timely escalation of issues when issues cannot be resolved using available resources.
Report status, resolution and provide feedback to end users on unresolved issues.
Assist with documentation and implementation of business process improvements.
Create and implement automated distribution of approved reports and process improvements.
Coordinate testing of software updates. Document issues in a timely manner to support “go-live” schedules.
Train staff on new or modified software products and features.
Record, document and track user issues through resolution using help desk software.
Research unfamiliar software features and solutions to user problems.
Assist end users with documentation/specification of business process software improvements and report requests.
Re-engineer ERP software setup and /or process flow to improve efficient usage.
Ensure compliance with corporate IT directives.
Additional responsibilities as requested.
What we're looking for:
Bachelor's Degree in Business, Information Technology or related field.
Eight years’ experience in business, IT or a related position.
3 years’ experience in finance business processes.
Financial analysis and report creation experience a plus.
Knowledge of the application development process, preferably through direct experience.
Strong software problem troubleshooting and resolution skills.
Experience with user training and support.
Working knowledge of application and database design.
Ability to organize and manage multiple priorities with competing deadlines, while demonstrating strong attention to detail and flexibility to adjust schedule as needed.
Experience desired in project management, relational databases and reporting tools.
Excellent documentation, organizational and interpersonal skills.
Strong collaborative skills; experience working with various departments for a common goal.
Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of the organization.
Proficient in MS Office.
Demonstrate enthusiasm and commitment to the job and the company core values.

What we offer:

Health insurance and prescription drug coverage
Dental and Vision insurance
Company-paid life insurance and voluntary life options
Company paid short and long-term disability
Critical illness, accident and hospital indemnity insurance
Flexible spending accounts

Job_title: Managerial - Data and Systems Manager (Tier C) (SY22-23) (Anticipated Vacancy)
Job_description:
Boston Day and Evening Academy (BDEA) is seeking an extraordinary Data and Systems Manager to work in our school. BDEA is an innovative public high school that engages young adults to build a vision for their futures through supportive relationships and meaningful competency-based learning. BDEA students are 16 to 23 years old, having attended traditional schools where they may have felt lost, unsafe, or disengaged. Upon entering BDEA, students remain eager to succeed and flourish because they are listened to and respected for who they are and for the gifts they possess. Working with experienced faculty in an environment that blends strong academics and support, students are given the opportunity to earn a Boston Public Schools diploma and to reach their fullest potential through a competency-based curriculum that inspires critical and creative thinking, independent learning, and active citizenship. As a competency-based school, BDEA does not have grade levels. Our extended program, beginning at 8am and running until 4:30pm serves students with different academic needs up to age 23, including those who are being promoted from middle school without being academically prepared for high school; those who have dropped out of high school and have decided to return to earn a diploma, and those who are unable to attend regular school hours due to health issues, full time work and/or full time parenting obligations. The school employs 60 full and part-time staff to work with 405 students and is governed by an active Board of Trustees. All employees of the school are expected to uphold the mission of the school to build a consistent, unified, anti-racist, inclusive community that stimulates greater student agency, engagement, and academic achievement

The Data and Systems Manager will manage multiple tasks related to the school’s accountability requirements relative to assessments, and data collection, analysis, and reporting. This person will manage BDEA’s unique data infrastructure CONNECTs built on the SalesForce platform. Working collaboratively with the school staff and leadership team, the developer helps to streamline and improve whole school system efficiencies.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:

Systems Development

Develop and manage system infrastructure(s) across various platforms (PowerSchool, Salesforce, and Schoology) to make work more sustainable
Develop API crosswalks and connections from software to software to ensure streamlined computing of benchmarks, scheduling, and attendance
Continually identify new approaches to efficiency while integrating user feedback into improvement practices
Perform new user setup, user maintenance, workflow rules, permission allowances, customizations. reporting and dashboard configurations, data security, and training across various systems
Ensure system sustainability across various platforms, including on-going training, notification of system updates, and documentation of capabilities.

Student Assessments

Collaboratively provide oversight of BDEA’s Systems and Technology Associate to accurately monitor the school’s performance toward state accountability indicators
Ensure accurate rostering and data uploads for each assessment (MCAS, WIDA, and other state assessments)
Order, receive, safeguard, and ship materials
Ensure proper staffing and training of test proctors
Distribute results to staff, students, and families
Monitor and ensures accurate completion and informed use of school-wide data (e.g., student performance, attendance, graduation, and dropout), including required assessment tools for existing and new programs
Use data analysis as a foundation for developing, implementing, and monitoring student achievement and school wide initiatives/decision-making

Data Management

Lead processes for data retrieval and analysis used to inform key staff and programs at BDEA
Understand the priorities of the various school programs and departments and incorporate their needs into a data collection and analyses process
Develop, coordinate, and administer surveys (students, families) to solicit input regarding school climate, attendance, programming, scheduling, safety, health and wellness, etc. in order to identify and address barriers to improving student outcomes, highlight promising practices
Using data from surveys and other databases, identify challenges and successes. This will be an opportunity to help quantitatively define the systemic problems faced by the school and help monitor ongoing efforts to address them
Highlight policy changes or program intervention where necessary

Communications

Report data from surveys and mine data for additional analyses to inform the work of multiple departments and programs
Summarize findings and outcomes in clear and concise reports to be presented to appropriate administrators, board, and staff
Assist Head of School with all Board of Trustees communications and accountability requirements
Performs other related duties as requested by the Head of School

Terms: BPS Managerial Class, Tier C, step based on experience. As a Horace Mann Charter School, employees are paid a competitive salary in accordance with the BPS managerial scale. The position is 223 work days between July 1st and June 30th each year. The employee will be required to adhere to the work conditions, including calendar, schedule and flexibility established by the School. The work schedule will be set by the staff member and the HoS according to school needs. Other benefits include Medical and Dental benefits, eligibility for City of Boston retirement.

Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree or higher, and a minimum of 2 years experience working in data analysis, collection, & reporting.
Experience in program and/or project evaluation; analysis of large, relational databases; excellent written and oral presentation skills.
Familiarity with state and other assessments, quantitative data analyses, programming in SPSS or other statistical packages is an advantage.
Mastery of Excel is required.
Knowledge and comfort in the use of social media (Twitter, Facebook, text messaging)
Have excellent communication and organizational skills; Bilingual Spanish, Creole, other: a strong plus
Acute attention to detail and project completion
Strong and tested ability to participate effectively in teams; have collaborative management style
Passion for coordinating multiple “moving parts” (logistics, schedule, people, etc.)
Ability to work in a fast-paced, challenging environment
Be able to interact with young people and their families in a respectful and caring manner
Adhere to BDEA’s Non-Discrimination Policy (see below)
A sense of humor!

TERMS:

Managerial Tier C

Please refer to www.bostonpublicschools.org/ohc (under "Employee Benefits and Policies") for more information on salary and compensation. Salaries are listed by Unions and Grade/Step.

NOTE: School-based managerial employees will work 223 days between July 1st and June 30th each year. The 223 day work-year will include the 180 days in which school is in session, and the additional days will be determined by the employee and the principal or headmaster of the school. This position subject to the City of Boston residency requirement as well as U.S. citizenship.

School-based managerial employees are not eligible for vacation time or compensatory time. In the event of school cancellation due to snow or inclement weather, school-based managerial employees need not report to work.

The Boston Public Schools, in accordance with its nondiscrimination policies, does not discriminate in its programs, facilities, or employment or educational opportunities on the basis of race, color, age, criminal record (inquiries only), disability, homelessness, sex/gender, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, genetics or military status, and does not tolerate any form of retaliation, or bias-based intimidation, threat or harassment that demeans individuals’ dignity or interferes with their ability to learn or work.Show Less  Report
